targetString: Sin embargo, los jabones antibacterianos contienen agentes antibacterianos comunes, como triclosán, que tiene una extensa lista de cepas de organismos resistentes.
en-mt: However, antibacterial soaps contain common antibacterial agents, such as triclosan, which has an extensive list of resistant strains of organisms.

sourceString: So, even if antibiotic resistant strains aren't selected for by antibacterial soaps, they might not be as effective as they are marketed to be.
targetString: De esta manera, aun si los jabones antibacterianos no preservan las cepas resistentes a los antibióticos, podrían no ser tan eficaces como se promociona.
en-mt: Thus, even if antibacterial soaps don't preserve antibiotic-resistant strains, they might not be as effective as advertised.

sourceString: Besides the surfactant and skin-protecting agent, the sophisticated formulations may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as pH regulator, antimicrobially active benzoic acid and further skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts).A comprehensive analysis from the University of Oregon School of Public Health indicated that plain soaps are as effective as consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps containing triclosan in preventing illness and removing bacteria from the hands.
targetString: Además del agente surfactante y que protege la piel, las sofisticadas fórmulas pueden contener ácidos (ácido acético, ácido ascórbico, ácido láctico) así como regulador del pH, ácido benzoico con actividad antimicrobiana y más acondicionadores para la piel (aloe vera, vitaminas, mentol, extractos vegetales). Un análisis exhaustivo de la Escuela de Salud Pública de la Universidad de Oregon indicó que los jabones comunes son tan eficaces como los jabones antibacterianos para el consumidor que contienen triclosán para prevenir las enfermedades y eliminar las bacterias de las manos.
en-mt: In addition to the surfactant and skin protecting agent, the sophisticated formulas may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as well as pH regulator, benzoic acid with antimicrobial activity and further skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol , vegetable extracts). A comprehensive review by the University of Oregon School of Public Health found that regular soaps are just as effective as antibacterial consumer soaps containing triclosan in preventing illness and killing bacteria on hands.

sourceString: Hot water that is comfortable for washing hands is not hot enough to kill bacteria.
targetString: El agua caliente agradable para lavarse las manos no es suficiente para eliminar las bacterias.
en-mt: Nice hot water for hand washing is not enough to kill bacteria.

sourceString: Bacteria grow much faster at body temperature (37 °C).
targetString: Las bacterias crecen mucho más rápido a temperatura corporal (37 °C).
en-mt: Bacteria grow much faster at body temperature (37°C).

sourceString: However, warm, soapy water is more effective than cold, soapy water at removing natural oils which hold soils and bacteria.
targetString: Sin embargo, el agua jabonosa tibia es más eficaz que el agua jabonosa fría para eliminar los aceites naturales que retienen tierra y bacterias.
en-mt: However, warm soapy water is more effective than cold soapy water in removing natural oils that hold dirt and bacteria.

sourceString: Contrary to popular belief however, scientific studies have shown that using warm water has no effect on reducing the microbial load on hands.
targetString: Sin embargo, contrario a la creencia popular, estudios científicos han demostrado que usar agua tibia no tienen ningún efecto en la reducción de la carga microbiana en las manos.
en-mt: However, contrary to popular belief, scientific studies have shown that using warm water has no effect on reducing the microbial load on the hands.

sourceString: A hand sanitizer or hand antiseptic is a non-water-based hand hygiene agent.
targetString: Un desinfectante para manos o antiséptico para manos es un agente sin agua para la higiene de las manos.
en-mt: A hand sanitizer or hand antiseptic is a waterless agent for hand hygiene.

sourceString: In the late 1990s and early part of the 21st century, alcohol rub non-water-based hand hygiene agents (also known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) began to gain popularity.
targetString: A finales de 1990 y en la primera parte del siglo XXI, los agentes para la higiene de las manos sin agua y con alcohol para frotar (también conocidos como solución para manos a base de alcohol para frotar, solución antiséptica para manos para frotar o desinfectantes para manos) comenzaron a adquirir popularidad.
en-mt: In the late 1990s and into the early part of the 21st century, waterless and alcohol-based hand hygiene rubs (also known as alcohol-based hand rub, antiseptic hand rub, or sanitizers for hands) began to gain popularity.

sourceString: Most are based on isopropyl alcohol or ethanol formulated together with a thickening agent such as Carbomer (polymer of acrylic acid) into a gel, or a humectant such as glycerin into a liquid, or foam for ease of use and to decrease the drying effect of the alcohol.
targetString: La mayoría se basa en alcohol isopropílico o etanol formulado con un agente espesante como carbómero (polímero de ácido acrílico) en un gel, o un humectante como glicerina en un líquido, o espuma para un uso fácil y para reducir el efecto de resequedad del alcohol.
en-mt: Most are based on isopropyl alcohol or ethanol formulated with a thickening agent such as carbomer (acrylic acid polymer) in a gel, or a humectant such as glycerin in a liquid, or foam for ease of use and to reduce the drying effect of alcohol. .

sourceString: Adding diluted hydrogen-peroxide increases further  the antimicrobial activity.Hand sanitizers containing a minimum of 60 to 95% alcohol are efficient germ killers.
targetString: Agregar peróxido de hidrógeno diluido aumenta aún más la actividad antimicrobiana. Los desinfectantes para manos que contienen entre 60 y 95 % de alcohol como mínimo eliminan los gérmenes eficazmente.
en-mt: Adding diluted hydrogen peroxide further increases antimicrobial activity. Hand sanitizers that contain at least 60-95% alcohol kill germs effectively.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers kill bacteria, multi-drug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.
targetString: Los desinfectantes a base de alcohol para frotar eliminan las bacterias, las bacterias resistentes a varios medicamentos (SARM y ERV), de la tuberculosis y algunos virus (incluidos VIH, herpes, VSR, rinovirus, vaccinia, influenza y hepatitis) y hongos.
en-mt: Alcohol-based disinfectant rubs kill bacteria, multidrug-resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of the bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of the bacteria on hands 1 minute after application.Hand sanitizers are most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.
targetString: Los desinfectantes a base de alcohol para frotar que contienen un 70 % de alcohol eliminan el 99,97 % (reducción de 3,5 logaritmos, similar a la reducción de 35 decibeles) de las bacterias en las manos 30 segundos después de la aplicación y del 99,99 % al 99,999 % (reducción de 4 a 5 logaritmos) de las bacterias en las manos 1 minuto después de la aplicación. Los desinfectantes para manos son más eficaces contra las bacterias y menos eficaces contra algunos virus.
en-mt: Alcohol-based rubs containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of bacteria on hands within 30 seconds of application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of bacteria on hands 1 minute after application. Hand sanitizers are more effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost entirely ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) type viruses, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis.Enough hand antiseptic or alcohol rub must be used to thoroughly wet or cover both hands.
targetString: Los desinfectantes para manos a base de alcohol son prácticamente ineficaces contra los virus tipo norovirus (o Norwalk), la causa más frecuente de la gastroenteritis contagiosa. Se debe usar suficiente solución para manos antiséptica o a base de alcohol para frotar, como para humedecer o cubrir por completo ambas manos.
en-mt: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are virtually ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) viruses, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis. Enough antiseptic or alcohol-based hand rub should be used to moisten or completely cover both hands.

sourceString: The front and back of both hands and between and the ends of all fingers are rubbed for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.
targetString: La palma y el dorso de ambas manos, entre los dedos y los extremos de todos los dedos se frotan durante aproximadamente 30 segundos hasta que el líquido, la espuma o el gel se sequen.
en-mt: The palm and back of both hands, between the fingers, and the ends of all fingers are rubbed together for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam, or gel is dry.

sourceString: Finger tips must be washed well too, rubbing them in both palms.The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing over hand sanitizer rubs, particularly when hands are visibly dirty.
targetString: Las puntas de los dedos también se deben lavar bien, frotándolas en ambas palmas. Los Centros para el Control y la Prevención de Enfermedades de los Estados Unidos recomiendan el lavado de manos antes que los desinfectantes para manos para frotar, especialmente cuando las manos están visiblemente sucias.
en-mt: The tips of the fingers should also be washed well, rubbing them on both palms. The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing before hand rubs, especially when hands are visibly dirty.

sourceString: The increasing use of these agents is based on their ease of use and rapid killing activity against micro-organisms; however, they should not serve as a replacement for proper hand washing unless soap and water are unavailable.
targetString: El aumento del uso de estos agentes se basa en su facilidad de uso y en la rápida actividad de eliminación de microorganismos; sin embargo, no deben utilizarse como reemplazo del lavado adecuado de manos salvo que no se disponga de agua ni jabón.
en-mt: The increased use of these agents is based on their ease of use and rapid microorganism killing activity; however, they should not be used as a substitute for proper hand washing unless soap and water are not available.

sourceString: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can cause dry skin unless emollients and/or skin moisturizers are added to the formula.
targetString: El uso frecuente de los desinfectantes para manos a base de alcohol puede resecar la piel, salvo que se agreguen emolientes o hidratantes para la piel a la fórmula.
en-mt: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can dry out the skin, unless emollients or skin moisturizers are added to the formula.

sourceString: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin and/or other emollients to the formula.
targetString: El efecto de sequedad del alcohol se puede reducir o eliminar agregando glicerina u otros emolientes a la fórmula.
en-mt: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin or other emollients to the formula.

sourceString: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing emollients caused substantially less skin irritation and dryness than soaps or antimicrobial detergents.
targetString: En los ensayos clínicos, los desinfectantes para manos a base de alcohol que contienen emolientes causaron una irritación y sequedad de la piel considerablemente menores que los jabones o detergentes antimicrobianos.
en-mt: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand rubs containing emollients caused significantly less skin irritation and dryness than antimicrobial soaps or detergents.

sourceString: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives present in alcohol hand rubs rarely occur.
targetString: La dermatitis alérgica por contacto, el síndrome de urticaria por contacto o la hipersensibilidad al alcohol o los aditivos presentes en las soluciones para manos a base de alcohol para frotar son muy poco frecuentes.
en-mt: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome, or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives in alcohol-based hand rubs are very rare.

sourceString: The lower tendency to induce irritant contact dermatitis became an attraction as compared to soap and water hand washing.
targetString: La menor tendencia a provocar dermatitis irritante por contacto resultó atractiva en comparación con el lavado de manos con agua y jabón.
en-mt: The lower tendency to cause irritant contact dermatitis was attractive compared to handwashing with soap and water.

sourceString: Despite their effectiveness, non-water agents do not cleanse the hands of organic material, but simply disinfect them.
targetString: A pesar de su eficacia, los agentes sin agua no eliminan la materia orgánica de las manos, sino que, simplemente, las desinfectan.
en-mt: Despite their effectiveness, waterless agents do not remove organic matter from hands, but simply disinfect them.

sourceString: It is for this reason that hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water at preventing the spread of many pathogens, since the pathogens still remain on the hands.
targetString: Por este motivo, los desinfectantes para manos no son tan eficaces como el agua y el jabón para prevenir la propagación de muchos patógenos, ya que los patógenos siguen quedando en las manos.
en-mt: For this reason, hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water in preventing the spread of many pathogens, since the pathogens remain on the hands.

sourceString: Alcohol-free hand sanitizer efficacy is heavily dependent on the ingredients and formulation, and historically has significantly under-performed alcohol and alcohol rubs.
targetString: La eficacia de los desinfectantes para manos sin alcohol depende en gran medida de los ingredientes y la fórmula, además, históricamente, ha sido mucho menor que la del alcohol y las soluciones a base de alcohol para frotar.
en-mt: The effectiveness of non-alcoholic hand sanitizers is highly dependent on the ingredients and formula, and has historically been much lower than that of alcohol and alcohol-based rubbing solutions.

sourceString: More recently, formulations that use benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have persistent and cumulative antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, which has been shown to decrease in efficacy after repeated use, probably due to progressive adverse skin reactions.
targetString: Más recientemente, se ha comprobado que las fórmulas que usan cloruro de benzalconio tienen una actividad antimicrobiana persistente y acumulativa después de la aplicación, a diferencia del alcohol, cuya eficacia disminuye después del uso repetido, probablemente debido a las reacciones adversas progresivas de la piel.
en-mt: More recently, formulations using benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have persistent and cumulative antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, whose efficacy diminishes after repeated use, likely due to progressive adverse skin reactions.

sourceString: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.
targetString: Muchas personas en comunidades de bajos ingresos no pueden comprar jabón y utilizan en cambio cenizas o tierra.
en-mt: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or dirt instead.

sourceString: Ash or soil may be more effective than water alone, but may be less effective than soap.
targetString: Las cenizas o la tierra pueden ser más eficaces que el agua sola, pero menos eficaces que el jabón.
en-mt: Ashes or dirt may be more effective than plain water, but less effective than soap.

sourceString: One concern is that if the soil or ash is contaminated with microorganisms it may increase the spread of disease rather than decrease it.
targetString: Una preocupación es que, si la tierra o las cenizas están contaminadas con microorganismos, esto puede aumentar la propagación de enfermedades en lugar de disminuirla.
en-mt: One concern is that if soil or ash is contaminated with microorganisms, this may increase the spread of disease rather than decrease it.

sourceString: Like soap, ash is also a disinfecting agent because in contact with water, it forms an alkaline solution.
targetString: Al igual que el jabón, la ceniza también es un agente desinfectante, ya que, en contacto con agua, forma una solución alcalina.
en-mt: Like soap, ash is also a disinfectant agent, since, in contact with water, it forms an alkaline solution.

sourceString: WHO recommended ash or sand as alternative to soap when soap is not available.
targetString: La OMS recomendó usar ceniza o arena como una alternativa al jabón cuando no se dispone de jabón.
en-mt: The WHO recommended using ash or sand as an alternative to soap when soap is not available.

sourceString: Correct handwashing technique recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control  for prevention of transmission of disease includes the following steps:
targetString: La técnica correcta de lavado de manos recomendada por los Centros para el Control y la Prevención de Enfermedades de los Estados Unidos para prevenir la transmisión de enfermedades incluye los siguientes pasos:
en-mt: The correct hand washing technique recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to prevent disease transmission includes the following steps:

sourceString: Wet hands with warm or cold running water.
targetString: Mojarse las manos con agua corriente tibia o fría.
en-mt: Wet your hands with lukewarm or cold running water.

sourceString: Running water is recommended because standing basins may be contaminated, while the temperature of the water does not seem to make a difference.
targetString: Se recomienda el agua corriente porque los recipientes con agua estancada pueden estar contaminados, mientras que la temperatura del agua al parecer no hace ninguna diferencia.
en-mt: Tap water is recommended because containers of standing water may be contaminated, while the temperature of the water does not appear to make any difference.

sourceString: Lather hands by rubbing them with a generous amount of soap, including the backs of hands, between fingers, and under nails.
targetString: Frotarse las manos para formar espuma con una cantidad generosa de jabón, incluidos los dorsos de las manos, entre los dedos y debajo de las uñas.
en-mt: Rub a generous amount of soap into your hands, including the backs of your hands, between your fingers, and under your fingernails.

sourceString: Soap lifts germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when soap is used rather than water alone.
targetString: El jabón quita los gérmenes de la piel, y los estudios indican que las personas suelen lavarse las manos más minuciosamente cuando usan jabón que cuando usan agua sola.
en-mt: Soap washes germs off the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when using soap than when using plain water.

sourceString: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: Restregar durante al menos 20 segundos.
en-mt: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.

sourceString: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from skin, and scrubbing for longer periods removes more germs.
targetString: Restregar crea fricción, lo que ayuda a eliminar los gérmenes de la piel, y restregar durante períodos más prolongados elimina más gérmenes.
en-mt: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from the skin, and scrubbing for longer periods removes more germs.

sourceString: Rinse well under running water.
targetString: Enjuagar bien con agua corriente.
en-mt: Rinse well under running water.

sourceString: Rinsing in a basin can recontaminate hands.
targetString: Enjuagar en un recipiente puede volver a contaminar las manos.
en-mt: Rinsing in a container can recontaminate hands.

sourceString: Dry with a clean towel or allow to air dry.
targetString: Secar con una toalla limpia o dejar secar al aire.
en-mt: Pat dry with a clean towel or allow to air dry.

sourceString: Wet and moist hands are more easily recontaminated.The most commonly missed areas are the thumb, the wrist, the areas between the fingers, and under fingernails.
targetString: Las manos húmedas y mojadas se vuelven a contaminar con más facilidad. Las partes que se olvidan con más frecuencia son el pulgar, la muñeca, las áreas entre los dedos y debajo de las uñas
en-mt: Damp and wet hands are more easily contaminated again. The parts that are most often forgotten are the thumb, the wrist, the areas between the fingers and under the nails.

sourceString: Artificial nails and chipped nail polish may harbor microorganisms.
targetString: Las uñas artificiales y el esmalte de uñas descascarado pueden albergar microorganismos.
en-mt: Artificial nails and chipped nail polish can harbor microorganisms.

sourceString: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to keep the hands from drying out; dry skin can lead to skin damage which can increase the risk for the transmission of infection.
targetString: Con frecuencia, se recomienda loción humectante para evitar que las manos se resequen; la piel seca puede provocar daños cutáneos que pueden aumentar el riesgo de transmisión de infecciones.
en-mt: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to prevent hands from drying out; dry skin can cause skin damage that can increase the risk of infection transmission.

sourceString: Various low-cost options can be made to facilitate hand washing where tap-water and/or soap is not available e.g. pouring water from a hanging jerrycan or gourd with suitable holes and/or using ash if needed in developing countries.In situations with limited water supply (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-conserving solutions, such as "tippy-taps" and other low-cost options.
targetString: Se pueden utilizar varias opciones económicas para facilitar el lavado de manos cuando no se dispone de agua corriente ni jabón, por ejemplo, verter agua desde un bidón colgado o una calabaza con orificios apropiados o usar ceniza si es necesario en los países en desarrollo. En las situaciones en las que hay un suministro de agua limitado (como escuelas o áreas rurales en los países en desarrollo), hay soluciones para ahorrar agua, como "grifos caseros" y otras opciones económicas.
en-mt: Various inexpensive options can be used to facilitate hand washing when running water and soap are not available, for example pouring water from a hanging jerry can or gourd with appropriate holes or using ash if necessary in developing countries. In situations where there is limited water supply (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-saving solutions such as "home taps" and other inexpensive options.

sourceString: A tippy-tap is a simple technology using a jug suspended by a rope, and a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water over the hands and a bar of soap.
targetString: Un grifo casero es una tecnología simple que consiste en utilizar una jarra suspendida de una soga y una palanca accionada con el pie para verter una pequeña cantidad de agua sobre las manos y un jabón en barra.
en-mt: A home faucet is a simple technology that involves using a jug suspended from a rope and a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water over your hands and a bar of soap.

sourceString: Effective drying of the hands is an essential part of the hand hygiene process, but there is some debate over the most effective form of drying in public washrooms.
targetString: El secado eficaz de las manos es una parte esencial del proceso de higiene de las manos, pero existe cierto debate acerca de la forma de secado más eficaz en los baños públicos.
en-mt: Effective hand drying is an essential part of the hand hygiene process, but there is some debate about the most effective way of drying in public restrooms.

sourceString: A growing volume of research suggests paper towels are much more hygienic than the electric hand dryers found in many washrooms.
targetString: Cada vez son más las investigaciones que señalan que las toallas de papel son mucho más higiénicas que los secadores de manos eléctricos que se encuentran en muchos baños.
en-mt: A growing body of research indicates that paper towels are much more sanitary than the electric hand dryers found in many restrooms.

sourceString: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the paper-towel industry the European Tissue Symposium, to compare the levels of hygiene offered by paper towels, warm-air hand dryers and the more modern jet-air hand dryers.
targetString: En 2008, la Universidad de Westminster, Londres, realizó un estudio, patrocinado por la asociación de la industria de toallas de papel European Tissue Symposium, para comparar los niveles de higiene ofrecidos por las toallas de papel, los secadores de manos de aire caliente y los secadores de manos por chorro de aire más modernos.
en-mt: In 2008, the University of Westminster, London, conducted a study, sponsored by the European Tissue Symposium paper towel industry association, to compare the levels of hygiene offered by paper towels, hot air hand dryers and the most modern air jet hand dryers.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with the warm-air dryer, the total number of bacteria was found to increase on average on the finger pads by 194% and on the palms by 254%.
targetString: Después de lavarse y secarse las manos con el secador de aire caliente, se detectó que la cantidad total de bacterias aumentó, en promedio, un 194 % en las yemas de los dedos y un 254 % en las palmas.
en-mt: After washing and drying hands with the hot air dryer, the total number of bacteria was found to increase by an average of 194% on the fingertips and 254% on the palms.

sourceString: Drying with the jet-air dryer resulted in an increase on average of the total number of bacteria on the finger pads by 42% and on the palms by 15%.
targetString: Secarse con el secador por chorro de aire dio como resultado un aumento promedio de la cantidad total de bacterias del 42 % en las yemas de los dedos y del 15 % en las palmas.
en-mt: Drying with the air jet dryer resulted in an average increase in the total number of bacteria of 42% on the fingertips and 15% on the palms.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with a paper towel, the total number of bacteria was reduced on average on the finger pads by up to 76% and on the palms by up to 77%.The scientists also carried out tests to establish whether there was the potential for cross contamination of other washroom users and the washroom environment as a result of each type of drying method.
targetString: Después de lavarse y secarse las manos con una toalla de papel, la cantidad total de bacterias disminuyó, en promedio, un 76 % en las yemas de los dedos y un 77 % en las palmas. Los científicos también realizaron pruebas para determinar si existía la posibilidad de contaminación cruzada de otros usuarios del baño y del entorno del baño como resultado de cada tipo de método de secado.
en-mt: After washing and drying hands with a paper towel, the total number of bacteria decreased by an average of 76% on the fingertips and 77% on the palms. The scientists also conducted tests to determine if there was a potential for cross-contamination from other bath users and the bath environment as a result of each type of drying method.

sourceString: The jet-air dryer, which blows air out of the unit at claimed speeds of 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), was capable of blowing micro-organisms from the hands and the unit and potentially contaminating other washroom users and the washroom environment up to 2 metres away.
targetString: El secador por chorro de aire, que sopla aire desde la unidad a velocidades, según se afirma, de 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), logró soplar los microorganismos de las manos y la unidad y, potencialmente, contaminar a otros usuarios del baño y el entorno del baño a una distancia de hasta 2 metros.
en-mt: The air jet dryer, which blows air from the unit at speeds of a claimed 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), succeeded in blowing the microorganisms off the hands and unit and potentially contaminating to other bathroom users and the bathroom environment at a distance of up to 2 metres.

sourceString: Use of a warm-air hand dryer spread micro-organisms up to 0.25 metres from the dryer.
targetString: El uso de un secador de manos de aire caliente propagó los microorganismos hasta 0,25 metros de distancia del secador.
en-mt: The use of a hot air hand dryer spread the microorganisms up to 0.25 meters away from the dryer.

sourceString: Paper towels showed no significant spread of micro-organisms.In 2005, in a study conducted by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different hand drying methods were evaluated.
targetString: Las toallas de papel no mostraron una propagación significativa de microorganismos. En 2005, en un estudio realizado por TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, se evaluaron diferentes métodos de secado de manos.
en-mt: Paper towels did not show significant spread of microorganisms. In 2005, in a study carried out by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different hand drying methods were evaluated.

sourceString: The following changes in the bacterial count after drying the hands were observed:
targetString: Se observaron los siguientes cambios en el recuento de bacterias después del secado de manos:
en-mt: The following changes in bacterial counts were observed after hand drying:

sourceString: Many different hand dryer manufacturers exist, and hand driers have been compared against drying with paper towels.
targetString: Existen muchos fabricantes de secadores de manos diferentes, y los secadores de manos se han comparado con el secado con toallas de papel.
en-mt: There are many different manufacturers of hand dryers, and hand dryers have been compared to drying with paper towels.

sourceString: Hand washing using hand sanitizing wipes is an alternative during traveling in the absence of soap and water.
targetString: Lavarse las manos con toallitas desinfectantes para manos es una alternativa durante los viajes, cuando no se tiene agua ni jabón.
en-mt: Washing your hands with hand sanitizing wipes is an alternative during travel when soap and water are not available.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer should contain at least 60% alcohol.
targetString: El desinfectante para manos a base de alcohol debe contener al menos un 60 % de alcohol.
en-mt: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer must contain at least 60% alcohol.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in a hospital environment.
targetString: El lavado de manos de los médicos se volvió obligatorio mucho después de que el médico húngaro Ignaz Semmelweis descubriera su eficacia (en 1846) para la prevención de enfermedades en un entorno hospitalario.
en-mt: Handwashing by doctors became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its efficacy (in 1846) for disease prevention in a hospital setting.

sourceString: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.
targetString: Hay dispositivos electrónicos que proporcionan comentarios para recordarles a los miembros del personal del hospital que se laven las manos cuando se olvidan.
en-mt: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital staff members to wash their hands when they forget.

sourceString: One study has found decreased infection rates with their use.
targetString: Un estudio comprobó una disminución de las tasas de infección con su uso.
en-mt: One study found a decrease in infection rates with its use.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing is for a minimum of 15 seconds, using generous amounts of soap and water or gel to lather and rub each part of the hands.
targetString: El lavado de manos de los médicos se hace por lo menos durante 15 segundos, con abundante cantidad de agua y jabón o gel para formar espuma y restregar todas las partes de las manos.
en-mt: Hand washing by doctors is done for at least 15 seconds, with copious amounts of water and soap or gel to form a foam and scrub all parts of the hands.

sourceString: Hands should be rubbed together with digits interlocking.
targetString: Las manos deben restregarse juntas entrelazando los dedos.
en-mt: The hands should be rubbed together interlocking the fingers.

sourceString: If there is debris under fingernails, a bristle brush may be used to remove it.
targetString: Si hay restos debajo de las uñas, se puede usar un cepillo de cerdas para quitarlos.
en-mt: If there is debris under the nails, a bristle brush can be used to remove it.

sourceString: Since germs may remain in the water on the hands, it is important to rinse well and wipe dry with a clean towel.
targetString: Dado que los gérmenes pueden permanecer en el agua en las manos, es importante enjuagarlas bien y secarlas con una toalla limpia.
en-mt: Since germs can stay in the water on your hands, it's important to rinse your hands well and dry them with a clean towel.

sourceString: After drying, the paper towel should be used to turn off the water (and open any exit door if necessary).
targetString: Después del secado, se debe usar la toalla de papel para cerrar el agua (y abrir cualquier puerta de salida si fuera necesario).
en-mt: After drying, the paper towel should be used to turn off the water (and open any exit doors if necessary).

sourceString: This avoids re-contaminating the hands from those surfaces.
targetString: Esto evita que las manos vuelvan a contaminarse por esas superficies.
en-mt: This prevents hands from being recontaminated by those surfaces.

sourceString: The purpose of hand-washing in the health-care setting is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmitting them.
targetString: El propósito del lavado de manos en el entorno de atención médica es eliminar los microorganismos patógenos ("gérmenes") y evitar transmitirlos.
en-mt: The purpose of handwashing in the healthcare setting is to kill pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and prevent transmission.

sourceString: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments, with large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.
targetString: Según New England Journal of Medicine, la falta de lavado de manos sigue existiendo a niveles inaceptables en la mayoría de los entornos médicos, donde muchos médicos y enfermeros habitualmente se olvidan de lavarse las manos antes de tocar a los pacientes y, de esta manera, transmiten microorganismos.
en-mt: According to the New England Journal of Medicine, handwashing failure continues to exist at unacceptable levels in most medical settings, where many doctors and nurses routinely forget to wash their hands before touching patients, thereby transmit microorganisms.

sourceString: One study showed that proper hand-washing and other simple procedures can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66 percent.The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard hand-washing and hand-rubbing in health-care sectors.
targetString: Un estudio demostró que el lavado correcto de las manos y otros procedimientos simples pueden disminuir la tasa de infecciones del torrente sanguíneo relacionadas con catéter en un 66 %. La Organización Mundial de la Salud ha publicado una hoja en la que se demuestra el lavado de manos y el frotamiento de manos estándar en los sectores de la atención médica.
en-mt: One study showed that proper hand washing and other simple procedures can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66%. The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard handwashing and handrubbing in healthcare sectors.

sourceString: The draft guidance of hand hygiene by the organization can also be found at its website for public comment.
targetString: La versión preliminar de la guía para la higiene de manos de la organización se puede encontrar también en su sitio web para que el público pueda hacer comentarios.
en-mt: The organization's draft hand hygiene guidance can also be found on its website for public comment.

sourceString: A relevant review was conducted by Whitby et al.
targetString: Whitby y otros llevaron a cabo una revisión relevante.
en-mt: Whitby et al carried out a relevant review.

sourceString: Commercial devices can measure and validate hand hygiene, if demonstration of regulatory compliance is required.
targetString: Los dispositivos comerciales pueden medir y verificar la higiene de las manos, si se requiere la demostración del cumplimiento normativo.
en-mt: Commercial devices can measure and verify hand hygiene, if demonstration of regulatory compliance is required.

sourceString: The World Health Organization has "Five Moments" for washing hands:
targetString: La Organización Mundial de la Salud tiene "Cinco momentos" para el lavado de manos:
en-mt: The World Health Organization has "Five Moments" for handwashing:

sourceString: after exposure to blood/body fluids
targetString: después de la exposición a sangre o líquidos corporales
en-mt: after exposure to blood or body fluids

sourceString: before an aseptic task, and
targetString: antes de un trabajo aséptico y
en-mt: before aseptic work and

sourceString: after patient care.The addition of antiseptic chemicals to soap ("medicated" or "antimicrobial" soaps) confers killing action to a hand-washing agent.
targetString: después de atender a pacientes. El agregado de productos químicos antisépticos en el jabón (jabones "medicinales" o "antibacterianos") le confiere la posibilidad de eliminación al agente de lavado de manos.
en-mt: after caring for patients. The addition of antiseptic chemicals to the soap ("medicated" or "antibacterial" soaps) gives the hand washing agent the possibility of removal.

sourceString: Such killing action may be desired prior to performing surgery or in settings in which antibiotic-resistant organisms are highly prevalent.To 'scrub' one's hands for a surgical operation, it is necessary to have a tap that can be turned on and off without touching it with the hands, some chlorhexidine or iodine wash, sterile towels for drying the hands after washing, and a sterile brush for scrubbing and another sterile instrument for cleaning under the fingernails.
targetString: Esta eliminación puede ser necesaria antes de una cirugía o en entornos en los que son muy frecuentes los organismos resistentes a los antibióticos. Para lavarse las manos antes de una operación quirúrgica, es necesario contar con un grifo que se pueda abrir y cerrar sin tocarlo con las manos, un poco de clorhexidina o yodo para el lavado, toallas esterilizadas para secarse las manos después del lavado, un cepillo esterilizado para fregarse y otro instrumento esterilizado para limpiarse debajo de las uñas.
en-mt: This removal may be necessary prior to surgery or in settings where antibiotic-resistant organisms are highly prevalent. To wash your hands before a surgical operation, it is necessary to have a faucet that can be opened and closed without touching it with your hands, a little chlorhexidine or iodine for washing, sterilized towels to dry your hands after washing, a brush sterilized instrument for scrubbing and another sterilized instrument for cleaning under the fingernails.

sourceString: All jewelry should be removed.
targetString: Se deben quitar todas las joyas.
en-mt: All jewelry must be removed.

sourceString: This procedure requires washing the hands and forearms up to the elbow, usually 2–6 minutes.
targetString: Este procedimiento requiere lavarse las manos y los antebrazos hasta el codo, en general, durante 2 a 6 minutos.
en-mt: This procedure requires washing hands and forearms up to the elbow, typically for 2 to 6 minutes.

sourceString: Long scrub-times (10 minutes) are not necessary.
targetString: No es necesario lavarse durante mucho tiempo (10 minutos).
en-mt: No need to wash for a long time (10 minutes).

sourceString: When rinsing, water on the forearms must be prevented from running back to the hands.
targetString: Al enjuagarse, se debe evitar que el agua de los antebrazos regrese a las manos.
en-mt: When rinsing, water from the forearms must be prevented from returning to the hands.

sourceString: After hand-washing is completed, the hands are dried with a sterile cloth and a surgical gown is donned.
targetString: Después del lavado, las manos se secan con un paño esterilizado y se coloca una bata quirúrgica.
en-mt: After washing, the hands are dried with a sterile cloth and a surgical gown is donned.

sourceString: To reduce the spread of germs, it is better to wash the hands or use a hand antiseptic before and after tending to a sick person.
targetString: Para reducir la propagación de gérmenes, es mejor lavarse las manos o usar un antiséptico para manos antes y después de atender a personas enfermas.
en-mt: To reduce the spread of germs, it's best to wash your hands or use a hand sanitizer before and after caring for sick people.

sourceString: For control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it has been found that the greatest benefit from hand-cleansing came from the first 20% of washing, and that very little additional benefit was gained when hand cleansing frequency was increased beyond 35%.
targetString: Para controlar las infecciones causadas por estafilococos en hospitales, se ha comprobado que el mayor beneficio de la limpieza de manos está en el primer 20 % del lavado y que se obtiene muy poco beneficio adicional cuando la frecuencia de la higiene de manos aumenta más del 35 %.
en-mt: To control staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it has been shown that the greatest benefit of hand hygiene is in the first 20% of washing, with very little additional benefit when the frequency of hand hygiene is increased more than 35%. %.

sourceString: Washing with plain soap results in more than triple the rate of bacterial infectious disease transmitted to food as compared to washing with antibacterial soap.Comparing hand-rubbing with alcohol-based solution with hand washing with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.
targetString: El lavado con jabón común da como resultado más del triple de incidencia de infecciones bacterianas transmitidas a alimentos en comparación con el lavado con jabón antibacteriano. Al comparar el lavado de manos con una solución a base de alcohol con el lavado de manos con un jabón antibacteriano durante un tiempo promedio de 30 segundos en cada caso, se observó que el frotado con alcohol redujo un 26 % más la contaminación de bacterias que el jabón antibacteriano.
en-mt: Washing with plain soap results in more than three times the incidence of foodborne bacterial infections compared to washing with antibacterial soap. When comparing handwashing with an alcohol-based handrub to handwashing with an antibacterial soap for an average of 30 seconds each, alcohol rubbing reduced bacterial contamination by 26 percent more than antibacterial soap.

sourceString: But soap and water is more effective than alcohol-based hand rubs for reducing H1N1 influenza A virus and Clostridium difficile spores from hands.Interventions to improve hand hygiene in healthcare settings can involve education for staff on hand washing, increasing the availability of alcohol-based hand rub, and written and verbal reminders to staff.
targetString: Sin embargo, el agua y el jabón son más eficaces para reducir el virus de la gripe A H1N1 y las esporas de Clostridium difficile de las manos que los desinfectantes para manos a base de alcohol. Las intervenciones para mejorar la higiene de las manos en centros de atención de la salud pueden incluir capacitar al personal sobre el lavado de manos, aumentar la disponibilidad de desinfectante para manos a base de alcohol y recordatorios escritos y orales al personal.
en-mt: However, soap and water are more effective at reducing the H1N1 influenza A virus and Clostridium difficile spores from hands than alcohol-based hand sanitizers. Interventions to improve hand hygiene in health care settings may include training staff on handwashing, increasing the availability of alcohol-based hand rub, and written and oral reminders to staff.

sourceString: There is a need for more research into which of these interventions are most effective in different healthcare settings.
targetString: Es necesario investigar más sobre cuáles de estas intervenciones son las más eficaces en los distintos entornos de atención de la salud.
en-mt: More research is needed on which of these interventions are most effective in different health care settings.

sourceString: In developing countries, hand washing with soap is recognized as a cost-effective, essential tool for achieving good health, and even good nutrition.
targetString: En los países en desarrollo, se considera que el lavado de manos con jabón es una herramienta económica y fundamental para lograr una buena salud e incluso una buena alimentación.
en-mt: In developing countries, handwashing with soap is considered an inexpensive and essential tool for achieving good health and even good nutrition.

sourceString: However, a lack of reliable water supply, soap or hand washing facilities in people's homes, at schools and at the workplace make it a challenge to achieve universal hand washing behaviors.
targetString: Sin embargo, la falta de un suministro confiable de agua, jabón o instalaciones para lavarse las manos en los hogares, las escuelas y los lugares de trabajo, hace que sea un desafío lograr conductas universales de lavado de manos.
en-mt: However, the lack of a reliable supply of water, soap, or handwashing facilities in homes, schools, and workplaces makes achieving universal handwashing behaviors challenging.

sourceString: For example, in most of rural Africa hand washing taps close to every private or public toilet are scarce, even though cheap options exist to build hand washing stations.
targetString: Por ejemplo, en la mayor parte de las zonas rurales de África, hay muy pocos grifos para lavarse las manos cerca de retretes públicos o privados, aunque existen opciones económicas para construir estaciones de lavado de manos.
en-mt: For example, in most rural areas of Africa, there are very few handwashing faucets near public or private toilets, although there are inexpensive options for building handwashing stations.

sourceString: However, low hand washing rates rather can also be the result of engrained habits rather than due to a lack of soap or water.
targetString: Sin embargo, las bajas tasas de lavado de manos también pueden ser el resultado de hábitos arraigados y no de la falta de jabón o agua.
en-mt: However, low handwashing rates may also be the result of ingrained habits and not a lack of soap or water.

sourceString: The promotion and advocacy of hand washing with soap can influence policy decisions, raise awareness about the benefits of hand washing and lead to long-term behavior change of the population.
targetString: La promoción del lavado de manos con jabón puede influir en las decisiones políticas, aumentar la conciencia sobre los beneficios del lavado de manos y provocar un cambio de comportamiento en la población a largo plazo.
en-mt: The promotion of handwashing with soap can influence political decisions, increase awareness of the benefits of handwashing and cause behavior change in the population in the long term.

sourceString: For this to work effectively, monitoring and evaluation are necessary.
targetString: Para que esto funcione de manera eficaz, es necesario hacer un seguimiento y evaluar.
en-mt: For this to work effectively, it is necessary to monitor and evaluate.

sourceString: A systematic review of 70 studies found that community-based approaches are effective at increasing hand washing in LMICs, while social marketing campaigns are less effective.One example for hand washing promotion in schools is the "Three Star Approach" by UNICEF that encourages schools to take simple, inexpensive steps to ensure that students wash their hands with soap, among other hygienic requirements.
targetString: En una revisión sistemática de 70 estudios, se observó que los enfoques comunitarios son eficaces para aumentar el lavado de manos en los PRBM, mientras que las campañas de marketing social son menos eficaces. Un ejemplo de promoción del lavado de manos en las escuelas es el enfoque "Tres estrellas" de UNICEF, que alienta a las escuelas a tomar medidas simples y económicas para garantizar que los estudiantes se laven las manos con jabón, entre otros requisitos de higiene.
en-mt: In a systematic review of 70 studies, community-based approaches were found to be effective in increasing LICs handwashing, while social marketing campaigns were less effective. An example of promoting handwashing in schools is UNICEF's "Three Star" approach, which encourages schools to take simple and inexpensive steps to ensure that students wash their hands with soap, among other hygiene requirements.

sourceString: When minimum standards are achieved, schools can move from one to ultimately three stars.
targetString: Cuando se alcanzan los estándares mínimos, las escuelas pueden pasar de una a, finalmente, tres estrellas.
en-mt: When minimum standards are met, schools can go from one to eventually three stars.

sourceString: Building hand washing stations can be a part of hand washing promotion campaigns that are carried out in order to reduce diseases and child mortality.
targetString: La construcción de estaciones de lavado de manos puede formar parte de las campañas de promoción del lavado de manos que se llevan adelante para disminuir las enfermedades y la mortalidad infantil.
en-mt: The construction of handwashing stations can be part of the campaigns to promote handwashing that are carried out to reduce illnesses and infant mortality.

sourceString: Global Hand washing Day is another example of an awareness-raising campaign that is trying to achieve behavior change.As a result of the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, UNICEF promoted the adoption of a handwashing emoji.
targetString: El Día Mundial del Lavado de Manos es otro ejemplo de campaña de concientización que trata de lograr un cambio de comportamiento. Como consecuencia de la pandemia de coronavirus 2019-2020, UNICEF impulsó la creación de un emoji para el lavado de manos.
en-mt: Global Handwashing Day is another example of an awareness campaign that tries to achieve behavior change. As a consequence of the 2019-2020 coronavirus pandemic, UNICEF promoted the creation of an emoji for hand washing.

sourceString: Few studies have considered the overall cost effectiveness of hand washing in developing countries in relationship to DALYs averted.
targetString: Pocos estudios han considerado la rentabilidad general del lavado de manos en los países en desarrollo en relación con los AVAD evitados.
en-mt: Few studies have considered the overall cost-effectiveness of handwashing in developing countries in relation to DALYs averted.

sourceString: However, one review suggests that promoting hand washing with soap is significantly more cost-effective than other water and sanitation interventions.
targetString: Sin embargo, un análisis indica que promover el lavado de manos con jabón es considerablemente más eficaz que otras intervenciones en materia de agua y saneamiento.
en-mt: However, one analysis indicates that promoting handwashing with soap is significantly more effective than other water and sanitation interventions.

sourceString: The importance of hand washing for human health – particularly for people in vulnerable circumstances like mothers who had just given birth or wounded soldiers in hospitals – was first recognized in the mid 19th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: the Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis who worked in Vienna, Austria and Florence Nightingale, the English "founder of modern nursing".
targetString: La importancia del lavado de manos para la salud humana, en particular para las personas en circunstancias vulnerables, como las madres que acaban de dar a luz o los soldados en los hospitales, fue reconocida por primera vez a mediados del siglo XX por dos pioneros de la higiene de manos: el médico húngaro Ignaz Semmelweis, que trabajó en Viena, Austria, y Florence Nightingale, inglesa, la "fundadora de la enfermería moderna".
en-mt: The importance of handwashing for human health, particularly for people in vulnerable circumstances, such as mothers who have just given birth or soldiers in hospitals, was first recognized in the mid-20th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis, who worked in Vienna, Austria, and English Florence Nightingale, the "founder of modern nursing."

sourceString: At that time most people still believed that infections were caused by foul odors called miasmas.
targetString: En esa época, la mayoría de las personas todavía creía que las infecciones eran provocadas por olores desagradables llamados miasmas.
en-mt: At that time, most people still believed that infections were caused by unpleasant odors called miasmata.

sourceString: In the 1980s, foodborne outbreaks and healthcare-associated infections led the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to more actively promote hand hygiene as an important way to prevent the spread of infection.
targetString: En la década de 1980, los brotes de enfermedades transmitidas por alimentos y las infecciones relacionadas con el cuidado de la salud llevaron a los Centros para el Control y la Prevención de Enfermedades de Estados Unidos a promover la higiene de manos más activamente como una forma importante de prevenir la propagación de infecciones.
en-mt: In the 1980s, outbreaks of foodborne illness and healthcare-associated infections led the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to more actively promote hand hygiene as an important way to to prevent the spread of infection.

sourceString: The outbreak of swine flu in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 led to increased awareness in many countries of the importance of washing hands with soap to protect oneself from such infectious diseases.
targetString: El brote de gripe porcina en 2009 y la pandemia de COVID-19 en 2020 hicieron que en muchos países se tomara más conciencia sobre la importancia de lavarse las manos con jabón para protegerse de esas enfermedades infecciosas.
en-mt: The swine flu outbreak in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 increased awareness in many countries of the importance of washing hands with soap to protect against these infectious diseases.

sourceString: For example, posters with "correct hand washing techniques" were hung up next to hand washing sinks in public toilets and in the toilets of office buildings and airports in Germany.
targetString: Por ejemplo, en Alemania, se colgaron carteles con "técnicas correctas para lavarse las manos" junto a los lavabos de los baños públicos y de los baños de los edificios de oficinas y aeropuertos.
en-mt: For example, in Germany, signs with "proper handwashing techniques" were hung next to sinks in public toilets and toilets in office buildings and airports.

sourceString: The phrase "washing one's hands of" something, means declaring one's unwillingness to take responsibility for the thing or share complicity in it.
targetString: La frase "lavarse las manos" es una declaración de no querer hacerse cargo de algo o compartir la complicidad de algo.
en-mt: The phrase "wash your hands" is a statement of not wanting to take charge of something or share complicity in something.

sourceString: It originates from the bible passage in Matthew where Pontius Pilate washed his hands of the decision to crucify Jesus Christ, but has become a phrase with a much wider usage in some English communities.
targetString: Tiene su origen en el pasaje bíblico de Mateo en el que Poncio Pilato se lavó las manos ante la decisión de crucificar a Jesucristo, pero se ha convertido en una frase de uso mucho más amplio en algunas comunidades inglesas.
en-mt: It originates from the Biblical passage in Matthew in which Pontius Pilate washed his hands of the decision to crucify Jesus Christ, but it has become a much more widely used phrase in some English communities.

sourceString: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth begins to compulsively wash her hands in an attempt to cleanse an imagined stain, representing her guilty conscience regarding crimes she had committed and induced her husband to commit.
targetString: En Macbeth de Shakespeare, Lady Macbeth comienza a lavarse las manos de manera compulsiva en un intento por limpiar una mancha imaginaria, que representa su conciencia de culpabilidad sobre los crímenes que había cometido y que había inducido a su marido a cometer.
en-mt: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth begins to compulsively wash her hands in an attempt to clean an imaginary stain, which represents her guilty conscience about the crimes she had committed and had led her husband to commit.

sourceString: It has also been found that people, after having recalled or contemplated unethical acts, tend to wash hands more often than others, and tend to value hand washing equipment more.
targetString: También se ha comprobado que después de recordar o reflexionar sobre acciones no éticas, las personas tienden a lavarse las manos más a menudo que otros y tienden a valorar más los elementos para el lavado de manos.
en-mt: It has also been found that after remembering or reflecting on unethical actions, people tend to wash their hands more often than others and tend to value handwashing items more highly.

sourceString: Furthermore, those who are allowed to wash their hands after such a contemplation are less likely to engage in other "cleansing" compensatory actions, such as volunteering.
targetString: Además, aquellas personas que tienen permitido lavarse las manos después de tal reflexión, tienen menos probabilidad de involucrarse en otras acciones "de limpieza" compensatorias, como un voluntariado.
en-mt: Also, those people who are allowed to wash their hands after such reflection are less likely to engage in other compensatory "cleaning" actions, such as volunteering.

sourceString: Religions prescribe hand washing for both hygienic and symbolic purposes.Symbolic hand washing, using water but no soap to wash hands, is a part of ritual hand washing featured in many religions, including Bahá'í Faith, Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, Lavabo in Christianity, and Wudhu in Islam.Religions also prescribe hygienic hand washing, especially after certain actions.
targetString: Las religiones recomiendan el lavado de manos con fines higiénicos y simbólicos. El lavado de manos simbólico, con agua, pero sin jabón, forma parte del lavado de manos ritual en muchas religiones, como el bahaísmo, el hinduismo, la tevilá y el netilat yadayim en el judaísmo, el lavatorio en el cristianismo y el wudu en el islam. Las religiones también recomiendan el lavado de manos higiénico, en particular después de ciertas acciones.
en-mt: Religions recommend hand washing for hygienic and symbolic purposes. Symbolic handwashing, with water but no soap, is part of ritual handwashing in many religions, including Baha'i, Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, lavatory in Christianity, and wudu in the Islam. Religions also recommend hygienic hand washing, particularly after certain actions.

sourceString: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands after using the toilet.
targetString: El hinduismo, el judaísmo y el islam obligan a lavarse las manos después de ir al baño.
en-mt: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam require washing hands after using the toilet.

sourceString: And, Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands before and after every meal.
targetString: Y el hinduismo, el budismo, el sijismo, el judaísmo y el islam obligan a lavarse las manos antes y después de cada comida.
en-mt: And Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism and Islam require washing hands before and after each meal.

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19
targetString: Controles de riesgos en el lugar de trabajo ante la COVID-19
en-mt: Risk controls in the workplace before COVID-19

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19 are the application of occupational safety and health methodologies for hazard controls to the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: Los controles de riesgos en el lugar de trabajo ante la COVID-19 refieren a la aplicación de metodologías de higiene y seguridad ocupacional en los controles de riesgos para la prevención de la enfermedad del coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19).
en-mt: Risk controls in the workplace in the face of COVID-19 refer to the application of occupational hygiene and safety methodologies in risk controls for the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The proper hazard controls in the workplace depend on the worksite and job task, based on a risk assessment of sources of exposure, disease severity in the community, and risk factors of individual workers who may be vulnerable to contracting COVID-19.
targetString: Los controles de riesgos adecuados en el lugar de trabajo dependen del sitio de trabajo y de la tarea laboral y se basan en una evaluación de riesgos de las fuentes de exposición, la gravedad de la enfermedad en la comunidad y los factores de riesgo de los trabajadores que pueden ser propensos a contraer COVID-19.
en-mt: Appropriate workplace hazard controls depend on the workplace and work task and are based on a risk assessment of sources of exposure, severity of illness in the community, and worker risk factors. who may be prone to contracting COVID-19.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers, for which basic infection prevention measures are recommended, including hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Según la Administración de Seguridad y Salud Ocupacional (OSHA) de Estados Unidos, los trabajos con menor riesgo de exposición tienen contacto laboral mínimo con el público y los compañeros de trabajo, para los que se aconsejan medidas de prevención de infecciones básicas, entre las que se incluyen el lavado de manos, la recomendación a los trabajadores de quedarse en casa si están enfermos, normas de higiene respiratoria y el mantenimiento de una rutina de limpieza y desinfección del entorno de trabajo.
en-mt: According to the US Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), jobs with lower risk of exposure have minimal occupational contact with the public and co-workers, for whom basic infection prevention measures are advised, including These include hand washing, advising workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory hygiene standards, and maintaining a routine cleaning and disinfection of the work environment.

sourceString: Medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact with people who are not known or suspected with COVID-19, but may be infected due to ongoing community transmission or international travel.
targetString: Los trabajos con riesgo de exposición media incluyen aquellos en los que se requiere contacto frecuente o cercano con personas que no se sabe ni sospecha que tengan COVID-19, pero que podrían estar infectadas por la transmisión comunitaria vigente o por un viaje internacional.
en-mt: Jobs with medium exposure risk include those that require frequent or close contact with individuals not known or suspected to have COVID-19, but who may be infected by ongoing community transmission or international travel.

sourceString: This includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.
targetString: Esto incluye a los trabajadores que están en contacto con el público general, como en las escuelas, los entornos de trabajo con mucha concentración de personas y algunos entornos de venta minorista de gran tamaño.
en-mt: This includes workers who are in contact with the general public, such as in schools, crowded work environments, and some large retail settings.

sourceString: Hazard controls for this group, in addition to basic infection prevention measures, include ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, sneeze guards, and having personal protective equipment available in case a person with COVID-19 is encountered.
targetString: Los controles de riesgo para este grupo, además de las medidas de prevención de infecciones básicas, incluyen la ventilación con filtros de aire de alta eficiencia, cubiertas protectoras y equipos de protección individual disponibles en caso de que haya una persona con COVID-19.
en-mt: Risk controls for this group, in addition to basic infection prevention measures, include ventilation with high-efficiency air filters, protective coverings, and PPE available in the event of a person with COVID-19.

sourceString: OSHA considers healthcare and mortuary workers exposed to known or suspected person with COVID-19 to be at high exposure risk, which increases to very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected person with COVID-19.
targetString: La OSHA considera que los trabajadores de la atención de la salud y de los servicios funerarios, expuestos a personas que se sabe o se sospecha que tienen COVID-19, tienen un riesgo de exposición alto, que aumenta a muy alto si realizan procedimientos que pueden generar aerosoles en personas que se sabe o se sospecha que tienen COVID-19 o toman o manipulan muestras de estas personas.
en-mt: OSHA considers health care and funeral workers exposed to individuals known or suspected to have COVID-19 to be at high exposure risk, which increases to very high if they perform procedures that may generate aerosols in people known or suspected to have COVID-19 or take or handle samples from these people.

sourceString: Hazard controls appropriate for these workers include engineering controls such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to the job task.
targetString: Los controles de riesgos apropiados para estos trabajadores incluyen controles de ingeniería, como salas de ventilación con presión negativa, y equipos de protección individual apropiados para la actividad laboral.
en-mt: Appropriate hazard controls for these workers include engineering controls, such as negative-pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to the work activity.

sourceString: COVID-19 outbreaks can have several effects within the workplace.
targetString: Los brotes de COVID-19 pueden tener varias consecuencias en el lugar de trabajo.
en-mt: COVID-19 outbreaks can have various consequences in the workplace.

sourceString: Workers may be absent from work due to becoming sick, needing to care for others, or from fear of possible exposure.
targetString: Los trabajadores pueden faltar al trabajo por enfermarse, por tener que cuidar a otros o por el miedo a la posible exposición.
en-mt: Workers may miss work due to illness, care for others, or fear of possible exposure.

sourceString: Patterns of commerce may change, both in terms of what goods are demanded, and the means of acquiring these goods (such as shopping at off-peak hours or through delivery or drive-through services).
targetString: Es posible que los patrones de comercio cambien, tanto en lo que respecta a qué bienes se demandan como a los medios de adquisición de esos bienes (como comprar en horas que no sean pico, por medio de servicios de envío a domicilio o por ventanilla desde el automóvil).
en-mt: Trade patterns are likely to change, both in terms of what goods are in demand and the means of acquiring those goods (such as buying at off-peak hours, through home delivery services, or over the counter from the car).

sourceString: Lastly, shipments of items from geographic areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be interrupted.An infectious disease preparedness and response plan can be used to guide protective actions.
targetString: Por último, los envíos de artículos desde zonas geográficas gravemente afectadas por la COVID-19 podrían verse interrumpidos. Se puede utilizar un plan de preparación y respuesta ante enfermedades infecciosas para orientar las medidas preventivas.
en-mt: Finally, shipments of items from geographical areas severely affected by COVID-19 could be interrupted. An infectious disease preparedness and response plan can be used to guide preventive measures.

sourceString: Plans address the levels of risk associated with various worksites and job tasks, including sources of exposure, risk factors arising from home and community settings, and risk factors of individual workers such as old age or chronic medical conditions.
targetString: Los planes abordan los niveles de riesgo relacionados con diversos sitios de trabajo y actividades laborales, incluidas las fuentes de exposición, los factores de riesgo que surgen de los entornos domésticos y comunitarios y los factores de riesgo de los trabajadores individuales, como la vejez o las afecciones médicas crónicas.
en-mt: The plans address the levels of risk associated with various workplaces and work activities, including sources of exposure, risk factors arising from home and community settings, and individual worker risk factors such as old age or illnesses. chronic medical conditions.

sourceString: They also outline controls necessary to address those risks, and contingency plans for situations that may arise as a result of outbreaks.
targetString: También describen los controles necesarios para abordar esos riesgos y los planes de contingencia para las situaciones que puedan surgir como consecuencia de los brotes.
en-mt: They also describe the controls necessary to address those risks and contingency plans for situations that may arise as a result of outbreaks.

sourceString: Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to national or subnational recommendations.
targetString: Los planes de preparación y respuesta ante enfermedades infecciosas pueden estar sujetos a recomendaciones nacionales o regionales.
en-mt: Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to national or regional recommendations.

sourceString: Objectives for response to an outbreak include reducing transmission among staff, protecting people who are at higher risk for adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in their supply chains.
targetString: Entre los objetivos de la respuesta a un brote, se incluyen reducir la transmisión entre miembros del personal, proteger a las personas que tienen mayor riesgo de sufrir complicaciones de salud adversas, mantener las operaciones comerciales y minimizar los efectos adversos en otras entidades de sus cadenas de suministro.
en-mt: Outbreak response goals include reducing transmission among staff members, protecting individuals most at risk of adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in your chains of supply.

sourceString: The disease severity in the community where the business is located affects the responses taken.
targetString: La gravedad de la enfermedad en la comunidad en la que se encuentra la empresa afecta a las medidas que se toman.
en-mt: The severity of the disease in the community in which the company is located affects the actions that are taken.

sourceString: The hierarchy of hazard controls is a framework widely used in occupational safety and health to group hazard controls by effectiveness.
targetString: La jerarquía de los controles de riesgos es un marco ampliamente utilizado en materia de higiene y seguridad ocupacional para clasificar los controles de riesgos según su eficacia.
en-mt: The Hierarchy of Hazard Controls is a widely used occupational health and safety framework for ranking hazard controls based on their effectiveness.

sourceString: Where COVID-19 hazards cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are engineering controls, followed by administrative controls, and lastly personal protective equipment.
targetString: Si los riesgos de COVID-19 no se pueden eliminar, los controles más eficaces son los controles de ingeniería, seguidos por los administrativos y, por último, los equipos de protección individual.
en-mt: If the risks of COVID-19 cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are engineering controls, followed by administrative controls, and lastly, personal protective equipment.

sourceString: Engineering controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards without relying on worker behavior, and can be the most cost-effective solution to implement.
targetString: Los controles de ingeniería implican aislar a los empleados de los peligros relacionados con el trabajo sin recurrir al comportamiento de los trabajadores y pueden ser la solución más rentable de implementar.
en-mt: Engineering controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards without resorting to worker behavior and may be the most cost-effective solution to implement.

sourceString: Administrative controls are changes in work policy or procedures that require action by the worker or employer.
targetString: Los controles administrativos son cambios en las políticas o los procedimientos laborales que requieren acción del trabajador o del empleador.
en-mt: Administrative controls are changes to workplace policies or procedures that require action by the worker or employer.

sourceString: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but can help prevent some exposures.
targetString: Los equipos de protección individual se consideran menos eficaces que los controles de ingeniería y administrativos, pero pueden ayudar a prevenir algunas exposiciones.
en-mt: Personal protective equipment is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but it can help prevent some exposures.

sourceString: All types of PPE must be selected based upon the hazard to the worker, properly fitted as applicable (e.g., respirators), consistently and properly worn, regularly inspected, maintained, and replaced, as necessary, and properly removed, cleaned, and stored or disposed of to avoid contamination.
targetString: Todos los tipos de equipos de protección individual deben seleccionarse en función del peligro para el trabajador, colocarse como corresponda (por ejemplo, los respiradores), usarse de manera adecuada y sistemática, revisarse con frecuencia, recibir mantenimiento, reemplazarse si es necesario y eliminarse, limpiarse y almacenarse o desecharse de manera correcta para no contaminar.
en-mt: All types of personal protective equipment must be selected based on the hazard to the worker, donned accordingly (for example, respirators), used properly and consistently, checked frequently, maintained, replaced if necessary, and disposed of. cleaned and stored or disposed of correctly so as not to contaminate.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers.
targetString: Según la Administración de Salud y Seguridad Ocupacional (OSHA) de Estados Unidos, los trabajos con menor riesgo de exposición tienen contacto laboral mínimo con el público y los compañeros de trabajo.
en-mt: According to the US Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), jobs with the lowest risk of exposure have minimal workplace contact with the public and co-workers.

sourceString: Basic infection prevention measures recommended for all workplaces include frequent and thorough hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and trash receptacles, preparing for telecommuting or staggered shifts if needed, discouraging workers from using others' tools and equipment, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Las medidas de prevención de infecciones básicas que se recomiendan para todos los lugares de trabajo incluyen el lavado de manos profundo y frecuente, la recomendación a los trabajadores de quedarse en casa si están enfermos, las normas de higiene respiratoria que incluyen cubrirse al toser y al estornudar, la provisión de pañuelos de papel y contenedores para los desechos, la preparación para el teletrabajo o los turnos escalonados si es necesario, el disuadir a los trabajadores de usar herramientas y equipos ajenos y el mantenimiento de una rutina de limpieza y desinfección del entorno de trabajo.
en-mt: Basic infection prevention measures that are recommended for all workplaces include thorough and frequent handwashing, advising workers to stay home when sick, respiratory hygiene standards including covering coughs and sneezing, provision of tissues and waste containers, preparation for teleworking or staggered shifts if necessary, discouraging workers from using outside tools and equipment, and maintaining a routine cleaning and disinfection of the environment of work.

sourceString: Prompt identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is a critical step in protecting workers, customers, visitors, and others at a worksite.
targetString: La identificación y el aislamiento inmediatos de personas que puedan estar infectadas es una medida fundamental para proteger a los trabajadores, clientes, visitantes y otros en el lugar de trabajo.
en-mt: Immediate identification and isolation of people who may be infected is a critical measure to protect workers, customers, visitors, and others in the workplace.
