en-mt: On April 10, 2020, Apple and Google jointly announced that they would integrate functionality to support such Bluetooth-based applications directly into their iOS and Android operating systems.

sourceString: In China, the Chinese government, in conjunction with Alipay, has deployed an app that allows citizens to check if they have been in contact with people that have COVID-19.
targetString: En la China, el gobierno chino, junto con Alipay, ha implementado una aplicación que les permite a los ciudadanos verificar si han estado en contacto con personas que tienen COVID-19.
en-mt: In China, the Chinese government, together with Alipay, has implemented an app that allows citizens to check if they have been in contact with people who have COVID-19.

sourceString: It is in use across more than 200 Chinese cities.In Singapore, an app called TraceTogether is being used.
targetString: Ya está en uso en más de 200 ciudades chinas. En Singapur se está usando una aplicación llamada TraceTogether.
en-mt: It is already in use in more than 200 Chinese cities. An app called TraceTogether is being used in Singapore.

sourceString: The app was developed by local IT community, released as open source and will be handed over to the government.North Macedonia launched "StopKorona!", a Bluetooth-based app to trace exposure with potentially infected persons and  provide a fast response to healthcare authorities.
targetString: La aplicación fue desarrollada por una comunidad local de TI, se lanzó como una aplicación de código abierto y se le cederá al gobierno. En Macedonia del Norte se lanzó "StopKorona!", una aplicación basada en Bluetooth para rastrear la exposición a personas potencialmente contagiadas y brindar una respuesta rápida a las autoridades sanitarias.
en-mt: The app was developed by a local IT community, released as an open source app, and will be released to the government. In North Macedonia, "StopKorona!", a Bluetooth-based app to track exposure to potentially infected people and provide rapid response to health authorities, was launched.

sourceString: The app was developed by the Ministry of Communication and Technology and Ministry of Health.
targetString: La aplicación fue desarrollada por el Ministerio de Comunicación y Tecnología y el Ministerio de Salud.
en-mt: The application was developed by the Ministry of Communication and Technology and the Ministry of Health.

sourceString: As of 14 April 2020, the app was awaiting approval by the Google Play Store and Apple App Store.
targetString: Al 14 de abril de 2020, la aplicación estaba a la espera de la aprobación de Google Play Store y Apple App Store.
en-mt: As of April 14, 2020, the app was awaiting approval from the Google Play Store and the Apple App Store.

sourceString: On 12 April, the government stated that the contact tracing app was in an advanced stage of development, and would be available for deployment within weeks.A similar app is planned in Ireland, and in France ("StopCovid").
targetString: El 12 de abril, el gobierno informó que la aplicación de rastreo de contactos se encontraba en una etapa avanzada de desarrollo y que estaría disponible para su implementación en las próximas semanas. Se planea usar una aplicación parecida en Irlanda y en Francia ("StopCovid").
en-mt: On April 12, the government reported that the contact tracing app was in an advanced stage of development and would be available for implementation in the coming weeks. A similar app is planned to be used in Ireland and France ("StopCovid").

sourceString: Both Australia and New Zealand are considering apps based on Singapore's TraceTogether app and BlueTrace protocol.Russia intends to introduce a geofencing app for patients diagnosed with COVID-19 living in Moscow, designed to ensure they do not leave home.
targetString: Tanto Australia como Nueva Zelanda están considerando aplicaciones basadas en la aplicación TraceTogether y el protocolo BlueTrace de Singapur. Rusia planea introducir una aplicación de geoperimetraje para los pacientes que vivan en Moscú y hayan recibido un diagnóstico de COVID-19, diseñada para garantizar que no salgan de sus hogares.
en-mt: Both Australia and New Zealand are considering applications based on the TraceTogether application and Singapore's BlueTrace protocol. Russia plans to introduce a geofencing app for patients living in Moscow diagnosed with COVID-19, designed to ensure they do not leave their homes.

sourceString: Ross Anderson, professor of security engineering at Cambridge University, listed a number of potential practical problems with app-based systems, including false positives and the potential lack of effectiveness if takeup of the app is limited to only a small fraction of the population.
targetString: Ross Anderson, profesor de Ingeniería de Seguridad de la Universidad de Cambridge, expuso varios problemas prácticos potenciales con los sistemas basados en aplicaciones, incluidos los falsos positivos y la posible falta de eficacia si la adopción de la aplicación solo se limita a una pequeña parte de la población.
en-mt: Ross Anderson, Professor of Security Engineering at the University of Cambridge, outlined several potential practical problems with app-based systems, including false positives and potential inefficiency if app adoption is only limited to a small part of the population.

sourceString: Addressing concerns about the spread of misleading or harmful "coronavirus" apps, Apple set limits on which types of organizations could add coronavirus-related apps to its App Store, limiting them to only "official" or otherwise reputable organizations.
targetString: En respuesta a las inquietudes sobre la propagación de aplicaciones del "coronavirus" engañosas o dañinas, Apple limitó los tipos de organizaciones que pueden agregar aplicaciones relacionadas con el coronavirus en su App Store a organizaciones "oficiales" o de confianza únicamente.
en-mt: In response to concerns about the spread of misleading or harmful "coronavirus" apps, Apple has limited the types of organizations that can add coronavirus-related apps to its App Store to "official" or trusted organizations only.

sourceString: Google and Amazon have implemented similar restrictions.
targetString: Google y Amazon han implementado restricciones similares.
en-mt: Google and Amazon have implemented similar restrictions.

sourceString: Privacy campaigners voiced their concern regarding the implications of mass surveillance using coronavirus apps, in particular about whether surveillance infrastructure created to deal with the coronavirus pandemic will be dismantled once the threat has passed.
targetString: Los defensores de la privacidad expresaron su preocupación respecto de las consecuencias de la vigilancia masiva a través de las aplicaciones del coronavirus y, en particular, respecto de si se desmantelará la infraestructura creada para lidiar con la pandemia de coronavirus una vez que pase la amenaza.
en-mt: Privacy advocates have raised concerns about the consequences of mass surveillance through coronavirus apps, and in particular whether the infrastructure created to deal with the coronavirus pandemic will be dismantled once the threat passes.

sourceString: Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issued a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: Amnistía Internacional y más de 100 otras organizaciones presentaron un comunicado para exigir límites a este tipo de vigilancia.
en-mt: Amnesty International and more than 100 other organizations issued a statement demanding limits to this type of surveillance.

sourceString: The organisations declared eight conditions on governmental projects:
targetString: Las organizaciones establecieron ocho condiciones para los proyectos gubernamentales:
en-mt: The organizations established eight conditions for government projects:

sourceString: surveillance would have to be "lawful, necessary and proportionate";
targetString: la vigilancia tendría que ser "legal, necesaria y proporcional";
en-mt: surveillance would have to be "lawful, necessary and proportionate";

sourceString: extensions of monitoring and surveillance would have to have sunset clauses;
targetString: las ampliaciones del monitoreo y la vigilancia tendrían que tener cláusulas de extinción;
en-mt: extensions to monitoring and surveillance would have to have termination clauses;

sourceString: the use of data would have to be limited to COVID-19 purposes;
targetString: el uso de los datos tendría que limitarse a objetivos relacionados con la COVID-19;
en-mt: the use of the data would have to be limited to objectives related to COVID-19;

sourceString: data security and anonymity would have to be protected and shown to be protected based on evidence;
targetString: se tendrían que proteger la seguridad y el anonimato y debería haber evidencia de esta protección;
en-mt: security and anonymity would have to be protected and there should be evidence of this protection;

sourceString: digital surveillance would have to avoid exacerbating discrimination and marginalisation;
targetString: la vigilancia digital debería evitar exacerbar la discriminación y la marginalización;
en-mt: digital surveillance should avoid exacerbating discrimination and marginalization;

sourceString: any sharing of data with third parties would have to be defined in law;
targetString: cualquier intercambio de datos con terceros debería estar definido en las leyes;
en-mt: any data sharing with third parties should be defined in law;

sourceString: there would have to be safeguards against abuse and the rights of citizens to respond to abuses;
targetString: deberían implementarse protecciones contra el abuso y establecerse los derechos de los ciudadanos para responder a dicho abuso;
en-mt: protections against abuse should be implemented and the rights of citizens to respond to such abuse established;

sourceString: meaningful participation by all "relevant stakeholders" would be required, including that of public health experts and marginalised groups.The German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) and Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) also issued checklists.
targetString: será obligatoria la participación significativa de todas las "partes interesadas relevantes", incluidos los expertos de salud pública y los grupos marginalizados. El Chaos Computer Club (CCC) y Reporteros Sin Fronteras (Reporter ohne Grenzen, RSF) de Alemania también publicaron listas de controles.
en-mt: the meaningful participation of all “relevant stakeholders”, including public health experts and marginalized groups, will be mandatory. The Chaos Computer Club (CCC) and Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen, RSF) from Germany also published checklists.

sourceString: The proposed Google/Apple plan intends to address the problem of persistent surveillance by removing the tracing mechanism from their device operating systems once it is no longer needed.
targetString: El plan propuesto por Google/Apple pretende abordar el problema de la vigilancia persistente retirando el mecanismo de rastreo de sus sistemas operativos cuando ya no se necesite.
en-mt: The plan proposed by Google/Apple aims to address the problem of persistent surveillance by removing the tracking mechanism from their operating systems when it is no longer needed.

sourceString: Some countries used network-based location tracking instead of apps, eliminating both the need to download an app and the ability to avoid tracking.
targetString: En algunos países, se usó un rastreo de la ubicación basado en redes, en vez de aplicaciones, lo cual eliminó tanto la necesidad de descargar una aplicación como la capacidad de evitar el rastreo.
en-mt: In some countries, network-based location tracking was used instead of apps, eliminating both the need to download an app and the ability to avoid tracking.

sourceString: In Israel, network-based tracking was approved.
targetString: En Israel, se aprobó el rastreo basado en redes.
en-mt: In Israel, network-based tracking has been approved.

sourceString: Network-based solutions that have access to raw location data have significant potential privacy problems.
targetString: Las soluciones basadas en redes que tienen acceso a datos en bruto de ubicaciones presentan problemas potenciales de privacidad significativos.
en-mt: Network-based solutions that access raw location data present significant potential privacy issues.

sourceString: However, not all systems with central servers need to have access to personal location data; a number of privacy-preserving systems have been created that use central servers only for intercommunication (see section below).
targetString: Sin embargo, no es necesario que todos los sistemas con servidores centrales tengan acceso a los datos de ubicación personal; se han creado varios sistemas de protección de la privacidad que usan servidores centrales solo para la intercomunicación (véase la siguiente sección).
en-mt: However, it is not necessary for all systems with central servers to have access to personal location data; Several privacy protection systems have been created that use central servers only for intercommunication (see next section).

sourceString: In South Korea, a non-app-based system was used to perform contact tracing.
targetString: En Corea del Sur, se usó un sistema que no está basado en una aplicación para llevar a cabo el rastreo de contactos.
en-mt: In South Korea, a non-app-based system was used to conduct contact tracing.

sourceString: Instead of using a dedicated app, the system gathered tracking information from a variety of sources including mobile device tracking data and card transaction data, and combined these to generate notices via text messages to potentially-infected individuals.
targetString: En vez de usar una aplicación específica, el sistema recopiló información de rastreo de diversas fuentes, incluidos los datos de rastreo de dispositivos móviles y los datos de transacciones con tarjetas de crédito, y los combinó para generar avisos por medio de mensajes de texto para personas potencialmente contagiadas.
en-mt: Instead of using a specific app, the system collected tracking information from various sources, including mobile device tracking data and credit card transaction data, and combined it to generate text message alerts for people potentially infected.

sourceString: In addition to using this information to alert potential contacts, the government has also made the location information publicly available, something permitted because of far-reaching changes to information privacy laws after the MERS outbreak in that country.
targetString: Además de usar esta información para alertar sobre posibles contactos, el gobierno también ha hecho que la información sobre la ubicación se encuentre disponible al público, algo que está permitido debido a los cambios de gran alcance a las leyes de privacidad de la información después del brote de MERS en ese país.
en-mt: In addition to using this information to alert potential contacts, the government has also made location information publicly available, something that is allowed due to far-reaching changes to data privacy laws after the outbreak. of MERS in that country.

sourceString: This information is available to the public via a number of apps and websites.Countries including Germany considered using both centralized and privacy-preserving systems.
targetString: Esta información se encuentra disponible para el público a través de diversas aplicaciones y sitios web. Algunos países, incluida Alemania, consideraron usar sistemas centralizados y de protección de la privacidad.
en-mt: This information is available to the public through various applications and websites. Some countries, including Germany, considered using centralized and privacy protection systems.

sourceString: As of 6 April 2020, the details had not yet been released.
targetString: Al 6 de abril de 2020, todavía no se han publicado los detalles.
en-mt: As of April 6, 2020, details have not yet been released.

sourceString: Privacy-preserving contact tracing is a well-established concept, with a substantial body of research literature dating back to at least 2013.As of 7 April 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: El rastreo de contactos con protección de la privacidad es un concepto bien establecido, con una gran cantidad de investigaciones publicadas que se remontan, al menos, a 2013. Al 7 de abril de 2020, más de una docena de grupos de expertos estaban trabajando en soluciones respetuosas de la privacidad, como el uso de Bluetooth de baja energía (BLE) para registrar la proximidad de un usuario a otros teléfonos celulares.
en-mt: Contact tracing with privacy protection is a well-established concept, with a large body of published research dating back to at least 2013. As of April 7, 2020, more than a dozen expert groups were working on it. privacy-respecting solutions, such as using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to record a user's proximity to other cell phones.

sourceString: However, PEPP-PT is a co-ordination effort which contains both centralised and decentralised approaches, and is not a single protocol.Decentralised protocols include Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact Numbers (TCN, fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN), Privacy Sensitive Protocols and Mechanisms for Mobile Contact Tracing (PACT) and others.
targetString: Sin embargo, PEPP-PT es un esfuerzo coordinado que contiene tanto enfoques centralizados como descentralizados y no es un único protocolo. Los protocolos descentralizados incluyen el rastreo de proximidad descentralizado para preservar la privacidad (DP-PPT/DP-3T), los números de contacto temporales (TCN, antes conocidos como números de evento de contacto, CEN) y los protocolos y mecanismos para el rastreo móvil de contactos para la protección de la privacidad (PACT), entre otros.
en-mt: However, PEPP-PT is a coordinated effort that contains both centralized and decentralized approaches and is not a single protocol. Decentralized protocols include privacy-preserving decentralized proximity tracking (DP-PPT/DP-3T), temporary contact numbers (TCNs, formerly known as Contact Event Numbers, CENs), and protocols and mechanisms for tracking Mobile Contacts for Privacy Protection (PACT), among others.

sourceString: In these protocols, identifiable personal data never leaves the device, and all matching happens on-device.
targetString: En estos protocolos, los datos de identificación personal nunca salen del dispositivo y todo el emparejamiento ocurre en el dispositivo.
en-mt: In these protocols, personally identifiable data never leaves the device and all pairing happens on the device.

sourceString: The Privacy Group at MIT Media Lab has been developing SafePaths, a platform for using privacy-preserving techniques when collecting and using location or path intersection data to track the spread of COVID-19.
targetString: El Grupo de Privacidad del MIT Media Lab ha estado desarrollando SafePaths, una plataforma para el uso de técnicas que protegen la privacidad al recopilar y usar datos de ubicación o intersección de rutas para rastrear la propagación de la COVID-19.
en-mt: The MIT Media Lab Privacy Group has been developing SafePaths, a platform for the use of privacy-protecting techniques by collecting and using location or intersection data to track the spread of COVID-19.

sourceString: It is based on research from the whitepaper "Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" released in March 2020.Another similar effort is the SafeTrace platform by Enigma MPC, a company developing privacy technologies that was also originally founded at the MIT Media Lab.
targetString: Se basa en la investigación del informe técnico "Aplicaciones fuera de control: cómo mantener la privacidad personal durante una epidemia", publicado en marzo de 2020. Otro esfuerzo similar es la plataforma SafeTrace de Enigma MPC, una empresa que desarrolla tecnologías de privacidad que también se fundó originalmente en el MIT Media Lab.
en-mt: It is based on research from the white paper "Rogue Apps: Maintaining Personal Privacy During an Epidemic" published in March 2020. Another similar effort is the SafeTrace platform from Enigma MPC, a company that develops privacy technologies that also was originally founded at the MIT Media Lab.

sourceString: SafeTrace utilizes secure hardware technologies to allow users to share sensitive location and health data with other users and officials, without compromising the privacy of that data.
targetString: SafeTrace usa tecnologías de hardware seguro que permiten que sus usuarios compartan datos delicados de ubicación y salud con otros usuarios y funcionarios, sin comprometer la privacidad de esos datos.
en-mt: SafeTrace uses secure hardware technologies that allow its users to share sensitive location and health data with other users and officials, without compromising the privacy of that data.

sourceString: On 5 April 2020, the global TCN Coalition was founded by groups that had coalesced around what was essentially the same approach and largely overlapping protocols, with the goal to reduce fragmentation, and enable global interoperability of tracing and alerting apps, a key aspect of achieving widespread adoption.
targetString: El 5 de abril de 2020, varios grupos unidos en torno a lo que era esencialmente el mismo enfoque y con protocolos altamente coincidentes formaron la Coalición de TCN mundial con el objetivo de reducir la fragmentación y permitir la interoperabilidad mundial de las aplicaciones de rastreo y alertas, un aspecto clave para lograr una amplia adopción.
en-mt: On April 5, 2020, several groups united around what was essentially the same approach and highly overlapping protocols formed the Global TCN Coalition with the goal of reducing fragmentation and enabling global interoperability of tracking and alerting applications. , a key aspect to achieve wide adoption.

sourceString: On 9 April 2020, the Singaporean government announced that it had open-sourced the BlueTrace protocol used by its official government app.
targetString: El 9 de abril de 2020, el gobierno de Singapur anunció que había abierto el código del protocolo BlueTrace usado por su aplicación gubernamental oficial.
en-mt: On April 9, 2020, the Singapore government announced that it had open sourced the BlueTrace protocol used by its official government application.

sourceString: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple, the companies that control the Android and iOS mobile platforms, announced an initiative for contact tracing, which they claimed would preserve privacy, based on a combination of Bluetooth Low Energy technology and privacy-preserving cryptography.
targetString: El 10 de abril de 2020, Apple y Google, las empresas que controlan las plataformas móviles iOS y Android, anunciaron una iniciativa para el rastreo de contactos que, según aseguraron, protegería la privacidad, la cual está basada en la combinación de la tecnología de Bluetooth de baja energía y la criptografía de protección de la privacidad.
en-mt: On April 10, 2020, Apple and Google, the companies that control the iOS and Android mobile platforms, announced a contact tracing initiative that they said would protect privacy, which is based on the combination of Bluetooth low energy and privacy protection cryptography.

sourceString: They also published specifications of the core technologies used in the system.
targetString: También publicaron las especificaciones de las tecnologías principales usadas en el sistema.
en-mt: They also published the specifications of the main technologies used in the system.

sourceString: According to Apple and Google, the system is intended to be rolled out in three stages:
targetString: Según Apple y Google, se pretende implementar el sistema en tres etapas:
en-mt: According to Apple and Google, the system is intended to be implemented in three stages:

sourceString: rollout of tools to enable governments to create official privacy-preserving coronavirus tracing apps
targetString: implementación de las herramientas para que los gobiernos creen aplicaciones de rastreo del coronavirus oficiales que protejan la privacidad
en-mt: implementation of tools for governments to create official coronavirus tracking apps that protect privacy

sourceString: integration of this functionality directly into iOS and AndroidGoogle and Apple plan to address the take-up and persistent surveillance problems by first distributing the system through operating system updates, and later removing it in the same way once the threat has passed.
targetString: integración de esta funcionalidad directamente en iOS y en Android. Google y Apple planean abordar los problemas de adopción y de vigilancia persistente distribuyendo, en primer lugar, el sistema a través de actualizaciones del sistema operativo y, luego, retirándolas de la misma manera una vez que haya pasado la amenaza.
en-mt: integration of this functionality directly in iOS and Android. Google and Apple plan to address persistent surveillance and adoption issues by first distributing the system via OS updates, and then retiring them in the same way once the threat has passed.

sourceString: b'Drug repositioning (also known as drug repurposing, re-profiling, re-tasking or therapeutic switching) is the repurposing of an approved drug for the treatment of a different disease or medical condition than that for which it was originally developed.
targetString: b'La reperfilación (también conocida como reposicionamiento o cambio terapéutico) es la readaptación de un fármaco aprobado para el tratamiento de una enfermedad que no es aquella para la que se lo desarrolló originalmente.
en-mt: b'Reprofiling (also known as repositioning or therapeutic switching) is the repurposing of an approved drug for the treatment of a disease other than the one for which it was originally developed.

sourceString: This is one line of scientific research which is currently being pursued to develop safe and effective COVID-19 treatments.
targetString: Esto está en línea con la investigación científica que actualmente busca desarrollar tratamientos seguros y efectivos para la COVID-19.
en-mt: This is in line with the scientific research currently seeking to develop safe and effective treatments for COVID-19.

sourceString: Other research directions include the development of a COVID-19 vaccine and convalescent plasma transfusion.SARS-CoV-2 has about 66 druggable proteins, each of which has multiple ligand binding sites.
targetString: Otras líneas de investigación incluyen el desarrollo de una vacuna contra la COVID-19 y transfusión de plasma de convaleciente. El SARS-CoV-2 tiene aproximadamente 66 proteínas quimiomodulables, cada una de las cuales tiene múltiples sitios de unión con el ligando.
en-mt: Other lines of research include the development of a vaccine against COVID-19 and convalescent plasma transfusion. SARS-CoV-2 has approximately 66 chemomodulable proteins, each of which has multiple ligand-binding sites.

sourceString: Analyzing those binding sites provide the reasonable project of developing effective antiviral drug against COVID-19 proteins.
targetString: El análisis de esos sitios de unión brinda el fundamento razonable para el proyecto de desarrollar un fármaco antivírico efectivo contra las proteínas de la COVID-19.
en-mt: The analysis of these binding sites provides a reasonable foundation for the project to develop an effective antiviral drug against the COVID-19 proteins.

sourceString: Of the most important SARS-CoV-2 target proteins are papain-like protease, RNA dependent RNA polymerase, helicase, S protein, and ADP ribophosphatase.
targetString: Entre las proteínas diana más importantes del SARS-CoV-2, se encuentran la proteasa similar a la papaína, la ARN polimerasa dirigida por ARN, la helicasa, la proteína S y la ribofosfatasa ADP.
en-mt: Among the most important target proteins of SARS-CoV-2 are papain-like protease, RNA-directed RNA polymerase, helicase, protein S, and ADP ribophosphatase.

sourceString: Hussein A A, et al studied several candidate compounds which then optimized and analyzed for their skeleton similarity with the highest similar approved drugs in order to accelerate a potent anti-SARS-CoV-2 drug development in his preclinical study to be recommended in a clinical study design.
targetString: Hussein A. A. et al. estudiaron varios compuestos de interés médico que luego optimizaron y analizaron para identificar la similitud de su cadena principal con los fármacos aprobados más parecidos a fin de acelerar el desarrollo de un fármaco potente contra el SARS-CoV-2 en su estudio preclínico y recomendarlo para el diseño de un estudio clínico.
en-mt: Hussein AA et al. studied several compounds of medical interest that were then optimized and analyzed for their backbone similarity to the most similar approved drugs to accelerate the development of a potent SARS-CoV-2 drug in their preclinical study and recommend it for trial. design of a clinical study.

sourceString: Chloroquine is an anti-malarial medication that is also used against some auto-immune diseases.
targetString: La cloroquina es un fármaco antipalúdico que también se usa contra algunas enfermedades autoinmunes.
en-mt: Chloroquine is an antimalarial drug that is also used against some autoimmune diseases.

sourceString: On 18 March, the WHO announced that chloroquine and the related hydroxychloroquine would be among the four drugs studied as part of the Solidarity clinical trial.
targetString: El 18 de marzo, la OMS anunció que la cloroquina y la hidroxicloroquina relacionada estarían entre los cuatro fármacos que se estudiarían en el ensayo clínico Solidaridad.
en-mt: On March 18, the WHO announced that chloroquine and the related hydroxychloroquine would be among four drugs to be studied in the Solidaridad clinical trial.

sourceString: New York governor Andrew Cuomo announced that New York State trials of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine would begin on 24 March.On 28 March, the FDA authorized the use of hydroxychloroquine sulfate and chloroquine phosphate under an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).
targetString: El gobernador de Nueva York Andrew Cuomo anunció que los ensayos del estado de Nueva York con cloroquina e hidroxicloroquina empezarían el 24 de marzo. El 28 de marzo, la FDA autorizó el uso del sulfato de hidroxicloroquina y el fosfato de cloroquina mediante una autorización de uso urgente (EUA).
en-mt: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo announced that New York state trials of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine would begin on March 24. On March 28, the FDA authorized the use of hydroxychloroquine sulfate and chloroquine phosphate through an emergency use authorization (EUA).

sourceString: The treatment has not been approved by the FDA's clinical trials process and is authorized under the EUA only as an experimental treatment for emergency use in patients who are hospitalized but are not able to receive treatment in a clinical trial.
targetString: El tratamiento no ha sido aprobado por el proceso de ensayos clínicos de la FDA y está autorizado conforme una EUA solamente como un tratamiento experimental para el uso urgente en pacientes que están hospitalizados, pero que no pueden recibir tratamiento en un ensayo clínico.
en-mt: The treatment has not been approved through the FDA's clinical trial process and is authorized under an EUA only as an experimental treatment for urgent use in patients who are hospitalized but unable to receive treatment in a clinical trial.

sourceString: The CDC has said that "the use, dosing, or duration of hydroxychloroquine for prophylaxis or treatment of SARS-CoV-2 infection" are not yet established.
targetString: Los CDC dijeron que "el uso, la dosis o la duración de la hidroxicloroquina para la profilaxis o el tratamiento de la infección por SARS-CoV-2" todavía no están establecidos.
en-mt: The CDC said that "the use, dose, or duration of hydroxychloroquine for the prophylaxis or treatment of SARS-CoV-2 infection" is not yet established.

sourceString: Doctors have said they are using the drug when "there's no other option".
targetString: Lo médicos han dicho que usan el fármaco cuando "no hay otra opción".
en-mt: Doctors have said they use the drug when "there is no other option."

sourceString: A Turkish research team in Istanbul is conducting a small study on the use of chloroquine in combination with zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C and vitamin D.
targetString: Un equipo de investigación turco en Estambul lleva a cabo un estudio pequeño sobre el uso de la cloroquina en combinación con zinc, vitamina A, vitamina C y vitamina D.
en-mt: A Turkish research team in Istanbul is conducting a small study on the use of chloroquine in combination with zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C, and vitamin D.

sourceString: Large studies are underway at Duke University and the University of Oxford.
targetString: En la Universidad de Duke y la Universidad de Oxford, se encuentran en marcha estudios grandes.
en-mt: At Duke University and the University of Oxford, large studies are underway.

sourceString: NYU Langone Medical School is conducting a trial on the safety and efficacy of preventative use of hydroxychloroquine.
targetString: La Faculta de Medicina de Langone de la NYU está realizando un ensayo sobre la seguridad y eficacia del uso preventivo de la hidroxicloroquina.
en-mt: NYU Langone School of Medicine is conducting a trial on the safety and efficacy of the preventive use of hydroxychloroquine.

sourceString: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show favipiravir was "clearly effective".
targetString: Ensayos clínicos chinos en Wuhan y Shenzhen afirmaron demostrar que el favipiravir era "claramente efectivo".
en-mt: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show that favipiravir was "clearly effective."

sourceString: 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
targetString: Treinta y cinco pacientes en Shenzhen dieron negativo en un promedio de 4 días, mientras que la duración de la enfermedad fue de 11 días en 45 pacientes que no lo recibieron.
en-mt: Thirty-five patients in Shenzhen tested negative in an average of 4 days, while disease duration was 11 days in 45 patients who did not receive it.

sourceString: In a study conducted in Wuhan on 240 patients with pneumonia, half were given favipiravir and half received umifenovir.
targetString: En un estudio realizado en Wuhan en 240 pacientes con neumonía, la mitad recibió favipiravir, mientras que a la otra mitad se le administró umifenovir.
en-mt: In a study conducted in Wuhan in 240 pneumonia patients, half received favipiravir, while the other half received umifenovir.

sourceString: The Italian Pharmaceutical Agency reminded the public that the existing evidence in support of the drug is scant and preliminary.
targetString: La Agencia Italiana de Medicamentos recordó al público que las pruebas existentes que respaldan el fármaco son escasas y preliminares.
en-mt: The Italian Medicines Agency reminded the public that the existing evidence supporting the drug is scant and preliminary.

sourceString: On 2 April, Germany announced that it would purchase the drug from Japan for its stockpile, and use the military to deliver the drug to university hospitals, where the drug will be used to treat COVID-19 patients.
targetString: El 2 de abril, Alemania anunció que compraría el fármaco a Japón para sus reservas y que recurriría a los militares para entregar el fármaco a hospitales universitarios, donde se lo usará para tratar pacientes con COVID-19.
en-mt: On April 2, Germany announced that it would buy the drug from Japan for its stockpiles and would use the military to deliver the drug to university hospitals, where it will be used to treat COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: According to the South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe has made overtures to the Trump administration about purchasing the drug.The drug may be less effective in severe cases of illness where the virus has already multiplied.
targetString: De acuerdo con el South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe ha realizado propuestas a la Administración de Trump sobre la compra del fármaco. El fármaco puede ser menos efectivo en casos graves de la enfermedad si el virus ya se ha multiplicado.
en-mt: According to the South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe has made proposals to the Trump Administration regarding the purchase of the drug. The drug may be less effective in severe cases of the disease if the virus has already multiplied.

sourceString: It may not be safe for use by pregnant women or those trying to conceive.
targetString: Puede no ser seguro para las mujeres embarazadas o que tratan de concebir.
en-mt: May not be safe for women who are pregnant or trying to conceive.

sourceString: One study of lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), a combination of the antivirals lopinavir and ritonavir, concluded that "no benefit was observed".
targetString: Un estudio del lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), una combinación de los antivíricos lopinavir y ritonavir, concluyó que "no se observaron beneficios".
en-mt: A study of lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), a combination of the antivirals lopinavir and ritonavir, concluded that "no benefit was seen."

sourceString: The drugs were designed to inhibit HIV from replicating by binding to the protease.
targetString: Los fármacos fueron diseñados para inhibir la replicación del VIH uniéndose a la proteasa.
en-mt: The drugs were designed to inhibit HIV replication by binding to the protease.

sourceString: A team of researchers at the University of Colorado are trying to modify the drugs to find a compound that will bind with the protease of SARS-CoV-2.There are criticisms within the scientific community about directing resources to repurposing drugs specifically developed for HIV/AIDS.
targetString: Un equipo de investigadores en la Universidad de Colorado está intentando modificar los fármacos para encontrar un compuesto que se una a la proteasa del SARS-CoV-2. En la comunidad científica, han surgido críticas sobre la asignación de recursos a la readaptación de fármacos específicamente desarrollados para el VIH/SIDA.
en-mt: A team of researchers at the University of Colorado is trying to modify the drugs to find a compound that binds to the SARS-CoV-2 protease. Criticism has been raised in the scientific community about the allocation of resources to the repurposing of drugs specifically developed for HIV/AIDS.

sourceString: The WHO included lopinavir/ritonavir in the international Solidarity trial.
targetString: La OMS incluyó el lopinavir/ritonavir en el ensayo internacional Solidaridad.
en-mt: WHO included lopinavir/ritonavir in the international Solidaridad trial.

sourceString: Remdesivir was created and developed by Gilead Sciences as a treatment for Ebola virus disease and Marburg virus infections . Gilead Sciences subsequently discovered that Remdesivir had antiviral activity in vitro against multiple filo-, pneumo-, paramyxo-, and corona- viruses .
targetString: El remdesivir fue creado y desarrollado por Gilead Sciences como tratamiento para la enfermedad por el virus del Ébola y las infecciones por el virus de Marburg. Gilead Sciences posteriormente descubrió que el remdesivir tenía actividad antivírica in vitro contra múltiples filovirus, neumovirus, paramixovirus y coronavirus.
en-mt: Remdesivir was created and developed by Gilead Sciences as a treatment for Ebola virus disease and Marburg virus infections. Gilead Sciences subsequently found that remdesivir had in vitro antiviral activity against multiple filoviruses, pneumoviruses, paramyxoviruses, and coronaviruses.

sourceString: One issue with antiviral treatment is the development of resistance through mutations that can lead to more severe disease and transmission.
targetString: Un problema del tratamiento antivírico es el desarrollo de resistencia mediante mutaciones que puede resultar en una enfermedad y transmisión más graves.
en-mt: One problem with antiviral treatment is the development of resistance through mutations that can result in more severe disease and transmission.

sourceString: Some early pretrial studies suggest remdesivir may have a high genetic barrier to resistance.There are several clinical trials underway, including two conducted by Cleveland University Hospitals; one for people with moderate illness and another for those with more severe illness.
targetString: Algunos estudios iniciales previos a los ensayos sugieren que el remdesivir puede tener una barrera genética alta contra la resistencia. Varios ensayos clínicos están en curso, incluidos dos dirigidos por hospitales de la Universidad de Cleveland; uno para personas con una enfermedad moderada y otro para quienes tienen una enfermedad más grave.
en-mt: Some early studies prior to trials suggest that remdesivir may have a high genetic barrier against resistance. Several clinical trials are ongoing, including two led by Cleveland University Hospitals; one for people with moderate illness and one for those with more severe illness.

sourceString: There are three ongoing clinical trials of intravenous vitamin C for people who are hospitalized and severely ill with COVID-19; two placebo controlled (China, Canada) and one with no control (Italy).
targetString: Se encuentran en curso tres ensayos clínicos de vitamina C intravenosa para personas hospitalizadas y gravemente afectadas por la COVID-19; dos controlados con placebo (China, Canadá) y uno sin control (Italia).
en-mt: Three clinical trials of intravenous vitamin C for people hospitalized and severely affected by COVID-19 are ongoing; two placebo controlled (China, Canada) and one uncontrolled (Italy).

sourceString: New York State began trials for the antibiotic azithromycin on 24 March 2020.
targetString: El estado de Nueva York comenzó ensayos con el antibiótico azitromicina el 24 de marzo de 2020.
en-mt: New York State began trials of the antibiotic azithromycin on March 24, 2020.

sourceString: Japan's National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) is planning a clinical trial for Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide), an inhaled corticosteroid for asthma, for the treatment of pre-symptomatic patients infected with the novel coronavirus.
targetString: El Centro Nacional de Salud Global y Medicina (NCGM) de Japón está planificando un ensayo clínico con Alvesco (ciclesonida) de Teijin, un corticoesteroide inhalable para el asma, como tratamiento para pacientes asintomáticos infectados por el nuevo coronavirus.
en-mt: Japan's National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) is planning a clinical trial of Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide), an inhaled corticosteroid for asthma, as a treatment for asymptomatic patients infected with the novel coronavirus.

sourceString: A form of angiotensin-converting enzyme 2, a Phase II trial is underway with 200 patients to be recruited from severe, hospitalized cases in Denmark, Germany, and Austria to determine the effectiveness of the treatment.
targetString: Una forma de enzima convertidora de la angiotensina 2, un ensayo en fase II está en curso y se inscribirán 200 pacientes graves hospitalizados en Dinamarca, Alemania y Austria para determinar la efectividad del tratamiento.
en-mt: A form of angiotensin-converting enzyme 2, a phase II trial is ongoing and will enroll 200 critically ill hospitalized patients in Denmark, Germany and Austria to determine the effectiveness of the treatment.

sourceString: Researchers from the Montreal Heart Institute in Canada are currently studying the role of colchicine in reducing inflammation and pulmonary complications in patients suffering from mild symptoms of COVID-19.
targetString: Los investigadores del Montreal Heart Institute en Canadá actualmente están estudiando el papel de la colchicina para disminuir la inflamación y las complicaciones pulmonares en pacientes con síntomas leves de COVID-19.
en-mt: Researchers at the Montreal Heart Institute in Canada are currently studying the role of colchicine in decreasing inflammation and pulmonary complications in patients with mild symptoms of COVID-19.

sourceString: The study, named COLCORONA, is recruiting 6000 adults aged 40 and over who were diagnosed with COVID-19 and experience mild symptoms not requiring hospitalization.
targetString: El estudio, denominado COLCORONA, está inscribiendo a 6000 adultos de 40 años y mayores con un diagnóstico de COVID-19 y síntomas leves que no requieren hospitalización.
en-mt: The study, called COLCORONA, is enrolling 6,000 adults ages 40 and older with a diagnosis of COVID-19 and mild symptoms that do not require hospitalization.

sourceString: Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding or who do not have an effective contraceptive method are not eligible.
targetString: Las mujeres embarazadas, que amamantan o que no tienen un método anticonceptivo afectivo no son elegibles.
en-mt: Women who are pregnant, nursing or do not have effective contraception are not eligible.

sourceString: Several anticoagulants are being tested in Italy.
targetString: Se están evaluando varios anticoagulantes en Italia.
en-mt: Several anticoagulants are being evaluated in Italy.

sourceString: Low-molecular-weight heparin is being widely used to treat patients, prompting the Italian Medicines Agency to publish guidelines on its use.
targetString: La heparina de bajo peso molecular se usa ampliamente para tratar a los pacientes, por lo que la Agencia Italiana de Medicamentos publicó pautas sobre su uso.
en-mt: Low molecular weight heparin is widely used to treat patients, so the Italian Medicines Agency published guidelines on its use.

sourceString: A multicenter study on 300 patients researching the use of enoxaparin sodium at prophylaxis and therapeutic dosages was announced in Italy on April 14.
targetString: El 14 de abril, se anunció en Italia un estudio multicéntrico con 300 pacientes que investiga el uso de la enoxaparina sódica en dosis preventivas y terapéuticas.
en-mt: On April 14, a multicenter study involving 300 patients investigating the use of enoxaparin sodium in preventive and therapeutic doses was announced in Italy.

sourceString: Since SARS-CoV-2 is a virus, considerable scientific attention has been focused on repurposing approved anti-viral drugs that were developed for prior outbreaks such as MERS, SARS, and West Nile virus.
targetString: Como el SARS-CoV-2 es un virus, los científicos están dedicando mucha atención a la readaptación de fármacos antivíricos que se desarrollaron para brotes anteriores del virus del SROM, del SRAG y del Nilo Occidental.
en-mt: Because SARS-CoV-2 is a virus, scientists are devoting a lot of attention to repurposing antiviral drugs that were developed for previous MERS, SARS, and West Nile virus outbreaks.

sourceString: Ribavirin: ribavirin was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: Ribavirin: el ribavirin se recomendó para el tratamiento de la COVID-19 de acuerdo con la 7.ª edición de las pautas chinas
en-mt: Ribavirin: Ribavirin was recommended for the treatment of COVID-19 according to the 7th edition of the Chinese guidelines

sourceString: Umifenovir: umifenovir was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: Umifenovir: el umifenovir se recomendó para el tratamiento de la COVID-19 de acuerdo con la 7.ª edición de las pautas chinas
en-mt: Umifenovir: Umifenovir was recommended for the treatment of COVID-19 according to the 7th edition of the Chinese guidelines

sourceString: Some antibiotics that have been identified as potentially repurposable as COVID-19 treatments:
targetString: Estos son algunos tratamientos que se identificaron para readaptaciones posibles para el tratamiento de la COVID-19:
en-mt: Here are some treatments that have been identified for possible retrofits for the treatment of COVID-19:

sourceString: Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Approved by China.
targetString: Tocilizumab (bloquea el receptor de IL-6): aprobado por China.
en-mt: Tocilizumab (blocks the IL-6 receptor): approved by China.

sourceString: Also trials in Italy and China. and see Tocilizumab#COVID-19.
targetString: {NS}
en-mt: {DK}

sourceString: b'A COVID-19 vaccine is a hypothetical vaccine against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: b'Una vacuna contra la COVID-19 es una vacuna hipotética contra la enfermedad del coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19).
en-mt: b'A COVID-19 vaccine is a hypothetical vaccine against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).

sourceString: Although no vaccine has completed clinical trials, there are multiple attempts in progress to develop such a vaccine.
targetString: Aunque ninguna vacuna ha completado los ensayos clínicos, hay muchos intentos en curso para desarrollar dicha vacuna.
en-mt: Although no vaccine has completed clinical trials, there are many ongoing attempts to develop such a vaccine.

sourceString: In late February 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) said it did not expect a vaccine against SARS-CoV-2, the causative virus, to become available in less than 18 months.
targetString: A fines de febrero de 2020, la Organización Mundial de la Salud (OMS) dijo que no esperaba que hubiera una vacuna contra el SARS-CoV-2, el virus que causa la enfermedad, en menos de 18 meses.
en-mt: In late February 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) said it did not expect a vaccine against SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes the disease, to be available for less than 18 months.

sourceString: Five vaccine candidates were in Phase I safety studies in April.
targetString: En abril, cinco posibles vacunas estaban en estudios de la seguridad en fase I.
en-mt: As of April, five potential vaccines were in Phase I safety studies.

sourceString: COVID-19 was identified in December 2019.
targetString: La COVID-19 se identificó en diciembre de 2019.
en-mt: COVID-19 was identified in December 2019.

sourceString: A major outbreak spread around the world in 2020, leading to considerable investment and research activity to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Un brote importante se extendió por el mundo en el 2020, lo que desencadenó considerables inversiones y actividad de investigación para desarrollar una vacuna.
en-mt: A major outbreak swept the world in 2020, triggering considerable investment and research activity to develop a vaccine.

sourceString: Many organizations are using published genomes to develop possible vaccines against SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Muchas organizaciones usan los genomas publicados para desarrollar posibles vacunas contra el SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Many organizations use the published genomes to develop potential vaccines against SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Stated in April, imperatives of the CEPI initiative for vaccine development are speed, manufacturing capacity, deployment at scale, and global access.
targetString: Establecidos en abril, los requisitos de la iniciativa de la CEPI para el desarrollo de una vacuna son velocidad, capacidad de fabricación, implementación a escala y acceso global.
en-mt: Set out in April, the CEPI initiative's requirements for vaccine development are speed, manufacturability, deployment at scale, and global access.

sourceString: In April, CEPI scientists reported that 10 different technology platforms were under research and development during early 2020 to create an effective vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: En abril, los científicos de la CEPI informaron que 10 plataformas tecnológicas diferentes se estaban investigando y desarrollando a principios del 2020 para crear una vacuna efectiva contra la COVID-19.
en-mt: In April, CEPI scientists reported that 10 different technology platforms were being researched and developed by early 2020 to create an effective vaccine against COVID-19.

sourceString: Major platform targets advanced into Phase I safety studies include:
targetString: Entre las dianas de las plataformas principales que pasaron a estudios de la seguridad en fase I, se encuentran las siguientes:
en-mt: Among the targets of the main platforms that entered phase I safety studies are the following:

sourceString: nucleic acid (DNA and RNA) (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: Moderna, mRNA-1273)
targetString: ácido nucleico (ADN y ARN) (desarrollador de la fase I y posible vacuna: Moderna, mRNA-1273)
en-mt: nucleic acid (DNA and RNA) (Phase I developer and potential vaccine: Moderna, mRNA-1273)

sourceString: viral vector (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)
targetString: vector vírico (desarrollador de la fase I y posible vacuna: CanSino Biologics, vector de adenovirus tipo 5)
en-mt: Viral vector (Phase I developer and potential vaccine: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)

sourceString: As reported by CEPI scientists in April, 115 total vaccine candidates are in early stages of development, with 78 confirmed as active projects (79, according to the Milken Institute), and 37 others announced, but with little public information available (presumed to be in planning or being designed).
targetString: Según informaron los científicos de la CEPI en abril, en total, 115 posibles vacunas están en las etapas iniciales del desarrollo, 78 de las cuales están confirmadas en proyectos activos (79, de acuerdo con el Milken Institute) y las otras 37 están anunciadas, pero con poca información disponible (se presume que se está planificando o desarrollando).
en-mt: As reported by CEPI scientists in April, in total, 115 potential vaccines are in the early stages of development, 78 of which are confirmed in active projects (79, according to the Milken Institute) and the other 37 are announced, but with little information available (it is presumed that it is being planned or developed).

sourceString: A Phase I-II trial conducts preliminary safety and immunogenicity testing, is typically randomized, placebo-controlled, and at multiple sites, while determining more precise, effective doses.
targetString: Un ensayo en fase I o II realiza pruebas preliminares de la seguridad y la inmunogenicidad, usualmente es aleatorio, está controlado por placebo y se efectúa en varios sitios, a la vez que determina dosis más precisas y efectivas.
en-mt: A phase I or II trial performs preliminary testing of safety and immunogenicity, is usually randomized, placebo-controlled, and multisite, while determining more precise and effective doses.

sourceString: Phase III trials typically involve more participants, including a control group, and test effectiveness of the vaccine to prevent the disease, while monitoring for adverse effects at the optimal dose.
targetString: Los ensayos en fase III suelen involucrar más participantes, incluido un grupo de control, y evaluar la efectividad de la vacuna para prevenir la enfermedad, a la vez que controlan los efectos adversos que se producen con la dosis óptima.
en-mt: Phase III trials typically involve more participants, including a control group, and test the effectiveness of the vaccine in preventing disease, while controlling for adverse effects that occur with the optimal dose.

sourceString: Of 79 vaccine candidates in active development (confirmed as of early April 2020), 74 were not yet in human evaluation (still in "preclinical" research).
targetString: De las 79 vacunas en desarrollo activo (confirmadas a principios de abril de 2020), 74 todavía no estaban en evaluación en humanos (seguían en la investigación "preclínica").
en-mt: Of the 79 vaccines in active development (confirmed as of early April 2020), 74 were not yet in human evaluation (still in "preclinical" research).

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Australia, the University of Queensland announced that it is investigating the potential of a molecular clamp vaccine that would genetically modify viral proteins in order to stimulate an immune reaction.
targetString: Alrededor del 24 de enero de 2020 en Australia, la Universidad de Queensland anunció que estaba investigando el potencial de una vacuna con sujeción molecular que modificaría genéticamente las proteínas víricas para estimular la reacción inmunitaria.
en-mt: Around January 24, 2020 in Australia, the University of Queensland announced that it was investigating the potential for a molecularly-tethered vaccine that would genetically modify viral proteins to stimulate the immune response.

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Canada, the International Vaccine Centre (VIDO-InterVac) at the University of Saskatchewan announced the commencement of work on a vaccine, aiming to start human testing in 2021.
targetString: Alrededor del 24 de enero de 2020 en Canadá, el International Vaccine Centre (VIDO-InterVac) de la Universidad de Saskatchewan anunció el inicio del trabajo en una vacuna y espera que las pruebas en humanos comiencen en el 2021.
en-mt: Around January 24, 2020 in Canada, the International Vaccine Center (VIDO-InterVac) at the University of Saskatchewan announced the start of work on a vaccine and expects human testing to begin in 2021.

sourceString: Vaccine development projects were announced at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention on 26 January 2020, and the University of Hong Kong on 28 January.
targetString: Se anunciaron proyectos para el desarrollo de vacunas en el Centro para el Control y la Prevención de Enfermedades de China el 26 de enero de 2020 y en la Universidad de Hong Kong el 28 de enero.
en-mt: Projects for vaccine development were announced at the China Center for Disease Control and Prevention on January 26, 2020, and at the University of Hong Kong on January 28.

sourceString: Around 29 January 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, led by Hanneke Schuitemaker, announced that it had begun work on developing a vaccine.
targetString: Alrededor del 29 de enero de 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, lideradas por Hanneke Schuitemaker, anunciaron que habían comenzado a desarrollar una vacuna.
en-mt: Around January 29, 2020, the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, led by Hanneke Schuitemaker, announced that they had begun development of a vaccine.

sourceString: Janssen is co-developing an oral vaccine with its biotechnology partner, Vaxart.
targetString: Janssen está codesarrollando una vacuna oral con su asociado biotecnológico, Vaxart.
en-mt: Janssen is co-developing an oral vaccine with its biotech partner, Vaxart.

sourceString: On 18 March 2020, Emergent BioSolutions announced a manufacturing partnership with Vaxart to develop the vaccine.
targetString: El 18 de marzo de 2020, Emergent BioSolutions anunció una asociación de fabricación con Vaxart para el desarrollo de la vacuna.
en-mt: On March 18, 2020, Emergent BioSolutions announced a manufacturing partnership with Vaxart for vaccine development.

sourceString: On 8 February 2020, the laboratory OncoGen in Romania published a paper on the design of a vaccine with similar technology to the one used for cancer neoantigen vaccination therapy.
targetString: El 8 de febrero de 2020, el laboratorio OncoGen en Rumania publicó un documento con un diseño para una vacuna con tecnología similar a la que se usa en el tratamiento con vacunas neoantigénicas contra cáncer.
en-mt: On February 8, 2020, the OncoGen laboratory in Romania published a design document for a vaccine with technology similar to that used in neoantigenic vaccine treatment against cancer.

sourceString: On 25 March the head of the research institute announced that they had finalized the synthesis of the vaccine and were beginning the tests.
targetString: El 25 de marzo, el jefe del instituto de investigación anunció que habían finalizado la síntesis de la vacuna y que estaban comenzando las pruebas.
en-mt: On March 25, the head of the research institute announced that they had finished the synthesis of the vaccine and that tests were beginning.

sourceString: On 27 February 2020, a Generex subsidiary company, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, announced they were beginning a vaccine project to create an Ii-Key peptide vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: El 27 de febrero de 2020, una subsidiaria de Generex, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, anunció que estaba comenzando un proyecto para crear una vacuna de péptidos li-key contra la COVID-19.
en-mt: On February 27, 2020, a Generex subsidiary, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, announced that it was starting a project to create a li-key peptide vaccine against COVID-19.

sourceString: They wanted to produce a vaccine candidate that could be tested in humans "within 90 days."
targetString: Querían producir una posible vacuna que se pudiera probar en humanos "dentro de los 90 días".
en-mt: They wanted to produce a potential vaccine that could be tested in humans "within 90 days."

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, Washington University in St. Louis announced its projects to develop a vaccine.
targetString: El 5 de marzo de 2020, la Universidad de Washington en San Luis anunció sus proyectos para desarrollar una vacuna.
en-mt: On March 5, 2020, Washington University in St. Louis announced its plans to develop a vaccine.

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, the United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Army Institute of Research in Silver Spring, both in western Maryland, announced they were working on a vaccine.
targetString: El 5 de marzo de 2020, el United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command en el Fuerte Detrick y el Walter Reed Army Institute of Research en Silver Spring, ambos en el oeste de Maryland, anunciaron que estaban trabajando en una vacuna.
en-mt: On March 5, 2020, the United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Army Institute of Research in Silver Spring, both in western Maryland, announced that they were working on a vaccine.

sourceString: Around 10 March 2020, Emergent Biosolutions announced that it had teamed with Novavax Inc.
targetString: Cerca del 10 de marzo de 2020, Emergent Biosolutions anunció que se había unido a Novavax Inc.
en-mt: Around March 10, 2020, Emergent Biosolutions announced that it had joined Novavax Inc.

sourceString: in the development and manufacture of a vaccine.
targetString: en el desarrollo y la fabricación de una vacuna.
en-mt: in the development and manufacture of a vaccine.

sourceString: The partners further announced plans for preclinical testing and a Phase I clinical trial by July 2020.
targetString: Los asociados también anunciaron planes para una prueba clínica y un ensayo clínico en fase I para julio de 2020.
en-mt: The partners also announced plans for a clinical trial and a Phase I clinical trial by July 2020.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, India's Health Ministry announced they are working with 11 isolates, and that even on a fast track it would take at least around one-and-a-half to two years to develop a vaccine.
targetString: El 12 de marzo de 2020, el Ministerio de Salud de la India anunció que estaba trabajando con 11 aislados y que, aunque avanza rápido, tomaría al menos de un año y medio a dos años para desarrollar una vacuna.
en-mt: On March 12, 2020, the Indian Ministry of Health announced that it was working with 11 isolates and that although it is moving fast, it would take at least one and a half to two years to develop a vaccine.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company in Quebec City, Quebec, reported development of a coronavirus-like particle under partial funding from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research.
targetString: El 12 de marzo de 2020, Medicago, una empresa de biotecnología en la ciudad de Quebec, Quebec, informó el desarrollo de una partícula similar al coronavirus con financiamiento parcial de los Institutos Canadienses de Investigación en Salud.
en-mt: On March 12, 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company in Quebec City, Quebec, reported the development of a coronavirus-like particle with partial funding from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate is in laboratory research, with human testing planned for July or August 2020.
targetString: La posible vacuna está en la etapa de investigación de laboratorio y se espera que las pruebas en humanos comiencen en julio o agosto de 2020.
en-mt: The potential vaccine is in the laboratory research stage with human testing expected to begin in July or August 2020.

sourceString: Earlier that week, The Guardian reported that the US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "'large sums of money' for exclusive access to a Covid-19 vaccine", against which the German government protested.
targetString: Anteriormente esa semana, The Guardian informó que el presidente de los EE. UU. Donald Trump había ofrecido a CureVac "'grandes cantidades de dinero por acceso exclusivo a una vacuna contra la COVID-19", ante lo cual el Gobierno alemán se quejó.
en-mt: Earlier that week, The Guardian reported that US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "'large amounts of money for exclusive access to a COVID-19 vaccine," to which the German government complained.

sourceString: On 17 March 2020, American pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with German company BioNTech to jointly develop a mRNA-based vaccine.
targetString: El 17 de marzo de 2020, la empresa farmacéutica estadounidense Pfizer anunció una asociación con la empresa alemana BioNTech para desarrollar conjuntamente una vacuna basada en ARNm.
en-mt: On March 17, 2020, the American pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with the German company BioNTech to co-develop an mRNA-based vaccine.

sourceString: mRNA-based vaccine candidate BNT162, currently in pre-clinical testing with clinical trials expected to begin in April 2020.
targetString: La posible vacuna basada en ARNm BNT162, actualmente está en pruebas preclínicas y se espera que los ensayos clínicos comiencen en abril de 2020.
en-mt: The potential BNT162 mRNA-based vaccine is currently in preclinical testing with clinical trials expected to begin in April 2020.

sourceString: In Italy on 17 March 2020, Takis Biotech, an Italian biotech company announced they will have pre-clinical testing results in April 2020 and their final vaccine candidate could begin human testing by fall.
targetString: En Italia, el 17 de marzo de 2020, Takis Biotech, una empresa de biotecnología italiana, anunció que tendrá los resultados de las pruebas preclínicas en abril de 2020 y que las pruebas en humanos de la posible vacuna final podrían comenzar en el otoño.
en-mt: In Italy, on March 17, 2020, Takis Biotech, an Italian biotechnology company, announced that it will have the results of preclinical tests in April 2020 and that human testing of the final vaccine candidate could begin in the fall.

sourceString: In France on 19 March 2020, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced a US$4.9 million investment in a COVID-19 vaccine research consortium involving the Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), and the University of Pittsburgh, bringing CEPI's total investment in COVID-19 vaccine development to US$29 million.
targetString: En Francia, el 19 de marzo de 2020, la Coalición para Innovaciones en la Preparación Epidémica (CEPI) anunció una inversión de USD 4,9 millones en una alianza de investigación de una vacuna contra la COVID-19 que incluye al Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Viena, Austria) y la Universidad de Pittsburgh, lo que lleva la inversión total de la CEPI para el desarrollo de una vacuna contra la COVID-19 a USD 29 millones.
en-mt: In France, on March 19, 2020, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced a $4.9 million investment in a COVID-19 vaccine research alliance that includes Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria) and the University of Pittsburgh, bringing CEPI's total investment for the development of a vaccine against COVID-19 to USD 29 million.

sourceString: CEPI's other investment partners for COVID-19 vaccine development are Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford, and the University of Queensland.
targetString: Los otros asociados de la CEPI para el desarrollo de una vacuna contra la COVID-19 son Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, la Universidad de Hong Kong, la Universidad de Oxford y la Universidad de Queensland.
en-mt: CEPI's other partners for the development of a vaccine against COVID-19 are Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford and the University of Queensland.

sourceString: On 20 March 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists have begun animal testing of six different vaccine candidates.
targetString: El 20 de marzo de 2020, los oficiales sanitarios rusos anunciaron que los científicos comenzaron las pruebas en animales de seis posibles vacunas.
en-mt: On March 20, 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists have begun animal testing of six potential vaccines.

sourceString: Imperial College London researchers announced on 20 March 2020 that they are developing a self-amplifying RNA vaccine for COVID-19.
targetString: Los investigadores del Colegio Imperial de Londres anunciaron el 20 de marzo de 2020 que estaban desarrollando una vacuna de ARN con autorreplicación contra la COVID-19.
en-mt: Researchers at Imperial College London announced on March 20, 2020 that they were developing a self-replicating RNA vaccine against COVID-19.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate was developed within 14 days of receiving the sequence from China.
targetString: La posible vacuna se desarrolló dentro de los 14 días de recibida la secuencia de China.
en-mt: The potential vaccine was developed within 14 days of receiving the sequence from China.

sourceString: In late March, the Canadian government announced C$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian companies and universities, such as the Medicago and University of Saskatchewan initiatives.
targetString: A fines de marzo, el Gobierno canadiense anunció una financiación de CAD 275 millones para 96 proyectos de investigación sobre medidas médicas para contrarrestar la COVID-19, lo que incluye una gran cantidad de posibles vacunas en empresas y universidades canadienses, como las iniciativas de Medicago y la Universidad de Saskatchewan.
en-mt: In late March, the Canadian government announced CAD 275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical measures to counter COVID-19, including a host of potential vaccines at Canadian companies and universities, including Medicago initiatives and the University of Saskatchewan.

sourceString: Around the same time, the Canadian government announced C$192 million specifically for developing a COVID-19 vaccine, with plans to establish a national "vaccine bank" of several new vaccines that could be used if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
targetString: Más o menos al mismo tiempo, el Gobierno canadiense anunció el uso de CAD 192 millones específicamente para desarrollar una vacuna contra la COVID-19, con planes de crear un "banco nacional de vacunas" con varias vacunas nuevas que podrían usarse si se produce otro brote de coronavirus.
en-mt: Around the same time, the Canadian government announced the use of CAD 192 million specifically to develop a vaccine against COVID-19, with plans to create a "national vaccine bank" with several new vaccines that could be used if another one is produced. coronavirus outbreak.

sourceString: On 2 April 2020, researchers at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine reported on testing of PittCoVacc, a possible COVID-19 vaccine in mice, stating that "MNA delivered SARS-CoV-2 S1 subunit vaccines elicited potent antigen-specific antibody responses [in the mice] that were evident beginning 2 weeks after immunization."
targetString: El 2 de abril de 2020, los investigadores de la Facultad de Medicina de la Universidad de Pittsburgh anunciaron las pruebas de PittCoVacc, una posible vacuna contra la COVID-19, en ratones y dijeron que "las vacunas de la subunidad S1 del SARS-CoV-2 administradas por MNA obtuvieron respuestas potentes de los anticuerpos específicos de los antígenos (en ratones) que fueron evidentes dos semanas después de la vacunación".
en-mt: On April 2, 2020, researchers at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine announced testing of PittCoVacc, a potential COVID-19 vaccine, in mice, saying that "SARS-CoV S1 subunit vaccines -2 administered by MNA elicited potent antigen-specific antibody responses (in mice) that were evident two weeks after vaccination."

sourceString: In Canada on 16 April 2020, the University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy announced design of a DNA-based vaccine candidate as a possible nasal spray.
targetString: En Canadá, el 16 de abril de 2020, la Facultad de Farmacia de la Universidad de Waterloo anunció el diseño de una posible vacuna basada en ADN como un probable pulverizador nasal.
en-mt: In Canada, on April 16, 2020, the University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy announced the design of a potential DNA-based vaccine as a probable nasal spray.

sourceString: Using bacteriophages, the DNA will be designed to replicate inside human bacteria to produce harmless virus-like particles, which may stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
targetString: Utilizando bacteriófagos, el ADN se designará para replicarse dentro de la bacteria humana y producir partículas inocuas similares al virus, que pueden estimular al sistema inmunitario para producir anticuerpos contra el virus SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Using bacteriophages, the DNA will be engineered to replicate within the human bacterium and produce harmless virus-like particles, which can stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

sourceString: In March 2020, the US government, industry, and three universities pooled resources to access supercomputers from IBM, combined with cloud computing resources from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, and Google.
targetString: En marzo de 2020, el Gobierno, el sector industrial y tres universidades de los EE. UU. reunieron recursos para acceder a las supercomputadoras de IBM, junto con recursos de computación en la nube de Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft y Google.
en-mt: In March 2020, the US government, industry, and three universities pooled resources to access IBM supercomputers, along with cloud computing resources from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, and Google.

sourceString: Some vaccines have heterologous effects, also called non-specific effects.
targetString: Algunas vacunas tienen efectos no específicos.
en-mt: Some vaccines have non-specific effects.

sourceString: That means they can have benefits beyond the disease they prevent.
targetString: Eso significa que pueden tener beneficios más allá de la enfermedad que previenen.
en-mt: That means they may have benefits beyond the disease they prevent.

sourceString: A further randomized trial in Australia is seeking to enrol 4,170 healthcare workers.
targetString: Otro ensayo aleatorizado en Australia busca inscribir 4170 trabajadores sanitarios.
en-mt: Another randomized trial in Australia seeks to enroll 4170 healthcare workers.

sourceString: It is possible vaccines in development will not be safe or effective.
targetString: Es posible que las vacunas que se están desarrollando no sean seguras o eficaces.
en-mt: Vaccines being developed may not be safe or effective.

sourceString: Early research to assess vaccine efficacy using COVID-19-specific animal models, such as ACE2-transgenic mice, other laboratory animals, and non-human primates, indicate a need for biosafety-level 3 containment measures for handling live viruses, and international coordination to ensure standardized safety procedures.
targetString: Las investigaciones iniciales para evaluar la eficacia de las vacunas con modelos animales específicos de la COVID-19, como el ratón transgénico que expresa la ECA2, otros animales de laboratorio y primates no humanos, ponen de manifiesto la necesidad de contar con medidas de contención de bioseguridad de nivel 3 para la manipulación de virus vivos y con coordinación internacional para garantizar los procedimientos de seguridad estandarizados.
en-mt: Initial investigations to evaluate the efficacy of vaccines with specific animal models of COVID-19, such as the transgenic mouse expressing ACE2, other laboratory animals, and non-human primates, highlight the need for containment measures. biosafety level 3 for the handling of live viruses and with international coordination to guarantee standardized safety procedures.

sourceString: Vaccines against SARS and MERS have been tested in non-human animal models.
targetString: Las vacunas contra el SRAG y el SROM se han probado en modelos animales no humanos.
en-mt: SARS and MERS vaccines have been tested in non-human animal models.

sourceString: As of 2020, there is no cure or protective vaccine for SARS that has been shown to be both safe and effective in humans.
targetString: Al 2020, no existe una cura o vacuna que proteja contra el SRAG que haya demostrado ser segura y efectiva en humanos.
en-mt: As of 2020, there is no cure or vaccine that protects against SARS that has been shown to be safe and effective in humans.

sourceString: According to research papers published in 2005 and 2006, the identification and development of novel vaccines and medicines to treat SARS was a priority for governments and public health agencies around the world.There is also no proven vaccine against MERS.
targetString: De acuerdo con publicaciones de investigación del 2005 al 2006, la identificación y el desarrollo de vacunas y medicamentos nuevos para tratar el SRAG era una prioridad para los Gobiernos y las agencias de salud pública en todo el mundo. Tampoco existe una vacuna confirmada contra el SROM.
en-mt: According to research publications from 2005 to 2006, the identification and development of new vaccines and drugs to treat SARS was a priority for governments and public health agencies around the world. There is also no confirmed vaccine against MERS.

sourceString: When MERS became prevalent, it was believed that existing SARS research may provide a useful template for developing vaccines and therapeutics against a MERS-CoV infection.
targetString: Cuando el SROM se generalizó, se creía que la investigación existente sobre el SRAG podría ser una plantilla útil para desarrollar vacunas y tratamientos contra la infección por MERS-CoV.
en-mt: When MERS became widespread, it was believed that existing SARS research could be a useful template for developing vaccines and treatments against MERS-CoV infection.

sourceString: As of March 2020, there was one (DNA based) MERS vaccine which completed phase I clinical trials in humans, and three others in progress, all of which are viral-vectored vaccines, two adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS,  BVRS-GamVac), and one MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).
