targetString: A marzo de 2020, una vacuna contra el SROM (basada en ADN) completó los ensayos clínicos en fase I en humanos, otras tres estaban en curso, todas las cuales son vacunas de vectores víricos, dos de vectores adenovíricos (ChAdOx1-MERS, BVRS-GamVac) y una de vector de MVA (MVA-MERS-S).
en-mt: As of March 2020, one MRS vaccine (DNA-based) has completed Phase I clinical trials in humans, three others are ongoing, all of which are viral vectored vaccines, two adenoviral vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS, BVRS -GamVac) and one of MVA vector (MVA-MERS-S).

sourceString: Social media posts have promoted a conspiracy theory claiming the virus behind COVID-19 was known and that a vaccine was already available.
targetString: Las publicaciones en los medios sociales promovieron una teoría conspirativa según la cual el virus causante de la COVID-19 era conocido y ya había una vacuna.
en-mt: Posts on social media promoted a conspiracy theory that the virus that causes COVID-19 was known and a vaccine was already available.

sourceString: The patents cited by various social media posts reference existing patents for genetic sequences and vaccines for other strains of coronavirus such as the SARS coronavirus.
targetString: Las patentes citadas por diversas publicaciones en medios sociales se refieren a patentes existentes para secuencias genéticas y vacunas para otras cepas de coronavirus, como el coronavirus del SRAG.
en-mt: The patents cited by various social media posts refer to existing patents for genetic sequences and vaccines for other coronavirus strains, such as the SARS coronavirus.

sourceString: b'Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: b'La enfermedad por coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) es una enfermedad infectocontagiosa ocasionada por el coronavirus del síndrome respiratorio agudo grave 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: b'Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.
targetString: Los síntomas comunes incluyen fiebre, tos y dificultad para respirar.
en-mt: Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.

sourceString: Other symptoms may include fatigue, muscle pain, diarrhea, sore throat, loss of smell, and abdominal pain.
targetString: Otros síntomas son fatiga, dolor muscular, diarrea, dolor de garganta, pérdida del olfato y dolor abdominal.
en-mt: Other symptoms are fatigue, muscle pain, diarrhea, sore throat, loss of smell, and abdominal pain.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: El tiempo que transcurre entre la exposición y el inicio de los síntomas suele ser de unos cinco días, pero puede variar entre dos y catorce días.
en-mt: The time between exposure and the onset of symptoms is usually about five days, but can vary from two to fourteen days.

sourceString: While the majority of cases result in mild symptoms, some progress to viral pneumonia and multi-organ failure.
targetString: Si bien la mayoría de los casos resultan en síntomas leves, algunos progresan a neumonía vírica e insuficiencia multiorgánica.
en-mt: Although most cases result in mild symptoms, some progress to viral pneumonia and multi-organ failure.

sourceString: As of 17 April 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported across 210 countries and territories, resulting in more than 153,000 deaths.
targetString: Al 17 de abril de 2020, se informaron más de 2,24 millones de casos en 210 países y territorios, con más de 153 000 muertes.
en-mt: As of April 17, 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported in 210 countries and territories, with more than 153,000 deaths.

sourceString: More than 568,000 people have recovered.The virus is primarily spread between people during close contact, often via small droplets produced by coughing, sneezing, or talking.
targetString: Más de 568 000 personas se han recuperado. El virus se propaga principalmente entre las personas durante el contacto estrecho, por lo general mediante gotitas que se producen al toser, estornudar o hablar.
en-mt: More than 568,000 people have recovered. The virus is spread mainly from person to person during close contact, usually through droplets produced by coughing, sneezing, or talking.

sourceString: While these droplets are produced when breathing out, they usually fall to the ground or onto surfaces rather than being infectious over long distances.
targetString: Si bien estas gotitas se producen al exhalar, usualmente caen al piso o sobre las superficies, en vez de ser contagiosas en distancias largas.
en-mt: Although these droplets are produced by exhalation, they usually fall to the floor or onto surfaces, rather than being contagious over long distances.

sourceString: People may also become infected by touching a contaminated surface and then touching their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: Las personas también se pueden contagiar por tocar una superficie contaminada y luego tocarse los ojos, la nariz o la boca.
en-mt: People can also get it by touching a contaminated surface and then touching their eyes, nose, or mouth.

sourceString: The virus can survive on surfaces up to 72 hours.
targetString: El virus puede sobrevivir en las superficies hasta 72 horas.
en-mt: The virus can survive on surfaces for up to 72 hours.

sourceString: It is most contagious during the first three days after the onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.The standard method of diagnosis is by real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) from a nasopharyngeal swab.
targetString: Es más contagioso durante los primeros tres días después del inicio de los síntomas, aunque la propagación también es posible antes de que aparezcan los síntomas y en etapas tardías de la enfermedad. El método estándar para el diagnóstico es la reacción en cadena de la polimerasa con transcripción inversa en tiempo real (rRT-PCR) de un hisopado nasofaríngeo.
en-mt: It is most contagious during the first three days after the onset of symptoms, although spread is also possible before symptoms appear and late in the disease. The standard method for diagnosis is real-time reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of a nasopharyngeal swab.

sourceString: The use of masks is recommended for those who suspect they have the virus and their caregivers.
targetString: Se recomienda el uso de mascarillas para quienes sospechan que tienen el virus y sus cuidadores.
en-mt: The use of masks is recommended for those suspected of having the virus and their caregivers.

sourceString: Recommendations for mask use by the general public vary, with some authorities recommending against their use, some recommending their use, and others requiring their use.
targetString: Las recomendaciones sobre el uso de las mascarillas para el público general varían. Algunas autoridades recomiendan que no se las use, otras recomiendan que sí se las use, mientras que otras exigen su uso.
en-mt: Recommendations on the use of masks for the general public vary. Some authorities recommend that they not be used, others recommend that they be used, while others require their use.

sourceString: Currently, there is no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: Actualmente, no existe una vacuna o un tratamiento antivírico específico contra la COVID-19.
en-mt: Currently, there is no specific vaccine or antiviral treatment against COVID-19.

sourceString: Local transmission of the disease has been recorded in most countries across all six WHO regions.
targetString: Se ha registrado la transmisión local de la enfermedad en la mayoría de los países de las seis regiones de la OMS.
en-mt: Local transmission of the disease has been reported in most countries in the six WHO regions.

sourceString: Those infected with the virus may be asymptomatic or develop flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.
targetString: Los que están infectados por el virus pueden ser asintomáticos o tener síntomas similares a los de la gripe, como fiebre, tos, fatiga y dificultad para respirar.
en-mt: Those who are infected with the virus may be asymptomatic or have flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.

sourceString: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.
targetString: Los síntomas de emergencia incluyen dificultad para respirar, dolor o presión persistente en el pecho, confusión, dificultad para caminar y rostro o labios azulados. Si se presentan estos síntomas, se recomienda buscar inmediatamente atención médica.
en-mt: Emergency symptoms include shortness of breath, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, trouble walking, and a bluish face or lips. If these symptoms occur, it is recommended to immediately seek medical attention.

sourceString: Less commonly, upper respiratory symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose or sore throat may be seen.
targetString: Es menos común observar síntomas en las vías respiratorias superiores, como estornudos, goteo nasal y dolor de garganta.
en-mt: It is less common to see upper respiratory symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose, and sore throat.

sourceString: Gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea have been observed in varying percentages.
targetString: Se han identificado síntomas gastrointestinales, como náuseas, vómitos y diarrea, en porcentajes variables.
en-mt: Gastrointestinal symptoms, such as nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea, have been identified in variable percentages.

sourceString: Some cases in China initially presented only with chest tightness and palpitations.
targetString: Algunos casos en China presentaron inicialmente opresión en el pecho y palpitaciones.
en-mt: Some cases in China initially presented with chest tightness and palpitations.

sourceString: In some, the disease may progress to pneumonia, multi-organ failure, and death.
targetString: En algunos, la enfermedad progresó a neumonía, insuficiencia multiorgánica y muerte.
en-mt: In some, the disease progressed to pneumonia, multiple organ failure, and death.

sourceString: This is called the incubation period.
targetString: Esto se denomina período de incubación.
en-mt: This is called the incubation period.

sourceString: The incubation period for COVID-19 is typically five to six days but may range from two to 14 days.
targetString: El período de incubación de la COVID-19 suele ser de cinco a seis días, pero puede variar de dos a catorce días.
en-mt: The incubation period for COVID-19 is typically five to six days, but can range from two to fourteen days.

sourceString: 97.5% of people who develop symptoms will do so within 11.5 days of infection.Reports indicate that not all who are infected develop symptoms.
targetString: El 97,5 % de las personas que tienen síntomas lo hacen dentro de los 11,5 días de la infección. Según los informes, no todos los infectados presentan síntomas.
en-mt: 97.5% of people who have symptoms do so within 11.5 days of infection. According to reports, not all those infected have symptoms.

sourceString: The role of these asymptomatic carriers in transmission is not yet fully known; however, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.
targetString: El papel de estos portadores asintomáticos todavía no se conoce plenamente; sin embargo, la evidencia preliminar sugiere que pueden contribuir a propagar la enfermedad.
en-mt: The role of these asymptomatic carriers is not yet fully understood; however, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.

sourceString: The proportion of infected people who do not display symptoms is currently unknown and being studied, with the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reporting that 20% of all confirmed cases remained asymptomatic during their hospital stay.
targetString: La proporción de las personas infectadas que no presentan síntomas se desconoce por el momento y se está estudiando. Los Centros para el Control y la Prevención de Enfermedades de Corea (KCDC) informaron que un 20 % de los casos confirmados siguieron asintomáticos durante la hospitalización.
en-mt: The proportion of infected people who have no symptoms is currently unknown and is being studied. The Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reported that 20% of confirmed cases remained asymptomatic during hospitalization.

sourceString: China's National Health Commission began including asymptomatic cases in its daily cases on 1 April; of the 166 infections on that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic at the time of testing.
targetString: La Comisión Nacional de Salud de China comenzó a incluir los casos asintomáticos en los casos diarios el 1 de abril. De las 166 infecciones de ese día, 130 (78 %) eran asintomáticas cuando se realizó la prueba.
en-mt: China's National Health Commission began including asymptomatic cases in daily cases on April 1. Of the 166 infections that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic when tested.

sourceString: Both sputum and saliva can carry large viral loads.
targetString: Tanto el esputo como la saliva pueden tener grandes cargas víricas.
en-mt: Both sputum and saliva can have high viral loads.

sourceString: Loud talking releases more droplets than normal talking.
targetString: Hablar en voz alta libera más gotitas que cuando se habla con un volumen normal.
en-mt: Speaking loudly releases more droplets than speaking at a normal volume.

sourceString: A study in Singapore found that an uncovered cough can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 meters (15 feet).
targetString: Un estudio en Singapur descubrió que no cubrirse la boca al toser puede hacer que las gotitas viajen 4,5 metros (15 pies).
en-mt: A study in Singapore found that not covering your mouth when you cough can cause droplets to travel 4.5 meters (15 feet).

sourceString: Though the virus is not generally airborne, the National Academy of Science has suggested that bioaerosol transmission may be possible and air collectors positioned in the hallway outside of people's rooms yielded samples positive for viral RNA.
targetString: Aunque el virus no suele ser de transmisión aérea, la Academia Nacional de Ciencias ha sugerido que la transmisión mediante aerosoles biológicos es posible e explicó que los colectores de aire en el pasillo fuera de los dormitorios de las personas dieron positivo en ARN vírico.
en-mt: Although the virus is not typically airborne, the National Academy of Sciences has suggested that transmission via biological aerosols is possible, explaining that air collectors in the hallway outside people's bedrooms tested positive for viral RNA.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolised and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: Algunos procedimientos médicos, como la intubación y la reanimación cardiopulmonar (RCP) pueden provocar la aerosolización de las secreciones respiratorias y, en consecuencia, la transmisión aérea.
en-mt: Some medical procedures, such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) can cause aerosolization of respiratory secretions and consequently airborne transmission.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread via feces, this risk is believed to be low.The virus is most contagious when people are symptomatic; while spread may be possible before symptoms emerge, the risk is low.
targetString: Si bien hay inquietudes sobre la posibilidad de que se propague por las heces, se cree que el riesgo es bajo. El virus es más contagioso cuando las personas tienen síntomas; aunque la propagación es posible antes del inicio de los síntomas, el riesgo es bajo.
en-mt: Although there are concerns about the possibility of it being spread in feces, the risk is thought to be low. The virus is most contagious when people have symptoms; although spread is possible before the onset of symptoms, the risk is low.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) says while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: El Centro Europeo para la Prevención y el Control de las Enfermedades (ECDC) explica que, aunque no está del todo claro la facilidad con la que se propaga, una persona generalmente infecta a dos o tres más. El virus sobrevive horas o días en las superficies.
en-mt: The European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) explains that although it is not entirely clear how easily it spreads, one person usually infects two or three others. The virus survives hours or days on surfaces.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for one day on cardboard, for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and for up to four hours on 99% copper.
targetString: Específicamente, el virus se detectó durante un día en el cartón, hasta tres días en el plástico (polipropileno) y el acero inoxidable (AISI 304), y hasta cuatro horas en productos con 99 % de cobre.
en-mt: Specifically, the virus was detected for one day on cardboard, up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and up to four hours on 99% copper products.

sourceString: This, however, varies depending on the humidity and temperature.
targetString: Sin embargo, esto varía según la humedad y la temperatura.
en-mt: However, this varies depending on humidity and temperature.

sourceString: Soap and detergent are also effective if correctly used; soap products degrade the virus' fatty protective layer, deactivating it, as well as freeing them from skin and other surfaces.
targetString: El jabón y el detergente también son efectivos si se los usa de la manera correcta. Los productos de jabón degradan la capa lipídica protectora del virus y lo desactivan, además de quitarlo de la piel y otras superficies.
en-mt: Soap and detergent are also effective if used correctly. Soap products break down the protective lipid layer of the virus and deactivate it, as well as removing it from the skin and other surfaces.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective.In a Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken a median of two days after the start of hospitalization.
targetString: Otras soluciones, como el cloruro de benzalconio y el glucanato de clorohexidina (un desinfectante quirúrgico), son menos efectivos. En un estudio de Hong Kong, se tomaron muestras de saliva en un promedio de dos días después del inicio de la hospitalización.
en-mt: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine glucanate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective. In a Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken an average of two days after the start of hospitalization.

sourceString: In five of six patients, the first sample showed the highest viral load, and the sixth patient showed the highest viral load on the second day tested.
targetString: En cinco de seis pacientes, la primera muestra tuvo la carga vírica más alta. En el caso del sexto paciente, la carga vírica más alta se observó en el segundo día de prueba.
en-mt: In five of six patients, the first sample had the highest viral load. In the case of the sixth patient, the highest viral load was observed on the second test day.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: El coronavirus del síndrome respiratorio agudo grave 2 (SARS-CoV-2) es un nuevo coronavirus de síndrome respiratorio agudo grave, que fue aislado por primera vez de tres personas con neumonía conectadas con un grupo de casos de enfermedad respiratoria aguda en Wuhan.
en-mt: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, which was first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to a cluster of acute respiratory disease cases in Wuhan.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.
targetString: Todas las características del nuevo virus SARS-CoV-2 se encuentran en los coronavirus de naturaleza relacionada.
en-mt: All the features of the new SARS-CoV-2 virus are found in coronaviruses of a related nature.

sourceString: Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: Fuera del cuerpo humano, el jabón doméstico mata al virus, ya que revienta su burbuja protectora. El SARS-CoV-2 está estrechamente relacionado con el SARS-CoV originario.
en-mt: Outside the human body, household soap kills the virus by bursting its protective bubble. SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the parent SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The lungs are the organs most affected by COVID-19 because the virus accesses host cells via the enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in the type II alveolar cells of the lungs.
targetString: Los pulmones son los órganos más afectados por la COVID-19, debido a que el virus ingresa a las células anfitrionas mediante la enzima convertidora de la angiotensina I tipo 2 (ECA2), que abunda más en las células alveolares de tipo II de los pulmones.
en-mt: The lungs are the organs most affected by COVID-19, as the virus enters host cells via angiotensin I converting enzyme type 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in type II alveolar cells of the lungs .

sourceString: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein called a "spike" (peplomer) to connect to ACE2 and enter the host cell.
targetString: El virus usa una glicoproteína superficial especial llamada "espícula" (peplómero) para conectarse con la ECA2 e ingresar a la célula anfitriona.
en-mt: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein called a "spicule" (peplomer) to connect with ACE2 and enter the host cell.

sourceString: Acute cardiac injury was found in 12% of infected people admitted in hospital in Wuhan, China, and is more frequent in severe disease.
targetString: En el 12 % de las personas infectadas hospitalizadas en Wuhan, China, se identificó una lesión cardíaca aguda, que es más frecuente en la enfermedad grave.
en-mt: Acute cardiac injury was identified in 12% of infected people hospitalized in Wuhan, China, which is more common in severe disease.

sourceString: Rates of cardiovascular symptoms is high, owing to the systemic inflammatory response and immune system disorders during disease progression, but acute myocardial injury may also be related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.
targetString: Las tasas de síntomas cardiovasculares son altas, a causa de la respuesta inflamatoria sistémica y los trastornos del sistema inmunitario durante la evolución de la enfermedad, pero la lesión aguda del miocardio puede estar relacionada con las ECA2 receptoras en el corazón.
en-mt: Cardiovascular symptom rates are high, due to systemic inflammatory response and immune system disturbances during the course of the disease, but acute myocardial injury may be related to receptor ACE2 in the heart.

sourceString: ACE2 receptors are highly expressed in the heart and are involved in heart function.
targetString: Las ECA2 receptoras tienen una expresión alta en el corazón y participan en su funcionamiento.
en-mt: Receptor ACE2s are highly expressed in the heart and participate in its functioning.

sourceString: A high incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) have been found in ICU patients with COVID-19 infections and may be related to poor prognosis.Autopsies of people who died of COVID-19 have found diffuse alveolar damage (DAD), and lymphocyte-containing inflammatory infiltrates within the lung.
targetString: Se detectó una incidencia alta de trombosis (31 %) y tromboembolia venosa (25 %) en pacientes en la UCI con infecciones por el virus de la COVID-19 y puede estar relacionada con un mal pronóstico. En las autopsias de las personas que fallecieron por la COVID-19, se detectaron daño alveolar difuso (DAD) e infiltrados inflamatorios con linfocitos en los pulmones.
en-mt: A high incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) was detected in ICU patients with COVID-19 virus infections and may be related to a poor prognosis. In autopsies of people who died from COVID-19, diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) and inflammatory infiltrates with lymphocytes were detected in the lungs.

sourceString: Although SARS-COV-2 has a tropism for ACE2-expressing epithelial cells of the respiratory tract, patients with severe COVID-19 have symptoms of systemic hyperinflammation.
targetString: Aunque el SARS-COV-2 tiene tropismo por las células epiteliales que expresan la ECA2 de las vías respiratorias, los pacientes con COVID-19 grave tienen síntomas de hiperinflamación sistémica.
en-mt: Although SARS-COV-2 has tropism for ACE2-expressing airway epithelial cells, patients with severe COVID-19 have symptoms of systemic hyperinflammation.

sourceString: In particular, pathogenic GM-CSF-secreting T-cells were shown to correlate with the recruitment of inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes and severe lung pathology in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: En particular, se observó que los linfocitos T secretores de GM-CSF patógenos se correlacionan con el reclutamiento de monocitos secretores de IL-6 y una patología pulmonar grave en los pacientes con COVID-19.
en-mt: In particular, pathogenic GM-CSF-secreting T cells were found to correlate with the recruitment of IL-6-secreting monocytes and severe lung pathology in COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Lymphocytic infiltrates have also been reported at autopsy.
targetString: En las autopsias, también se informaron infiltrados linfocíticos.
en-mt: At autopsies, lymphocytic infiltrates were also reported.

sourceString: The WHO has published several testing protocols for the disease.
targetString: La OMS ha publicado varios protocolos de prueba para detectar la enfermedad.
en-mt: The WHO has published several testing protocols to detect the disease.

sourceString: The standard method of testing is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: El método estándar de prueba es la reacción en cadena de la polimerasa con transcripción inversa en tiempo real (rRT-PCR).
en-mt: The standard test method is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test is typically done on respiratory samples obtained by a nasopharyngeal swab; however, a nasal swab or sputum sample may also be used.
targetString: La prueba se suele hacer en muestras de las vías respiratorias obtenidas mediante un hisopado nasofaríngeo; no obstante, también se pueden usar muestras de hisopados nasales o esputo.
en-mt: The test is usually done on airway samples obtained by nasopharyngeal swab; however, nasal swab or sputum samples may also be used.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to two days.
targetString: Por lo general, los resultados están disponibles entre unas pocas horas o dos días.
en-mt: Results are usually available within a few hours to two days.

sourceString: Blood tests can be used, but these require two blood samples taken two weeks apart and the results have little immediate value.
targetString: También se pueden usar análisis de sangre, pero se deben tomar dos muestras de sangre con dos semanas de diferencia y los resultados tienen muy poco valor inmediato.
en-mt: Blood tests can also be used, but two blood samples must be taken two weeks apart and the results have very little immediate value.

sourceString: Chinese scientists were able to isolate a strain of the coronavirus and publish the genetic sequence so laboratories across the world could independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect infection by the virus.
targetString: Los científicos chinos lograron aislar la cepa del coronavirus y publicaron la secuencia genética para que los laboratorios del mundo pudieran desarrollar de manera independiente pruebas de reacción en cadena de la polimerasa (PCR) para detectar la infección por el virus.
en-mt: Chinese scientists succeeded in isolating the coronavirus strain and published the genetic sequence so that laboratories around the world could independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect infection with the virus.

sourceString: As of 4 April 2020, antibody tests (which may detect active infections and whether a person had been infected in the past) were in development, but not yet widely used.
targetString: Al 4 de abril de 2020, las pruebas de anticuerpos (que pueden detectar infecciones activas y si la persona fue infectada en el pasado) se estaban desarrollando, pero no se las utilizaba ampliamente.
en-mt: As of April 4, 2020, antibody tests (which can detect active infections and whether a person has been infected in the past) were being developed but not widely used.

sourceString: The Chinese experience with testing has shown the accuracy is only 60 to 70%.
targetString: La experiencia en China con las pruebas ha demostrado que la precisión es tan solo del 60 al 70 %.
en-mt: Experience in China with testing has shown that the accuracy is only 60-70%.

sourceString: The FDA in the United States approved the first point-of-care test on 21 March 2020 for use at the end of that month.Diagnostic guidelines released by Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University suggested methods for detecting infections based upon clinical features and epidemiological risk.
targetString: La FDA en Estados Unidos aprobó la primera prueba de diagnóstico inmediato el 21 de marzo de 2020 para usarla a fines de ese mes. Las pautas de diagnóstico publicadas por el Hospital Zhongnan de la Universidad de Wuhan sugerían métodos para detectar infecciones con base en las características clínicas y el riesgo epidemiológico.
en-mt: The FDA in the United States approved the first point-of-care test on March 21, 2020 for use at the end of that month. Diagnostic guidelines published by the Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University suggested methods to detect infections based on clinical features and epidemiological risk.

sourceString: Bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution are common in early infection.
targetString: Las opacidades en vidrio esmerilado multilobulares bilaterales con una distribución periférica, asimétrica y posterior son comunes en las etapas iniciales de la infección.
en-mt: Bilateral multilobular ground-glass opacities with a peripheral, asymmetric, and posterior distribution are common in the early stages of infection.

sourceString: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving (lobular septal thickening with variable alveolar filling), and consolidation may appear as the disease progresses.
targetString: A medida que la enfermedad progresa, pueden aparecer dominio subpleural, patrón en empedrado desordenado (engrosamiento septal lobulillar con llenado alveolar variable) y consolidación.
en-mt: As the disease progresses, subpleural dominance, a disordered cobblestone pattern (lobular septal thickening with variable alveolar filling), and consolidation may appear.

sourceString: Few data are available about microscopic lesions and the pathophysiology of COVID-19.
targetString: Se encuentran disponibles pocos datos sobre las lesiones microscópicas y la fisiopatología de la COVID-19.
en-mt: Few data are available on the microscopic lesions and pathophysiology of COVID-19.

sourceString: The main pathological findings at autopsy are:
targetString: Los principales resultados patológicos de las autopsias son los siguientes:
en-mt: The main pathological results of the autopsies are the following:

sourceString: Macroscopy: pleurisy, pericarditis, lung consolidation and pulmonary oedema
targetString: Macroscopía: pleuritis, pericarditis, consolidación pulmonar y edema pulmonar
en-mt: Macroscopy: pleuritis, pericarditis, pulmonary consolidation and pulmonary edema

sourceString: Four types of severity of viral pneumonia can be observed:
targetString: Se pueden observar cuatro tipos de gravedad de la neumonía vírica:
en-mt: Four types of severity of viral pneumonia can be observed:

sourceString: mild pneumonia: pulmonary oedema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, large atypical pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation with lymphocytic infiltration and multinucleated giant cell formation
targetString: neumonía leve: edema pulmonar, hiperplasia de los neumocitos, neumocitos atípicamente grandes, inflamación intersticial con infiltración de linfocitos y formación de células gigantes con múltiples núcleos
en-mt: Mild pneumonia: pulmonary edema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, atypically large pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation with lymphocyte infiltration, and multinucleated giant cell formation

sourceString: severe pneumonia: diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) with diffuse alveolar exudates.
targetString: neumonía grave: daño alveolar difuso (DAD) con exudados alveolares difusos.
en-mt: severe pneumonia: diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) with diffuse alveolar exudates.

sourceString: DAD is the cause of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxemia.
targetString: El DAD es causante del síndrome de dificultad respiratoria aguda (SDRA) y de hipoxemia grave.
en-mt: DAD is the cause of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxemia.

sourceString: healing pneumonia: organisation of exudates in alveolar cavities and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis
targetString: neumonía en curación: organización de exudados en cavidades alveolares y fibrosis intersticial pulmonar
en-mt: healing pneumonia: organization of exudates in alveolar cavities and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis

sourceString: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction
targetString: Sangre: coagulación intravascular diseminada (CID); reacción leucoeritroblástica
en-mt: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction

sourceString: Preventive measures to reduce the chances of infection include staying at home, avoiding crowded places, washing hands with soap and water often and for at least 20 seconds, practising good respiratory hygiene and avoiding touching the eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: Las medidas preventivas para disminuir las posibilidades de infección incluyen quedarse en la casa, evitar los lugares con muchas personas, lavarse las manos con agua y jabón frecuentemente por, al menos, 20 segundos, tener una buena higiene respiratoria y evitar tocarse los ojos, la nariz o la boca sin haberse lavado las manos.
en-mt: Preventive measures to decrease the chances of infection include staying home, avoiding crowded places, frequent hand washing with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, good respiratory hygiene, and avoiding touching your eyes, nose or mouth without washing hands.

sourceString: The CDC recommends covering the mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing and recommends using the inside of the elbow if no tissue is available.
targetString: Los CDC recomiendan cubrirse la boca y la nariz con un pañuelo al toser o estornudar y, en caso de no tener pañuelos, usar la parte interna del codo.
en-mt: The CDC recommends covering your mouth and nose with a tissue when you cough or sneeze and, if you don't have a tissue, use the inside of your elbow.

sourceString: Proper hand hygiene after any cough or sneeze is encouraged.
targetString: Se recomienda una higiene apropiada de las manos después de toser o estornudar.
en-mt: Proper hand hygiene is recommended after coughing or sneezing.

sourceString: The CDC has recommended the use of cloth face coverings in public settings, in part to limit transmission by asymptomatic individuals.Social distancing strategies aim to reduce contact of infected persons with large groups by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel and cancelling large public gatherings.
targetString: Los CDC han recomendado el uso de tapabocas de tela en lugares públicos, uno de los motivos es limitar la transmisión por parte de personas asintomáticas. Las estrategias de distanciamiento social buscan reducir el contacto de las personas infectadas con grupos grandes cerrando escuelas y lugares de trabajo, restringiendo los viajes y cancelando las reuniones públicas multitudinarias.
en-mt: The CDC has recommended the use of cloth face coverings in public places, one reason being to limit transmission by asymptomatic people. Social distancing strategies seek to reduce contact of infected people with large groups by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel, and canceling large public gatherings.

sourceString: Distancing guidelines also include that people stay at least 6 feet (1.8 m) apart.
targetString: Las pautas de distanciamiento también indican que las personas deben mantener una distancia de 6 pies (1,8 m).
en-mt: The distancing guidelines also state that people should maintain a distance of 6 feet (1.8 m).

sourceString: There is no medication known to be effective at preventing COVID-19.As a vaccine is not expected until 2021 at the earliest, a key part of managing COVID-19 is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as "flattening the curve".
targetString: No hay un medicamento efectivo para prevenir la COVID-19. Como no se espera que haya una vacuna hasta el 2021, como muy pronto, una parte clave para controlar la COVID-19 consiste en tratar de prevenir el pico epidémico, lo que se conoce como "aplanar la curva".
en-mt: There is no effective medicine to prevent COVID-19. With a vaccine not expected until 2021 at the earliest, a key part of controlling COVID-19 is trying to prevent the peak of the epidemic, known as "flattening the curve."

sourceString: The CDC also recommends that individuals wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty, before eating and after blowing one's nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: Los CDC también recomiendan lavarse las manos frecuentemente con agua y jabón por, al menos, 20 segundos, en particular después de ir al baño o cuando las manos están visiblemente sucias, antes de comer y después de sonarse la nariz, toser o estornudar.
en-mt: The CDC also recommends frequent hand washing with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, particularly after using the bathroom or when hands are visibly dirty, before eating, and after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing.

sourceString: It further recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitiser with at least 60% alcohol, but only when soap and water are not readily available.For areas where commercial hand sanitisers are not readily available, the WHO provides two formulations for local production.
targetString: También recomiendan el uso de un desinfectante para manos a base de alcohol que tenga un mínimo de 60 % de alcohol, pero solo cuando no haya agua y jabón disponibles oportunamente. Para las áreas en las que los desinfectantes para manos no son fáciles de conseguir, la OMS brinda dos formulaciones para la producción local.
en-mt: They also recommend the use of an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that has a minimum of 60% alcohol, but only when soap and water are not readily available. For areas where hand sanitizers are not readily available, WHO provides two formulations for local production.

sourceString: In these formulations, the antimicrobial activity arises from ethanol or isopropanol.
targetString: En estas formulaciones, la actividad antimicrobiana resulta del etanol o el isopropanol.
en-mt: In these formulations, the antimicrobial activity results from ethanol or isopropanol.

sourceString: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help eliminate bacterial spores in the alcohol; it is "not an active substance for hand antisepsis".
targetString: El peróxido de hidrógeno se usa para ayudar a eliminar las esporas bacterianas en el alcohol; "no es una sustancia activa para la antisepsia de las manos".
en-mt: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help kill bacterial spores in alcohol; "It is not an active substance for hand antisepsis".

sourceString: Glycerol is added as a humectant.
targetString: El glicerol se agrega como humectante.
en-mt: Glycerol is added as a humectant.

sourceString: People are managed with supportive care, which may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and supporting other affected vital organs.
targetString: A los pacientes se les brinda atención de apoyo, que puede incluir rehidratación, oxigenoterapia y tratamiento para otros órganos vitales afectados.
en-mt: Patients are provided supportive care, which may include rehydration, oxygen therapy, and treatment for other affected vital organs.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that those who suspect they carry the virus wear a simple face mask.
targetString: Los CDC recomiendan que quienes sospechen que tienen el virus usen una mascarilla simple.
en-mt: The CDC recommends that those who suspect they have the virus wear a simple face mask.

sourceString: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to address the issue of respiratory failure, but its benefits are still under consideration.
targetString: Se ha usado la oxigenación por membrana extracorporal (OMEC) para abordar el problema de la insuficiencia respiratoria, pero los beneficios todavía se están analizando.
en-mt: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to address the problem of respiratory failure, but the benefits are still being explored.

sourceString: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet have been recommended to improve immunity.
targetString: Para mejorar la inmunidad, se han recomendado una higiene personal y un estilo de vida y una alimentación saludables.
en-mt: To enhance immunity, personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet have been recommended.

sourceString: Supportive treatments may be useful in those with mild symptoms at the early stage of infection.The WHO and Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations for taking care of people who are hospitalised with COVID-19.
targetString: Los tratamientos de apoyo pueden ser útiles para quienes tienen síntomas leves en la etapa inicial de la infección. La OMS y la Comisión Nacional de Salud de China han publicado recomendaciones para el cuidado de personas hospitalizadas con COVID-19.
en-mt: Supportive care can be helpful for those with mild symptoms early in the infection. The WHO and the National Health Commission of China have published recommendations for the care of people hospitalized with COVID-19.

sourceString: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the U.S. have compiled treatment recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.
targetString: Los intensivistas y los neumólogos en los EE. UU. compilaron las recomendaciones de varias agencias en un recurso gratuito, el IBCC.
en-mt: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the US have compiled recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.

sourceString: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: A abril de 2020, no existe un tratamiento específico para la COVID-19.
en-mt: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.

sourceString: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen for first-line use.
targetString: Para el tratamiento inicial de los síntomas, algunos profesionales médicos recomiendan el parecetamol (acetaminofeno), en lugar del ibuprofeno.
en-mt: For initial treatment of symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen), rather than ibuprofen.

sourceString: Precautions must be taken to minimise the risk of virus transmission, especially in healthcare settings when performing procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or hand ventilation.
targetString: Se deben tomar precauciones para minimizar el riesgo de la transmisión del virus, especialmente en los entornos de atención de la salud cuando se realizan procedimientos que pueden generar aerosoles, como la intubación o la ventilación manual.
en-mt: Precautions should be taken to minimize the risk of virus transmission, especially in healthcare settings when procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or manual ventilation, are performed.

sourceString: For healthcare professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) in addition to using standard precautions, contact precautions and airborne precautions.The CDC outlines the guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.
targetString: Los CDC recomiendan a los profesionales de la atención de la salud que cuidan a personas con COVID-19 colocar al paciente en una zona de aislamiento de infección aérea (AIIR), además de usar las precauciones estándares, las precauciones relativas al contacto y las precauciones para evitar la transmisión aérea. Los CDC destacan las pautas para el uso de equipo de protección personal (EPP) durante la pandemia.
en-mt: CDC recommends that health care professionals caring for people with COVID-19 place the patient in an Airborne Infection Isolation Area (AIIR), in addition to using Standard Precautions, Contact Precautions, and Safety Precautions. to prevent airborne transmission. The CDC highlights guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.

sourceString: The recommended gear is: PPE gown, respirator or facemask, eye protection, and medical gloves.When available, respirators (instead of facemasks) are preferred.
targetString: Los equipos recomendados son bata de EPP, mascarilla, anteojos protectores y guantes médicos. Cuando estén disponibles, se prefieren los respiradores (en lugar de las mascarillas).
en-mt: The recommended equipment is PPE gown, mask, protective glasses and medical gloves. When available, respirators (rather than facemasks) are preferred.

sourceString: N95 respirators are approved for industrial settings but the FDA has authorised the masks for use under an Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA).
targetString: Las mascarillas N95 están aprobadas para los entornos industriales, pero la FDA autorizó su uso mediante una autorización de uso urgente (EUA).
en-mt: N95 masks are approved for industrial settings, but the FDA authorized their use through an emergency use authorization (EUA).

sourceString: They are designed to protect from airborne particles like dust but effectiveness against a specific biological agent is not guaranteed for off-label uses.
targetString: Están diseñados para proteger contra las partículas que están en el aire, como el polvo, pero no se garantiza la efectividad contra un agente biológico específico que no está estipulado en las indicaciones del producto.
en-mt: They are designed to protect against airborne particles such as dust, but effectiveness against a specific biological agent not listed in the product directions is not guaranteed.

sourceString: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends using face shields or, as a last resort, homemade masks.
targetString: Cuando no haya mascarillas disponibles, los CDC recomiendan el uso de caretas protectoras o, como último recurso, mascarillas caseras.
en-mt: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends the use of face shields or, as a last resort, homemade masks.

sourceString: Most cases of COVID-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical ventilation or alternatives, but a percentage of cases are.
targetString: La mayoría de los casos de COVID-19 no son lo suficientemente graves para requerir ventilación mecánica o alternativas, pero un porcentaje de los casos sí lo son.
en-mt: Most COVID-19 cases are not severe enough to require mechanical or alternative ventilation, but a percentage of cases are.

sourceString: The type of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19 related respiratory failure is being actively studied for people in hospital, with some evidence that intubation can be avoided with a high flow nasal cannula or bi-level positive airway pressure.
targetString: Se está estudiando activamente este tipo de apoyo respiratorio para personas hospitalizadas con insuficiencia respiratoria relacionada con la COVIDA-19 y ya se tiene cierta evidencia de que la intubación puede evitarse con una cánula nasal de alto flujo o bipresión positiva en las vías respiratorias.
en-mt: This type of respiratory support for people hospitalized with COVID-19-related respiratory failure is being actively studied, and there is already some evidence that intubation can be avoided with a high-flow nasal cannula or positive airway pressure.

sourceString: Whether either of these two leads to the same benefit for people who are critically ill is not known.
targetString: Todavía no se sabe si alguno de estos dos brinda el mismo beneficio a las personas en estado crítico.
en-mt: It is not yet known if either of these two provide the same benefit to people in critical condition.

sourceString: Some doctors prefer staying with invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to a high flow nasal cannula.Severe cases are most common in older adults (those older than 60 years, and especially those older than 80 years).
targetString: Algunos médicos prefieren usar la ventilación mecánica invasiva cuando está disponible porque esta técnica limita la propagación de partículas de aerosoles en comparación con la cánula nasal de alto flujo. Los casos graves se dan principalmente en adultos mayores (los mayores de 60 años y, en particular, los mayores de 80 años).
en-mt: Some clinicians prefer to use invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to high-flow nasal cannula. Severe cases occur mainly in older adults (those over 60 years of age and, in particular, those over 80 years of age).

sourceString: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds per capita, which limits a health system's capacity to handle a sudden spike in the number of COVID-19 cases severe enough to require hospitalisation.
targetString: Muchos países desarrollados no tienen suficientes camas por cabeza en los hospitales, lo que limita la capacidad del sistema sanitario para manejar el aumento repentino de casos graves de COVID-19 que requieren hospitalización.
en-mt: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds per head, limiting the ability of the healthcare system to handle the surge in severe COVID-19 cases requiring hospitalization.

sourceString: One study in China found 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% needed mechanical support of ventilation, and 1.4% died.
targetString: Un estudio en China encontró que el 5 % era admitido a unidades de cuidado intensivo, el 2,3 % necesitaba el apoyo mecánico de la ventilación y el 1,4 % falleció.
en-mt: A study in China found that 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% needed mechanical support for ventilation, and 1.4% died.

sourceString: In China, approximately 30% of people in hospital with COVID-19 are eventually admitted to ICU.
targetString: En China, aproximadamente el 30 % de las personas hospitalizadas con COVID-19 finalmente se transfiere a la UCI.
en-mt: In China, approximately 30% of people hospitalized with COVID-19 are eventually transferred to the ICU.

sourceString: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complex as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.
targetString: La ventilación mecánica se vuelve más compleja cuando un paciente con COVID-19 presenta síndrome de dificultad respiratoria aguda (SDRA) y la oxigenación es cada vez más difícil.
en-mt: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complex when a patient with COVID-19 presents with acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and oxygenation is increasingly difficult.

sourceString: Ventilators capable of pressure control modes and high PEEP are needed to maximise oxygen delivery while minimising the risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.
targetString: Se necesitan respiradores que tengan diferentes modos de control de la presión y PPTE para maximizar el suministro de oxígeno, a la vez que se minimiza el riesgo de lesión pulmonar asociada con el respirador y neumotórax.
en-mt: Ventilators that have different modes of pressure control and PEEP are needed to maximize oxygen delivery while minimizing the risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.

sourceString: High PEEP may not be available on older ventilators.
targetString: Los respiradores más antiguos pueden no contar con PPTE alta.
en-mt: Older respirators may not have high PEEP.

sourceString: Research into potential treatments started in January 2020, and several antiviral drugs are in clinical trials.
targetString: La investigación sobre posibles tratamientos comenzó en enero de 2020 y varios fármacos antivíricos están en ensayos clínicos.
en-mt: Research into potential treatments began in January 2020, and several antiviral drugs are in clinical trials.

sourceString: Remdesivir appears to be the most promising.
targetString: El remdesivir parece ser el más prometedor.
en-mt: Remdesivir appears to be the most promising.

sourceString: Although new medications may take until 2021 to develop, several of the medications being tested are already approved for other uses or are already in advanced testing.
targetString: Aunque el desarrollo de los medicamentos nuevos puede demorar hasta el 2021, varios medicamentos que se están probando ya están aprobados para otros usos o están en pruebas avanzadas.
en-mt: Although development of new drugs may take until 2021, several drugs being tested are already approved for other uses or are in advanced testing.

sourceString: Antiviral medication may be tried in people with severe disease.
targetString: Los medicamentos antivíricos pueden probarse en personas con la enfermedad grave.
en-mt: Antiviral drugs may be tried in people with severe disease.

sourceString: The WHO recommended volunteers take part in trials of the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments.The FDA has granted temporary authorisation to convalescent plasma as an experimental treatment in cases where the person's life is seriously or immediately threatened.
targetString: La OMS recomienda a los voluntarios participar en ensayos de la eficacia y la seguridad de posibles tratamientos. La FDA otorgó una autorización temporal al plasma de convaleciente como tratamiento experimental en casos donde la vida de la persona está en riesgo serio e inmediato.
en-mt: The WHO recommends that volunteers participate in trials of the efficacy and safety of possible treatments. The FDA granted a temporary authorization to convalescent plasma as an experimental treatment in cases where the person's life is in serious and immediate danger.

sourceString: It has not undergone the clinical studies needed to show it is safe and effective for the disease.
targetString: No ha sido sometido a los estudios clínicos necesarios para demostrar si es seguro y efectivo para una enfermedad.
en-mt: It has not undergone the necessary clinical studies to show whether it is safe and effective for a disease.

sourceString: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.
targetString: En febrero de 2020, China lanzó una aplicación móvil para lidiar con el brote de la enfermedad.
en-mt: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.

sourceString: Users are asked to enter their name and ID number.
targetString: Los usuarios deben ingresar su nombre y número de identificación.
en-mt: Users must enter their name and identification number.

sourceString: The app is able to detect 'close contact' using surveillance data and therefore a potential risk of infection.
targetString: La aplicación puede detectar el "contacto estrecho" y, por lo tanto, un riesgo potencial de infección mediante datos de vigilancia.
en-mt: The app can detect "close contact" and thus a potential risk of infection using surveillance data.

sourceString: Every user can also check the status of three other users.
targetString: Cada usuario también puede controlar el estado de otros tres usuarios.
en-mt: Each user can also monitor the status of three other users.

sourceString: If a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-quarantine, it also alerts local health officials.Big data analytics on cellphone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used to track infected people and people whom they contacted in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.
targetString: Si se detecta un riesgo posible, la aplicación no solo recomienda el autoconfinamiento, sino que también alerta a los oficiales sanitarios locales. El análisis de los macrodatos de la información de los celulares, la tecnología de reconocimiento facial, el seguimiento de los teléfonos móviles y la inteligencia artificial se usan para rastrear a las personas infectadas y aquellas con las que estuvieron en contacto en Corea del Sur, Taiwán y Singapur.
en-mt: If a possible risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-isolation, but also alerts local health officials. Big data analysis of cell phone information, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used to track down infected people and those they came in contact with in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.

sourceString: In March 2020, the Israeli government enabled security agencies to track mobile phone data of people supposed to have coronavirus.
targetString: En marzo de 2020, el Gobierno israelí permitió a las agencias de seguridad rastrear los datos de los teléfonos móviles de las personas sospechadas de tener coronavirus.
en-mt: In March 2020, the Israeli government allowed security agencies to track the mobile phone data of people suspected of having coronavirus.

sourceString: The measure was taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who may come into contact with infected citizens.
targetString: La medida se tomó para reforzar la cuarentena y proteger a quienes pueden entrar en contacto con ciudadanos infectados.
en-mt: The measure was taken to reinforce the quarantine and protect those who may come into contact with infected citizens.

sourceString: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated phone location data with the German federal government agency, Robert Koch Institute, in order to research and prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: También en marzo de 2020, Deutsche Telekom compartió los datos resumidos de la localización de los teléfonos con la agencia gubernamental federal alemana, Robert Koch Institute, a fin de investigar y prevenir la propagación del virus.
en-mt: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared summary phone location data with the German federal government agency, the Robert Koch Institute, in order to investigate and prevent the spread of the virus.

sourceString: Russia deployed facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breakers.
targetString: Rusia implementó la tecnología de reconocimiento facial para detectar incumplimientos de la cuarentena.
en-mt: Russia has implemented facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breaches.

sourceString: Italian regional health commissioner Giulio Gallera said he has been informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people are continuing to move around anyway".
targetString: El comisionado de salud regional Giulio Gallera dijo que los operadores de telefonía móvil le han informado que "de todas formas, el 40 % de las personas siguen desplazándose".
en-mt: Regional health commissioner Giulio Gallera said mobile phone operators have informed him that "40% of people are still on the move anyway."

sourceString: German government conducted a 48 hours weekend hackathon with more than 42.000 participants.
targetString: El Gobierno alemán llevó a cabo una hackatón de fin de semana de 48 horas con más de 42 000 participantes.
en-mt: The German government held a 48-hour weekend hackathon with more than 42,000 participants.

sourceString: Also the president of Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, made a global call for creative solutions against the spread of coronavirus.
targetString: Además, el presidente de Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, realizó una solicitud mundial por soluciones creativas contra la propagación del coronavirus.
en-mt: In addition, Estonian President Kersti Kaljulaid made a global call for creative solutions against the spread of the coronavirus.

sourceString: Individuals may experience distress from quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment or fear of the infection itself.
targetString: Las personas pueden sentir angustia por la cuarentena, las restricciones de viaje y los efectos secundarios del tratamiento o temer a la infección en sí.
en-mt: People may be anxious about the quarantine, travel restrictions, and side effects of treatment, or fear the infection itself.

sourceString: BBC quoted Rory O'Connor in saying, "Increased social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and an economic downturn are a perfect storm to harm people's mental health and wellbeing."
targetString: La BBC citó a Rory O'Connor: "El creciente aislamiento social, la soledad, la ansiedad por la salud, el estrés y los problemas económicos son una tormenta perfecta para la salud mental y el bienestar de las personas".
en-mt: The BBC quoted Rory O'Connor: "Increasing social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and financial problems are a perfect storm for people's mental health and well-being."

sourceString: The disease may take a mild course with few or no symptoms, resembling other common upper respiratory diseases such as the common cold.
targetString: La enfermedad puede seguir una evolución leve con pocos o sin síntomas, por lo que se parecerá a otras enfermedades de las vías respiratorias superiores, como el resfriado común.
en-mt: The illness may follow a mild course with few or no symptoms, thus resembling other upper respiratory illnesses, such as the common cold.

sourceString: Mild cases typically recover within two weeks, while those with severe or critical diseases may take three to six weeks to recover.
targetString: Los casos leves suelen recuperarse dentro de las dos semanas, mientras que los graves o críticos pueden demorar de tres a seis semanas para hacerlo.
en-mt: Mild cases usually recover within two weeks, while severe or critical cases can take three to six weeks to do so.

sourceString: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for severe infection with COVID-19 based on data from other similar viruses, like SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 is lacking.In some people, COVID-19 may affect the lungs causing pneumonia.
targetString: Las mujeres embarazadas pueden correr el riesgo de contraer una infección grave por el virus de la COVID-19, de acuerdo con los datos de otros virus similares, como el virus del SRAG y el SROM, pero los datos de la COVID-19 son insuficientes. En algunas personas, la COVID-19 puede afectar los pulmones y causar neumonía.
en-mt: Pregnant women may be at risk of severe infection with the COVID-19 virus, based on data from other similar viruses, such as SARS and MERS, but data from COVID-19 are insufficient . In some people, COVID-19 can affect the lungs and cause pneumonia.

sourceString: In those most severely affected, COVID-19 may rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) causing respiratory failure, septic shock or multi-organ failure.
targetString: En los casos de más gravedad, la COVID-19 puede progresar rápidamente al síndrome de dificultad respiratoria agua (SDRA) que causa insuficiencia respiratoria, choque séptico e insuficiencia multiorgánica.
en-mt: In the most severe cases, COVID-19 can rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) causing respiratory failure, septic shock, and multi-organ failure.

sourceString: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, abnormal clotting and damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.
targetString: Las complicaciones asociadas con la COVID-19 incluyen sepsis, alteración de la coagulación y daño cardíaco, renal y hepático.
en-mt: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, coagulation disorders, and heart, kidney, and liver damage.

sourceString: Clotting abnormalities, specifically an increase in prothrombin time, have been described in 6% of those admitted to hospital with COVID-19, while abnormal kidney function is seen in 4% of this group.
targetString: La alteración de la coagulación, específicamente el aumento del tiempo de protombina, se ha señalado en el 6 % de los pacientes hospitalizados con COVID-19; mientras que la alteración de la función renal se observa en el 4 % de este grupo.
en-mt: Coagulation abnormality, specifically increased prothrombin time, has been reported in 6% of hospitalized patients with COVID-19; while the alteration of renal function is observed in 4% of this group.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of people who present with COVID-19 demonstrate elevated liver enzymes (transaminases).
targetString: Aproximadamente entre el 20 y el 30 % de las personas con CODIV-19 tienen enzimas hepáticas (aminotransferasas) elevadas.
en-mt: Approximately 20-30% of people with CODIV-19 have elevated liver enzymes (aminotransferases).

sourceString: According to the same report, the median time between onset of symptoms and death was ten days, with five being spent hospitalised.
targetString: Según el mismo informe, el tiempo medio entre el inicio de los síntomas y la muerte fue de diez días, con cinco días de hospitalización.
en-mt: According to the same report, the median time between the onset of symptoms and death was ten days, with five days of hospitalization.

sourceString: However, patients transferred to an ICU had a median time of seven days between hospitalisation and death.
targetString: Sin embargo, para los pacientes transferidos a la UCI, transcurrió un tiempo medio de siete días entre la hospitalización y la muerte.
en-mt: However, for patients transferred to the ICU, a median time of seven days elapsed between hospitalization and death.

sourceString: In a study of early cases, the median time from exhibiting initial symptoms to death was 14 days, with a full range of six to 41 days.
targetString: En un estudio de casos incipientes, el tiempo medio desde la manifestación de los primeros síntomas hasta la muerte fue de 14 días, con un intervalo completo de 6 a 41 días.
en-mt: In a study of early cases, the median time from first symptom onset to death was 14 days, with a full range of 6 to 41 days.

sourceString: In a study by the National Health Commission (NHC) of China, men had a death rate of 2.8% while women had a death rate of 1.7%.
targetString: En un estudio de la Comisión Nacional de Salud (NHC) de China, la tasa de mortalidad entre los varones fue del 2,8 % y en entre las mujeres fue del 1,7 %.
en-mt: In a study by the National Health Commission (NHC) of China, the mortality rate among men was 2.8% and among women it was 1.7%.

sourceString: Histopathological examinations of post-mortem lung samples show diffuse alveolar damage with cellular fibromyxoid exudates in both lungs.
targetString: Los exámenes histopatológicos de muestras postmortem de los pulmones muestran daño alveolar difuso con exudados fibromixoides celulares en ambos pulmones.
en-mt: Histopathological examinations of postmortem samples from the lungs show diffuse alveolar damage with cellular fibromyxoid exudates in both lungs.

sourceString: Viral cytopathic changes were observed in the pneumocytes.
targetString: Se observaron cambios citopáticos víricos en los neumocitos.
en-mt: Viral cytopathic changes were observed in the pneumocytes.

sourceString: The lung picture resembled acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: La imagen de los pulmones se asemejaba al síndrome de dificultad respiratoria aguda (SDRA).
en-mt: The picture of the lungs resembled acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).

sourceString: In 11.8% of the deaths reported by the National Health Commission of China, heart damage was noted by elevated levels of troponin or cardiac arrest.
targetString: En el 11,8 % de las muertes informadas por la Comisión Nacional de Salud de China, el daño cardíaco resultó de niveles elevados de troponina o paro cardíaco.
en-mt: In 11.8% of deaths reported by China's National Health Commission, heart damage resulted from elevated troponin levels or cardiac arrest.

sourceString: According to March data from the United States, 89% of those hospitalised had preexisting conditions.Availability of medical resources and the socioeconomics of a region may also affect mortality.
targetString: Según los datos de marzo de los Estados Unidos, el 89 % de las personas hospitalizadas tenían una afección preexistente. La disponibilidad de recursos médicos y los aspectos socioeconómicos de una región también pueden afectar la mortalidad.
en-mt: According to March data from the United States, 89% of people hospitalized had a pre-existing condition. The availability of medical resources and the socioeconomic aspects of a region can also affect mortality.

sourceString: Estimates of the mortality from the condition vary because of those regional differences, but also because of methodological difficulties.
targetString: Las estimaciones de la mortalidad por la afección varían debido a esas diferencias regionales, pero también por dificultades metodológicas.
en-mt: Estimates of mortality from the condition vary due to these regional differences, but also due to methodological difficulties.

sourceString: The under-counting of mild cases can cause the mortality rate to be overestimated.
targetString: El recuento insuficiente de los casos leves puede hacer que la tasa de mortalidad esté sobrestimada.
en-mt: Undercounting of mild cases may cause the mortality rate to be overestimated.

sourceString: However, the fact that deaths are the result of cases contracted in the past can mean the current mortality rate is underestimated.
targetString: Sin embargo, el hecho de que las muertes sean el resultado de casos contraídos en el pasado puede indicar que la tasa de mortalidad actual está subestimada.
en-mt: However, the fact that the deaths are the result of cases contracted in the past may indicate that the current mortality rate is underestimated.

sourceString: Smokers were 1.4 times more likely to have severe symptoms of COVID-19 and approximately 2.4 times more likely to require intensive care or die compared to non-smokers.Concerns have been raised about long-term sequelae of the disease.
targetString: Los fumadores tenían 1,4 veces más posibilidades de padecer síntomas graves de la COVID-19 y aproximadamente 2,4 veces más posibilidades de necesitar cuidados intensivos o fallecer en comparación con los no fumadores. Preocupan las secuelas a largo plazo de esta enfermedad.
en-mt: Smokers were 1.4 times more likely to have severe COVID-19 symptoms and approximately 2.4 times more likely to require intensive care or die compared with non-smokers. There is concern about the long-term sequelae of this disease.

sourceString: The Hong Kong Hospital Authority found a drop of 20% to 30% in lung capacity in some people who recovered from the disease, and lung scans suggested organ damage.
targetString: La Autoridad de Hospitales de Hong Kong encontró una disminución del 20 al 30 % de la capacidad pulmonar en algunas personas que se recuperaron de la enfermedad, y las imágenes de los pulmones sugieren afectación de los órganos.
en-mt: The Hong Kong Hospital Authority found a 20-30% decrease in lung capacity in some people who recovered from the disease, and imaging of the lungs suggests organ involvement.

sourceString: This may also lead to post-intensive care syndrome following recovery.
targetString: Esto también puede causar el síndrome pos cuidados intensivos después de la recuperación.
en-mt: This can also cause post-critical care syndrome after recovery.

sourceString: As of March 2020, it was unknown if past infection provides effective and long-term immunity in people who recover from the disease.
targetString: A marzo de 2020, se desconocía si las infecciones anteriores generaban una inmunidad efectiva a largo plazo en las personas que se recuperaron de la enfermedad.
en-mt: As of March 2020, it was not known whether previous infections generated effective long-term immunity in people who recovered from the disease.

sourceString: Immunity is seen as likely, based on the behaviour of other coronaviruses, but cases in which recovery from COVID-19 have been followed by positive tests for coronavirus at a later date have been reported.
targetString: Pareciera que la inmunidad es posible, con base en el comportamiento de otros coronavirus, pero se han informado casos recuperados de la COVID-19 que posteriormente dieron positivo en coronavirus.
en-mt: It would appear that immunity is possible, based on the behavior of other coronaviruses, but recovered cases of COVID-19 who subsequently tested positive for coronavirus have been reported.

sourceString: These cases are believed to be worsening of a lingering infection rather than re-infection.
targetString: Se cree que estos casos son un empeoramiento de una infección persistente y no una reinfección.
en-mt: These cases are thought to be a worsening of a persistent infection and not a reinfection.

sourceString: The virus is thought to be natural and have an animal origin, through spillover infection.
targetString: Se considera que este virus es natural y de origen animal, mediante una infección interespecífica.
en-mt: This virus is considered to be natural and of animal origin, through interspecific infection.

sourceString: The actual origin is unknown, but by December 2019 the spread of infection was almost entirely driven by human-to-human transmission.
targetString: No se conoce el origen real, pero, para diciembre de 2019, la propagación de la infección se debía casi completamente a la transmisión entre humanos.
en-mt: The actual origin is not known, but as of December 2019, the spread of the infection was almost entirely due to human-to-human transmission.

sourceString: A study of the first 41 cases of confirmed COVID-19, published in January 2020 in The Lancet, revealed the earliest date of onset of symptoms as 1 December 2019.
targetString: Un estudio de los primeros 41 casos confirmados de la COVID-19, publicado en enero de 2020 en The Lancet, señaló como la primera fecha del inicio de los síntomas al 1 de diciembre de 2019.
en-mt: A study of the first 41 confirmed cases of COVID-19, published in January 2020 in The Lancet, indicated December 1, 2019 as the first date of onset of symptoms.

sourceString: Official publications from the WHO reported the earliest onset of symptoms as 8 December 2019.
targetString: Publicaciones oficiales de la OMS informaron que la primera manifestación de los síntomas era el 8 de diciembre de 2019.
en-mt: Official WHO publications reported that the first manifestation of symptoms was on December 8, 2019.

sourceString: Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: En general, se toman varias medidas para cuantificar la mortalidad.
en-mt: In general, several measures are taken to quantify mortality.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak and population characteristics such as age, sex and overall health.
targetString: Estas cifras varían por región y en el tiempo, además de verse afectadas por el volumen de las pruebas, la calidad del sistema sanitario, las opciones de tratamiento, el tiempo transcurrido desde el brote inicial y las características de la población, como la edad, el sexo y la salud general.
en-mt: These numbers vary by region and over time, as well as being affected by the volume of testing, the quality of the healthcare system, treatment options, the time elapsed since the initial outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, sex and general health.

sourceString: In late 2019, WHO assigned the emergency ICD-10 disease codes U07.1 for deaths from lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and U07.2 for deaths from clinically or epidemiologically diagnosed COVID-19 without lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: A fines del 2019, la OMS asignó los códigos de enfermedades CIE-10 de emergencia U07.1 a las muertes con confirmación de laboratorio de infección por SARS-CoV-2 y U07.2 a las muertes con un diagnóstico clínico o epidemiológico de COVID-19 sin confirmación de laboratorio de infección por SARS-CoV-2. La tasa de letalidad refleja la cantidad de muertes dividida por la cantidad de casos diagnosticados en un intervalo temporal determinado.
en-mt: In late 2019, the WHO assigned emergency ICD-10 disease codes U07.1 to deaths with laboratory confirmation of SARS-CoV-2 infection and U07.2 to deaths with a clinical or epidemiological diagnosis of COVID -19 without laboratory confirmation of SARS-CoV-2 infection. The case fatality rate reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of cases diagnosed in a given time interval.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) as of 17 April 2020.
targetString: Con base en las estadísticas de la Universidad Johns Hopkins, la tasa de letalidad global es del 6,9 % (153 822/2 240 191) al 17 de abril de 2020.
en-mt: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global case fatality rate is 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) as of April 17, 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed individuals who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected individuals (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: La cifra varía por región. Otras medidas incluyen la tasa de letalidad en pacientes diagnosticados (CFR), que refleja el porcentaje de personas diagnosticadas que mueren de una enfermedad, y la tasa de letalidad en personas infectadas, que refleja el porcentaje de personas infectadas (con o sin un diagnóstico) que mueren de una enfermedad.
en-mt: The figure varies by region.
