Other measures include the diagnosed case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percentage of people diagnosed who die of a disease, and the case fatality rate in infected people, which reflects the percentage of people infected (with or without a diagnosis). who die of a disease.

sourceString: These statistics are not time bound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: Estas estadísticas no dependen del tiempo y siguen a una población específica desde la infección hasta la resolución de los casos.
en-mt: These statistics do not depend on time and follow a specific population from infection to case resolution.

sourceString: While not all infected people develop antibodies, the presence of antibodies may provide information about how many people have been infected.
targetString: Si bien no todas las personas infectadas producen anticuerpos, la presencia de estos puede brindar información sobre cuántas personas se infectaron.
en-mt: Although not all infected people make antibodies, the presence of antibodies can provide information about how many people were infected.

sourceString: In the epicentre of the outbreak in Italy, Castiglione d'Adda, a small village of 4600, 80 (1.7%) are already dead.
targetString: En el epicentro del brote en Italia, Castiglione d'Adda, una pequeña villa de 4600 habitantes, 80 (1,7 %) ya fallecieron.
en-mt: In the epicenter of the outbreak in Italy, Castiglione d'Adda, a small town of 4,600 inhabitants, 80 (1.7%) have already died.

sourceString: In Gangelt, the disease was spread by Carnival festivals, and spread to younger people, causing a relatively lower mortality, and not all COVID-19 deaths may have been formally classified as such.
targetString: En Gangelt, le enfermedad se propagó durante los festivales de carnaval y afectó a los más jóvenes, por lo cual hubo una mortalidad relativamente baja, y es posible que no todas las muertes por COVID-19 se hayan clasificado como tales.
en-mt: In Gangelt, the disease spread during carnival festivals and affected the very young, resulting in relatively low mortality, and not all COVID-19 deaths may have been classified as such.

sourceString: Furthermore, the German health system has not been overwhelmed.
targetString: Es más, el sistema de salud alemán no se ha visto sobrepasado.
en-mt: Furthermore, the German healthcare system has not been overwhelmed.

sourceString: In the Netherlands, about 3% may have antibodies, as assessed from blood donors.
targetString: En los Países Bajos, cerca del 3 % de la población tiene anticuerpos, según se determinó de los donantes de sangre.
en-mt: In the Netherlands, about 3% of the population have antibodies, as determined from blood donors.

sourceString: 69 (0.004% of the population) have been confirmed to have died from COVID-19.
targetString: Se ha confirmado que 69 (0,004 % de la población) murieron por la COVID-19.
en-mt: It has been confirmed that 69 (0.004% of the population) died from COVID-19.

sourceString: The impact of the pandemic and its mortality rate are different for men and women.
targetString: El impacto de la pandemia y la tasa de mortalidad son diferentes para los varones y las mujeres.
en-mt: The impact of the pandemic and the mortality rate are different for men and women.

sourceString: Mortality is higher in men in studies conducted in China and Italy.
targetString: La mortalidad es más alta entre los varones en los estudios realizados en China e Italia.
en-mt: Mortality is higher among men in studies conducted in China and Italy.

sourceString: The highest risk for men is in their 50s, with the gap between men and women closing only at 90.
targetString: El mayor riesgo de los varones es para aquellos que están en sus 50, y la brecha entre varones y mujeres se achica solamente a los 90 años.
en-mt: The greatest risk for men is for those in their 50s, and the gap between men and women narrows only at age 90.

sourceString: In China, the death rate was 2.8 percent for men and 1.7 percent for women.
targetString: En China, la tasa de mortalidad fue del 2,8 en los varones y del 1,7 en las mujeres.
en-mt: In China, the death rate was 2.8 for men and 1.7 for women.

sourceString: The exact reasons for this sex-difference is not known, but genetic and behavioural factors could be a reason.
targetString: No se conocen los motivos exactos para esta diferencia por sexo, pero podría deberse a factores genéticos y conductuales.
en-mt: The exact reasons for this gender difference are not known, but it could be due to genetic and behavioral factors.

sourceString: Sex-based immunological differences, lesser prevalence of smoking in women and men developing co-morbid conditions such as hypertension at a younger age than women could have contributed to the higher mortality in men.
targetString: Las diferencias inmunológicas basadas en el sexo, la menor cantidad de mujeres que fuman y el hecho de que los varones tienen afecciones comórbidas, como hipertensión, a una edad más temprana podrían haber contribuido a la tasa de mortalidad más alta en los varones.
en-mt: Immunologic differences based on sex, fewer women smoking, and the fact that men have comorbid conditions, such as hypertension, at a younger age might have contributed to the higher mortality rate in men.

sourceString: In Europe, 57% of the infected individuals were men and 72% of those died with COVID-19 were men.
targetString: En Europa, el 57 % de las personas infectadas eran varones y el 72 % de los fallecidos por la COVID-19 eran varones.
en-mt: In Europe, 57% of infected people were men and 72% of those who died from COVID-19 were men.

sourceString: As of April 2020, the US government is not tracking sex-related data of COVID-19 infections.
targetString: A abril de 2020, el Gobierno de los EE. UU. no rastrea información sobre el sexo en las infecciones por el virus de la COVID-19.
en-mt: As of April 2020, the US Government does not track information about gender in COVID-19 virus infections.

sourceString: Research has shown that viral illnesses like Ebola, HIV, influenza and SARS affect men and women differently.
targetString: Las investigaciones muestran que las enfermedades víricas, como el Ébola, el VIH, la influenza y el SRAG, afectan a los varones y a las mujeres de manera diferente.
en-mt: Research shows that viral diseases, such as Ebola, HIV, influenza, and SARS, affect men and women differently.

sourceString: A higher percentage of health workers, particularly nurses, are women, and they have a higher chance of being exposed to the virus.
targetString: Un porcentaje mayor de trabajadores sanitarios, en particular el personal de enfermería, son mujeres, y tienen más posibilidades de exposición al virus.
en-mt: A higher percentage of health workers, particularly nurses, are women, and they are more likely to be exposed to the virus.

sourceString: The World Health Organization announced on 11 February 2020 that the official name of the disease would be "COVID-19".
targetString: La Organización Mundial de la Salud anunció el 11 de febrero de 2020 que el nombre oficial de la enfermedad sería "COVID-19".
en-mt: The World Health Organization announced on February 11, 2020 that the official name of the disease would be "COVID-19".

sourceString: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus explained that CO stands for corona, VI for virus, D for disease, and 19 for when the outbreak was first identified: 31 December 2019.
targetString: El jefe de la OMS Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus explicó que CO se refiere a corona, VI a virus, D a enfermedad y 19 a la fecha en que se descubrió el brote: 31 de diciembre de 2019.
en-mt: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus explained that CO refers to corona, VI to virus, D to disease, and 19 to the date the outbreak was discovered: December 31, 2019.

sourceString: The name had been chosen to avoid references to a specific geographical location (e.g. China), animal species or group of people, in line with international recommendations for naming aimed at preventing stigmatisation.The virus that causes COVID-19 is named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: El nombre se eligió para evitar las referencias a una ubicación geográfica específica (p. ej., China), especie animal o grupo de personas, en consonancia con las recomendaciones internacionales sobe denominación para prevenir la estigmatización. El virus que causa la COVID-19 se llama coronavirus del síndrome respiratorio agudo grave 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: The name was chosen to avoid references to a specific geographic location (eg, China), animal species, or group of people, in line with international naming recommendations to prevent stigma. The virus that causes COVID-19 is called severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: The WHO additionally uses "the COVID-19 virus" and "the virus responsible for COVID-19" in public communications.
targetString: La OMS utiliza, además, "el virus de la COVID-19" y "el virus responsable de la COVID-19" en las comunicaciones públicas.
en-mt: The WHO also uses "the COVID-19 virus" and "the virus responsible for COVID-19" in public communications.

sourceString: Both the disease and virus are commonly referred to as "coronavirus".
targetString: Es común que se utilice "coronavirus" para referirse tanto a la enfermedad como al virus.
en-mt: It is common for "coronavirus" to be used to refer to both the disease and the virus.

sourceString: During the initial outbreak in Wuhan, China, the virus and disease were commonly referred to as "coronavirus" and "Wuhan coronavirus".
targetString: Durante el brote inicial en Wuhan, China, era común que se hiciera referencia al virus y la enfermedad como "coronavirus" y "coronavirus de Wuhan".
en-mt: During the initial outbreak in Wuhan, China, it was common for the virus and illness to be referred to as "coronavirus" and "Wuhan coronavirus."

sourceString: In January 2020, WHO recommended 2019-nCov and 2019-nCoV acute respiratory disease as interim names for the virus and disease in accordance with 2015 guidance against using locations in disease and virus names.
targetString: En enero de 2020, la OMS recomendó 2019-nCov y enfermedad respiratoria agua por 2019-nCoV como nombres temporales para el virus y la enfermedad, de conformidad con la indicación del 2015 de no usar ubicaciones en el nombre de virus y enfermedades.
en-mt: In January 2020, WHO recommended 2019-nCov and 2019-nCoV acute respiratory disease as temporary names for the virus and disease, in line with the 2015 guidance not to use locations in virus and disease names.

sourceString: The official names COVID-19 and SARS-CoV-2 were issued on 11 February 2020.
targetString: Los nombres oficiales COVID-19 y SARS-CoV-2 se emitieron el 11 de febrero de 2020.
en-mt: The official names COVID-19 and SARS-CoV-2 were issued on February 11, 2020.

sourceString: Due to capacity limitations in the standard supply chains, some digital manufacturers are printing healthcare material such as nasal swabs and ventilator parts.
targetString: Debido a las limitaciones de capacidad en las cadenas de suministro estándares, algunos fabricantes digitales están imprimiendo material de salud, como hisopos nasales y partes de respiradores.
en-mt: Due to capacity constraints in standard supply chains, some digital manufacturers are printing healthcare supplies such as nasal swabs and respirator parts.

sourceString: In one example, when an Italian hospital urgently required a ventilator valve, and the supplier was unable to deliver in the timescale required, a local startup reverse-engineered and printed the required 100 valves overnight.
targetString: Por ejemplo, cuando un hospital italiano necesitó de urgencia la válvula de un respirador y el proveedor no podía entregarla en el tiempo requerido, una empresa emergente local realizó ingeniería inversa e imprimió las 100 válvulas necesarias durante la noche.
en-mt: For example, when an Italian hospital urgently needed a respirator valve and the supplier couldn't deliver it in the required time, a local start-up reverse-engineered and printed the 100 needed valves overnight.

sourceString: After the initial outbreak of COVID-19, conspiracy theories, misinformation and disinformation emerged regarding the origin, scale, prevention, treatment and other aspects of the disease and rapidly spread online.
targetString: Después del brote inicial de la COVID-19, surgieron teorías de conspiración, información falsa y desinformación sobre el origen, la escala, la prevención, el tratamiento y otros aspectos de la enfermedad que se propagaron rápidamente por Internet.
en-mt: After the initial outbreak of COVID-19, conspiracy theories, misinformation, and misinformation about the origin, scale, prevention, treatment, and other aspects of the disease spread rapidly across the Internet.

sourceString: Humans appear to be capable of spreading the virus to some other animals.
targetString: Pareciera que los humanos pueden transmitir el virus a algunos otros animales.
en-mt: It appears that humans can transmit the virus to some other animals.

sourceString: The study failed to find evidence of viral replication in pigs, ducks, and chickens.
targetString: El estudio no encontró evidencia de replicación vírica en cerdos, patos ni pollos.
en-mt: The study found no evidence of viral replication in pigs, ducks, or chickens.

sourceString: No medications or vaccine is approved to treat the disease.
targetString: No hay medicamentos ni vacunas aprobados para tratar la enfermedad.
en-mt: There are no drugs or vaccines approved to treat the disease.

sourceString: International research on vaccines and medicines in COVID-19 are underway by government organisations, academic groups and industry researchers.
targetString: Organizaciones gubernamentales, grupos académicos e investigadores del sector están llevando a cabo investigaciones internacionales sobre las vacunas y los medicamentos para la COVID-19.
en-mt: Government organizations, academic groups, and industry researchers are conducting international research on vaccines and medicines for COVID-19.

sourceString: In March, the World Health Organization initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
targetString: En marzo, la Organización Mundial de la Salud inició el "Ensayo SOLIDARIDAD" para evaluar los efectos terapéuticos de los cuatro compuestos antivíricos existentes más prometedores en cuanto a eficacia.
en-mt: In March, the World Health Organization initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" to evaluate the therapeutic effects of the four most promising existing antiviral compounds in terms of efficacy.

sourceString: There is no available vaccine, but various agencies are actively developing vaccine candidates.
targetString: No existe una vacuna, pero varias agencias están desarrollando activamente posibles vacunas.
en-mt: There is no vaccine, but several agencies are actively developing possible vaccines.

sourceString: Previous work on SARS-CoV is being utilised because SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 both use the ACE2 receptor to enter human cells.
targetString: Se está utilizando el trabajo anterior sobre el SARS-CoV porque el SARS-CoV y el SARS-CoV-2 usan la ECA2 receptora para ingresar a las células humanas.
en-mt: Previous work on SARS-CoV is being used because SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 use the ACE2 receptor to enter human cells.

sourceString: There are three vaccination strategies being investigated.
targetString: Se están investigando tres estrategias de vacunación.
en-mt: Three vaccination strategies are being investigated.

sourceString: First, researchers aim to build a whole virus vaccine.
targetString: Primero, los investigadores buscan desarrollar una vacuna de virus completo.
en-mt: First, the researchers seek to develop a whole virus vaccine.

sourceString: The use of such a virus, be it inactive or dead, aims to elicit a prompt immune response of the human body to a new infection with COVID-19.
targetString: El uso de dicho virus, sea inactivo o muerto, tiene como objetivo generar una respuesta inmunitaria rápida del cuerpo humano a una infección nueva por el virus de la COVID-19.
en-mt: The use of such a virus, whether inactive or killed, is intended to generate a rapid immune response of the human body to a novel infection by the COVID-19 virus.

sourceString: A second strategy, subunit vaccines, aims to create a vaccine that sensitises the immune system to certain subunits of the virus.
targetString: Una segunda estrategia, vacunas de subunidad, busca crear una vacuna que sensibilice el sistema inmunitario a ciertas subunidades del virus.
en-mt: A second strategy, subunit vaccines, seeks to create a vaccine that sensitizes the immune system to certain subunits of the virus.

sourceString: In the case of SARS-CoV-2, such research focuses on the S-spike protein that helps the virus intrude the ACE2 enzyme receptor.
targetString: En el caso del SARS-CoV-2, dicha investigación se centra en la proteína S que ayuda al virus a meterse en la ECA2 receptora.
en-mt: In the case of SARS-CoV-2, that research focuses on the S protein that helps the virus get into the recipient ACE2.

sourceString: A third strategy is that of the nucleic acid vaccines (DNA or RNA vaccines, a novel technique for creating a vaccination).
targetString: Una tercera estrategia son las vacunas de ácido nucleico (vacunas de ADN o ARN, una técnica nueva para crear vacunas).
en-mt: A third strategy is nucleic acid vaccines (DNA or RNA vaccines, a new technique for creating vaccines).

sourceString: Experimental vaccines from any of these strategies would have to be tested for safety and efficacy.On 16 March 2020, the first clinical trial of a vaccine started with four volunteers in Seattle.
targetString: Las vacunas experimentales de cualquiera de estas estrategias deberían estudiarse para determinar su seguridad y eficacia. El 16 de marzo de 2020, comenzó el primer ensayo clínico de una vacuna con cuatro voluntarios en Seattle.
en-mt: Experimental vaccines from any of these strategies should be studied for safety and efficacy. On March 16, 2020, the first clinical trial of a vaccine began with four volunteers in Seattle.

sourceString: The vaccine contains a harmless genetic code copied from the virus that causes the disease.Antibody dependent enhancement has been suggested as a potential challenge for vaccine development for SARS-COV-2, but this is controversial.
targetString: La vacuna contiene una copia inocua del código genético del virus que causa la enfermedad. Se ha sugerido que la mejora basada en anticuerpos es un desafío potencial para el desarrollo de vacunas contra el SARS-COV-2, pero esto es controversial.
en-mt: The vaccine contains a harmless copy of the genetic code of the virus that causes the disease. Antibody-based enhancement has been suggested as a potential challenge for SARS-COV-2 vaccine development, but this is controversial.

sourceString: There are more than 300 active clinical trials underway as of April 2020.
targetString: A abril de 2020, hay más de 300 ensayos clínicos activos.
en-mt: As of April 2020, there are more than 300 active clinical trials.

sourceString: Seven trials were evaluating already approved treatments for malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.
targetString: Siete ensayos evaluaban tratamientos ya aprobados para el paludismo, incluidos cuatro estudios sobre hidroxicloroquina o cloroquina.
en-mt: Seven trials evaluated already approved treatments for malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.

sourceString: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with nine phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
targetString: Los fármacos antivíricos readaptados constituyen la mayor parte de la investigación china, entre los que se incluyen nueve ensayos en fase III sobre el remdesivir en varios países y que deben presentar informes a fines de abril.
en-mt: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up the bulk of Chinese research, including nine phase III trials of remdesivir in several countries due to report by the end of April.

sourceString: A dynamic review of clinical development for COVID-19 vaccine and drug candidates was in place, as of April 2020.Several existing antiviral medications are being evaluated for treatment of COVID-19, including remdesivir, chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir and lopinavir/ritonavir combined with interferon beta.
targetString: En abril de 2020, estaba en curso una revisión dinámica de desarrollos clínicos sobre la vacuna y posibles fármacos contra la COVID-19. Se evalúan varios medicamentos antivíricos para el tratamiento de la COVID-19, incluidos los siguientes: remdesivir, cloroquina e hidroxicloroquina, lopinavir/ritonavir y lopinavir/ritonavir en combinación con interferón-beta.
en-mt: As of April 2020, a dynamic clinical development review for the COVID-19 vaccine and potential drugs was underway. Several antiviral drugs are being evaluated for the treatment of COVID-19, including: remdesivir, chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir, and lopinavir/ritonavir in combination with interferon-beta.

sourceString: There is tentative evidence for efficacy by remdesivir, as of March 2020.
targetString: A marzo de 2020, existe evidencia tentativa sobre la eficacia del remdesivir.
en-mt: As of March 2020, there is tentative evidence for the efficacy of remdesivir.

sourceString: Clinical improvement was observed in patients treated with compassionate-use remdesivir.
targetString: Se observó mejoría clínica en los pacientes tratados con el uso compasivo del remdesivir.
en-mt: Clinical improvement was observed in patients treated with compassionate use of remdesivir.

sourceString: Phase III clinical trials are being conducted in the US, China and Italy.Chloroquine, previously used to treat malaria, was studied in China in February 2020, with preliminary results.
targetString: Se están realizando ensayos clínicos en fase III en los EE. UU., China e Italia. La cloroquina, que anteriormente se utilizaba para tratar el paludismo, se estudió en China en febrero de 2020. Los resultados obtenidos fueron preliminares.
en-mt: Phase III clinical trials are ongoing in the US, China, and Italy. Chloroquine, previously used to treat malaria, was studied in China in February 2020. The results obtained were preliminary.

sourceString: However, there are calls for peer review of the research.
targetString: No obstante, hay solicitudes de revisiones de pares para la investigación.
en-mt: However, there are requests for peer reviews for the research.

sourceString: Korean and Chinese Health Authorities recommend the use of chloroquine.
targetString: Las autoridades sanitarias de Corea y China recomiendan el uso de la cloroquina.
en-mt: The health authorities of Korea and China recommend the use of chloroquine.

sourceString: However, the Wuhan Institute of Virology, while recommending a daily dose of one gram, notes that twice that dose is highly dangerous and could be lethal.
targetString: Sin embargo, aunque el Instituto de Virología de Wuhan recomienda una dosis diaria de un gramo, señala que el doble de esa dosis es muy peligroso y podría ser letal.
en-mt: However, while the Wuhan Institute of Virology recommends a daily dose of one gram, it notes that twice that dose is very dangerous and could be fatal.

sourceString: On 28 March 2020, the FDA issued an emergency use authorisation for hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine at the discretion of physicians treating people with COVID-19.The Chinese 7th edition guidelines also include interferon, ribavirin or umifenovir for use against COVID-19.
targetString: El 28 de marzo de 2020, la FDA emitió una autorización de uso urgente para la hidroxicloroquina y la cloroquina a discreción de los médicos tratantes de pacientes con COVID-19. La 7.ª edición de las pautas chinas también incluye el uso del interferón, el ribavirin o el umifenovir contra la COVID-19.
en-mt: On March 28, 2020, the FDA issued an emergency use authorization for hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine at the discretion of physicians treating COVID-19 patients. The 7th edition of the Chinese guidelines also includes the use of interferon, ribavirin, or umifenovir against COVID-19.

sourceString: Preliminary data indicate that high doses of ribavirin are necessary to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.
targetString: Los datos preliminares indican que se necesitan dosis altas de ribavirin para inhibir el SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.
en-mt: Preliminary data indicates that high doses of ribavirin are required to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.

sourceString: Nitazoxanide has been recommended for further in vivo study after demonstrating low concentration inhibition of SARS-CoV-2.Studies have demonstrated that initial spike protein priming by transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) is essential for entry of SARS-CoV-2 via interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: Se ha recomendado que se realicen más estudios in vivo de la nitazoxanida, después de determinar que las concentraciones bajas inhiben el SARS-CoV-2. Los estudios han demostrado que el cebado inicial de la proteína S que realiza la serina-proteasa transmembranaria de tipo 2 (TMPRSS2) es esencial para el ingreso del SARS-CoV-2 mediante la interacción con la ECA2 receptora.
en-mt: Further in vivo studies of nitazoxanide have been recommended, after determining that low concentrations inhibit SARS-CoV-2. Studies have shown that the initial priming of the S protein by transmembrane serine protease type 2 (TMPRSS2) is essential for the entry of SARS-CoV-2 through interaction with the ACE2 recipient.

sourceString: The studies of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine with or without azithromycin have major limitations that have prevented the medical community from embracing these therapies without further study.Oseltamivir does not inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro and has no known role in COVID-19 treatment.
targetString: Los estudios de la cloroquina y la hidroxicloroquina con o sin azitromicina tienen limitaciones importantes que evitan que la comunidad médica adopte estos tratamientos sin más estudios. El oseltamivir no inhibe el SARS-CoV-2 in vitro y no tiene una función conocida en el tratamiento de la COVID-19.
en-mt: Studies of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine with or without azithromycin have important limitations that prevent the medical community from adopting these treatments without further study. Oseltamivir does not inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro and has no known role in the treatment of COVID-19.

sourceString: Cytokine storm can be a complication in the later stages of severe COVID-19.
targetString: La liberación de citocinas puede ser una complicación de las últimas etapas de la COVID-19 grave.
en-mt: Cytokine release may be a complication of late-stage severe COVID-19.

sourceString: There is evidence that hydroxychloroquine may have anti-cytokine storm properties.Tocilizumab has been included in treatment guidelines by China's National Health Commission after a small study was completed.
targetString: Existe evidencia de que la hidroxicloroquina puede tener propiedades que evitan la liberación de citocinas. La Comisión Nacional de Salud de China incluyó el tocilizumab en las pautas de tratamiento después de la compleción de un estudio pequeño.
en-mt: There is evidence that hydroxychloroquine may have properties that prevent cytokine release. The National Health Commission of China included tocilizumab in treatment guidelines after the completion of a small study.

sourceString: It is undergoing a phase 2 non randomised test at the national level in Italy after showing positive results in people with severe disease.
targetString: Se encuentra en una prueba nacional no aleatorizada en fase II en Italia después de observar resultados positivos en personas con la enfermedad grave.
en-mt: It is in a phase II nonrandomized national trial in Italy after seeing positive results in people with severe disease.

sourceString: Combined with a serum ferritin blood test to identify cytokine storms, it is meant to counter such developments, which are thought to be the cause of death in some affected people.
targetString: Se espera que, en combinación con un análisis de sangre de ferritina sérica para identificar las liberaciones de citocina, contrarreste dichos efectos, que se cree son la causa de muerte de algunas personas infectadas.
en-mt: Combined with a serum ferritin blood test to identify cytokine releases, it is hoped that it will counteract these effects, which are thought to be the cause of death in some infected people.

sourceString: The interleukin-6 receptor antagonist was approved by the FDA based on retrospective case studies for treatment of steroid refractory cytokine release syndrome induced by a different cause, CAR T cell therapy, in 2017.
targetString: La FDA aprobó el antagonista del receptor de la interleucina-6 con base en casos pasados para el tratamiento del síndrome de liberación de citocina resistente a los esteroides inducido por otra causa, el tratamiento de los linfocitos T-CAR T, en el 2017.
en-mt: The FDA approved the interleukin-6 receptor antagonist based on past cases for the treatment of steroid-resistant cytokine release syndrome induced by another cause, the treatment of T-CAR T cells, in 2017.

sourceString: To date, there is no randomised, controlled evidence that tocilizumab is an efficacious treatment for CRS.
targetString: Hasta la fecha, no existe evidencia controlada no aleatorizada de que el tocilizumab sea un tratamiento eficaz para el CRS.
en-mt: To date, there is no nonrandomized controlled evidence that tocilizumab is an effective treatment for CRS.

sourceString: Transferring purified and concentrated antibodies produced by the immune systems of those who have recovered from COVID-19 to people who need them is being investigated as a non-vaccine method of passive immunisation.
targetString: Se está investigando la transferencia de anticuerpos purificados y concentrados producidos por el sistema inmunitario de quienes se han recobrado de la COVID-19 a personas que los necesitan como un método de inmunización pasiva sin vacunas.
en-mt: The transfer of purified and concentrated antibodies produced by the immune systems of those who have recovered from COVID-19 to people in need as a method of passive immunization without vaccines is being investigated.

sourceString: This strategy was tried for SARS with inconclusive results.
targetString: Esta estrategia se probó con el SRAG con resultados no concluyentes.
en-mt: This strategy was tested with the SARS with inconclusive results.

sourceString: Viral neutralisation is the anticipated mechanism of action by which passive antibody therapy can mediate defence against SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: La neutralización vírica es el mecanismo de acción esperado mediante el cual un tratamiento pasivo con anticuerpos puede defender contra el SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Viral neutralization is the expected mechanism of action by which a passive antibody treatment can defend against SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Other mechanisms however, such as antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity and/or phagocytosis, may be possible.
targetString: Sin embargo, otros mecanismos son posibles, como la citotoxicidad celular dependiente de anticuerpos o la fagocitosis.
en-mt: However, other mechanisms are possible, such as antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity or phagocytosis.

sourceString: Other forms of passive antibody therapy, for example, using manufactured monoclonal antibodies, are in development.
targetString: Se están desarrollando otras formas de tratamiento pasivo con anticuerpos, por ejemplo, usando anticuerpos monoclonales fabricados.
en-mt: Other forms of passive antibody treatment are being developed, for example, using manufactured monoclonal antibodies.

sourceString: Production of convalescent serum, which consists of the liquid portion of the blood from recovered patients and contains antibodies specific to this virus, could be increased for quicker deployment.
targetString: La producción de suero de convaleciente, que consta de la parte líquida de la sangre de pacientes recuperados y contiene anticuerpos específicos contra este virus, se podría aumentar para lograr una distribución más rápida.
en-mt: The production of convalescent serum, which consists of the liquid part of the blood of recovered patients and contains specific antibodies against this virus, could be increased to achieve a more rapid distribution.

sourceString: Coronavirus diseases, a group of closely related syndromes
targetString: Enfermedades por coronavirus, un grupo de síndromes estrechamente relacionados
en-mt: Coronavirus diseases, a group of closely related syndromes

sourceString: Li Wenliang, a doctor at Central Hospital of Wuhan, who later contracted and died of COVID-19 after raising awareness of the spread of the virus.
targetString: Li Wenliang, médico en el Hospital Central de Wuhan, quien posteriormente murió por la COVID-19 después de generar conciencia sobre la propagación del virus.
en-mt: Li Wenliang, a doctor at Wuhan Central Hospital, who later died of COVID-19 after raising awareness about the spread of the virus.
